review_text: I'm really trying to give it a 2.5 but there wasn't an option.  Let me start with our arrival.  Staff was friendly, place is clean, covid rules enforced.  Definitely on point (I'm obviously not big on the covid thing since I'm in Vegas, but nice to see they were following orders from the government) and appreciative to see it.  Bags were delivered to our room within 10 minutes of us calling on them so we were off to a good start.  I'll share a quick video of the room since I don't remember the name, but the room was dope, huge patio with a TV and a Vegas view that if you're only visiting here once, I'd recommend one of these rooms.  You pretty much get it all.  Those are all the upsides.  Downside, first night; we get back late and being in Vegas, non cigarette smokers, and myself personally being an asthmatic, we couldn't wait for the shower.  Also, being as how I drank because it was my birthday, I assumed a shower and water weren't something I'd have to worry about but no water at all.  Upon calling the front desk, we were told there is nothing they could do and to take all the water in the fridge and at that point, we knew the hotel was most likely struggling so made the best of it.  Well that didn't work either.  On everything at 1AM the sounds of pipes clanging started.  Even though I drank for my birthday, it was damn near impossible to sleep.  We called the desk again and they informed us there is nothing they can do, so we took it and slept as much as we could and just turned some TV on loud to try and diffuse the noise.  Well day 2 (day after my sleepless birthday) we went to the event we came into town for, luckily showered, and had a good time after considering the room was definitely set up to have company.  Again, although the room has obviously been weathered over the years, it shows nice, and it's large balcony area is amazing and accommodating.  Well, when everyone left, guess what happened again?  THE NOISE.  I know in the real world we are fortunate enough to be able to afford spaces like these, and I should be thankful, but honestly even though the room was only $900 a night, I feel like we should at least get some sleep because really that's part of renting a space that is at a place like the MGM right?  Well the people were very nice on the phone, but we were met with answers like "We are short staffed" and then again at about 3:30AM that it might no be pipes but something blowing in the wind on the unit above us but they didn't have anyone who could go up to look.  Well 5 calls in, we gave up.  Tired as we could be we just grabbed coffee and made the best of it knowing MGM has always taken care of our parents when they brought us here growing up, and knowing we called over 8 times trying to resolve the situation that maybe we'd be comped or something....... well........ NONE OF THAT.  Had this been me 10 years back:  I probably would've lost my shit and made a scene, but now, I'm just going to make sure y'all see this warning.  MGM might be struggling, but we were treated like nobodies because maybe we didn't press the issue.  Upon telling the guy on checkout, we were given a free Red Bull.  This post isn't about anything other then warning you, MGM isn't back thru this covid thing enough to care if the rooms are going to suit your needs.  They are so broken that if there happens to be an issue, they don't have the time or manpower to fix it, and probably not the money to anyways.  I usually don't add up what I do or pay when I go to places, but we easily spent 6-7K on our 2 day trip at MGM and their restaurants (Tom's Steakhouse and the Japanese Waygu and the Ribs are a must)  and I am sad I ever bothered.  The fact thay we were treated like nobodies was comical, but sad at the same time knowing the people we were asking for help, literally couldn't do anything about it.

I want to give a special shout out to the Hotel Manager's Jake & Ryan. On 2 occasions I was not happy with the room that was assigned during my contactless check in. Jake assistd me in Jan. & Ryanassisted in April. They both went above and beyond to resolve the issue. That is what I call excellent customer service. Room was clean and view is more than I can ask for. Room service was also pleasant. Thank you again. Hope to visit real soon.

If I could give this "resort" no stars I would. The first issue was that the room they gave us wasn't what we booked plus it was dirty. After notifying the hotel personnel of this, we were told that there wasn't much they could do about the room mixup since they were booked up. They could only get us the same type of room, since that's all they had available at the time, but it would take an hour to clean. The "resort fee" is a scam because nothing seemed to be operable but the casino, even though they mention so many amenities. Valet, the pool, room service wasn't available at any time. The speaker on the alarm clock didn't even work. The next day I wanted to do an early check out because of the terrible experience and was told I would be charged extra...DO NOT waste your time!!

The MGM has been a favorite when staying in Vegas for years! Hubs & I honeymooned here back in 2014. We just finally made it back a couple weeks ago. Woo! We traveled with a big group, but most of us had rooms close together. My parents booked a strip view, so they were up a different bank of elevators. This was kind of a pain, since my kids were back and forth so much! If you're in a group I recommend all similar rooms and ask for closer. With the requirement for a key to access the correct elevators it just adds some complications. Covid protocol was really solid. Security in the elevator area to enforce masks, as well as throughout the casino. You can smoke, eat, or drink with it off, but then pull it back up after each drink. We reserved chairs at the pool, which I HIGHLY recommend you do. Especially while capacity limits are lower. It was not well marked where to go to get to the middle of the river, but after walking back and forth past a guy posted up at a gate (he didn't look like an employee or I would have asked sooner!) I finally made it. Ha! We floated the lazy river and really enjoyed having a spot to leave our stuff or relax. Masks are not required while in the pool, walking to/from the pool, eating, or drinking. You can purchase tubes for $20-$25 each. They do refill them for free if you bring them back. One of ours popped after day 1, so they replaced it. We had really great service both days too! The server came around frequently and quickly brought menus to us. Drinks were all good, but very expensive. Food was perfect pool food for the kids and grown kids alike! It was windy while we were there, so the umbrellas had to stay down. I still enjoy the MGM, but having the monorail down made it SO FAR from everything else. The strip just past it (toward Planet Hollywood) has become really different... it felt more run down than any of us had seen in the past. A lot of the elevators to get to and from the skywalks were broke down, which was really frustrating with a stroller and littles.

Worst hotel experience of my life.My key stopped working and my dad is in the room sleeping, and the front desk can't help me because the room isn't in my name.Two hours later I get him to come down and his key isn't working either, so we have to wait at the front desk.We finally get up to the room and the adjacent room is smoking weed, filling up our room with the smell for the entire night.I'm currently in my room listening to my neighbors music because the doors connecting the room don't have any soundproofing.We're leaving a day early.

I use to stay here all the time, definitely will stay elsewhere. I heard this hotel got new owners- and it definitely shows. This hotel gets 1 star because of Losers bar being so fun... I know you have to add it least 1. Rooms: smell like smoke and very outdated- no microwave, coffee or mini fridge anymore. All the views are horrible, NO ROOM SERVICE until 2pm... huh? Rooms were small, the digital key was horrible. Now your key only works on your floor so if you have friends on other areas of the hotel you cannot meet up.POOL: first off- closing a pool at 4pm is just not okay. we rented chairs because we heard of this mess- during this time, if they reach capacity you can't get into the area if you don't pay to rent a chair. We tried to get in on other days and the waitlist was 300-400 people! Even the staff up front would lie and say oh you're next in (lies). We waited 3 hours and never got in. I was happy when we booked chairs months in advance they were $20 a day but then went up too $100 for a chair. And in the lazy river you have to move around, but can sit together outside the pool just not group in the pool- huh??Food: the food court here was horrible! It use to be good- but now only 3-5 horrible food options are open and they close at 8. This place has gone downhill and I will never stay here again. The lazy river is something we enjoyed years ago, but not anymore- I will spend my money elsewhere.

Stay far from this Sh$$ Ho$$ worst service in the world and there guest don't even get into the pool . 1star is tooo much all the manages from the front desk to the pool are a joke and memorized the same line. I'm so disappointed I'm shaking . 4hrs of this is too much. If you ain't rich or a millionaire don't bother because they all treat you like trash here . I make my living in hospitality and this is disgusting. They should tell all there guest they will not be able to get into the pool at Check in . They have aloe to learn in this place including secret shoppers to see how there staff is treating there guest .

SMOKE FREE!!  Do yourself a favor and enjoy yourself here!Everywhere else is foggy with disgusting cigarette and marijuana smoke except for this amazing, spacious, clean resort / casino.You can game peacefully without the risk of inhaling an ungodly amount of secondhand smoke. Your food tastes better. Your hair, clothes and face mask don't reek when you've walked through the gaming floor.It's WONDERFUL!I recommend you enjoy *Emeril*'s restaurant or even catch *David Copperfield*'s magic show here.The staff are friendly and helpful. And this environment just makes everyone feel better.

Had the best time at the Cabana pool and Lazy River. Byron took care of us and was super attentive. He is the reason I'll be going back and renting a cabana in the future! Awesome service and great vibe. Adults and kids had a fantastic time! Room was decent. It had a fridge but with mini bar you have to pay for. No microwave or coffee pot but it's Covid right now. All in all we had a great time. Room was clean and amenities in order

So disappointed with this stay. Despite Covid restrictions the staff is clearly not interested in speaking with "guests". Concierge experience was terrible. On hold for 20+ minutes with front desk. The rotting dead bird outside the room window is a little less than desired as is the rotting banana pieces under the desk. Bummer. Downtown was cool though.

Good People at MGM Grand. I have been a fairly a frequent visitor at MGM Grand in last 10 years.  Coming out of COVID locked down. I visited MGM Grand and stayed at their Stay Well rooms.   All very nice and I used the digital app check in and got my room assignment on my phone and use my phone as key to access my room.  All worked flawlessly.  In my many years as adult, I never lost my wallet.  I accidentally did this time.  I was panicking. As it is painful trying to get credit cards and ID replaced.  I called the lost and found desk.  They had my wallet.  It turns out the an employee turn it in as I must had dropped it when parking my car in the parking garage.  I got my wallet back, all the cards intact and surprisingly all the money was in it.   I want to thank the nameless employee who turn it in and most importantly is that there are still good people out there.

When we arrive to check in at 11:00pm, we are told that they downgraded us from the SPA room with a King size bed to a regular room with 2 Queen size beds because they were having a water problem with our room. They didn't call or email or notify us in anyway that they were doing this to give us an opportunity to find a different hotel until we were there to check in. We specifically chose the SPA room at MGM for the Jacuzzi Hot Tub after looking at several other hotels. We had to ask them to try and find a room with a King bed because it was just my fiancee and myself. They offered to refund the difference from the new room, but that didn't make the experience there any better.  After all of that , there was a huge line to use the elevators just to get up to the floor the room was on. There was a line that was at least 5 to 10 minutes long that we had to wait in every time we wanted to leave or access our room! And, I wouldn't have cared if the wait was due to Covid-19 elevator spacing, but that was not the case! Each elevator was jam packed because the wait was so long, no one wanted to miss their chance to get to their room. Not staying here again.

I love going to Vegas and have stayed in many different Hotels. I must say the MGM without reserve was hands down the worst experience I have had to date. And, although they will blame it on Covid, I do not buy the excuse.Like many, the reason I chose this hotel (my fav was not open yet) is because the pool complex is supposedly kid friendly. They endlessly currently advertise "Pool season open", come enjoy! It wasn't just that you had to line up 1.5 hours before opening to MAYBE get in, but hopefully get on the waiting list to get in. But, even after you spend upwards of $600 on a 2 seater chaise lounge, you have to line up inside the pool area for at least 30 more minutes to get your POD and then MAYBE get into the lazy river pool, if they are not at capacity with ALL the other people they conned into paying extra for chairs and cabanas. ANd, if you wait until the line goes down, actually you can't because if you don't show up and wait in line before 11am, they sell your cabana to someone else and keep your money.Yes, Covid regulations make it hard but many places that are usually crowed have online reservation systems that let guests book time slots, that are respectful and considerate to the public.Not this greedy and horribly run hotel. The treat you like crap, actually worse. And even paying a lot extra doesn't help. We finally demanded our money back and made a different plan for the day. Never got to enjoy the pool at all.This will DEFINITELY be our first and last visit to this dump.

So we booked this hotel because of the pool complex... unfortunately we barely got to see the pools because it was always at capacity and we spent most of the time waiting around.  The casino smells terrible, the walls are thin (I could hear people vomiting all night long from the rooms next door), the towels are paper thin and scratchy. We even saw what looked like nasty diarrhea on the floor near the elevator and the hallway to our room smelled like someone died! Almost everything was closed or if it was open, the lines were ridiculous. Tons of people walk around without masks despite signs being posted everywhere that masks are required.  They have a gaming arcade area but no one under 13 is allowed in there... also another reason why we picked this hotel... we paid $39 a day for a resort fee but never got any use of it. I'm very disappointed on our stay here. This place is a dump! Don't be fooled by the nice lobby... once you get up to your room, you will wish you stayed somewhere else.

Terrible experience and will never come back. Apparently the room was flooded and we had to be relocated to the signature. They did not inform us ahead of time of this change. The signature was a 15 min walk away and we had a lot of luggage. The check out system could not find our reservation and we had to wait in line with all the check in guest to check out. The pools were reservation only but they never told us of this. I booked this hotel to use the pool and if there was a reservation system in place, it should have been notified to booking guest. Lastly pillows are extremely soft and provide no support. The shower pressure was extremely weak.

The danger of staying at a hotel with different women over the years can be awkward. The wife inevitably catches on when you bring up past reminiscences, and it wasn't one she was part of. So, it's best to switch hotels as you cycle through women. That's my tip for the day.My first stay here was back during the Wizard of Oz days, when the big cartoon Lion head was the facade of the hotel. It registered a 12 on the gaudiness scale, but I miss it!! And Dorothy's shoes were stolen from that little Oz diorama up front. That era was short lived. Stayed here a few other times, and even saw the greatest stand-up comedian of all time, George Carlin, a year or so before he went on to the Comedy Club in the Sky. And you'll say it's crazy talk, but they used to have a theme park out back!! Only about four rides. Can't remember which woman I was with when I went that time. Know it wasn't the wife so I don't bring it up. I'm gaining wisdom in my old age!!I do know one time when I stayed with my wife, we dined at Rainforest Cafe, which used to be here. She wore one of her ao dai, which is why I remember. (Yes, mail order bride. Postage was.... excessive!)It's a great hotel for many reasons, but for me it doesn't quite have a defined personality. But, it has great restaurants, shows, etc, etc....  It's always worth a visit when in town for a few days, or you could of course just stay here. Just keep track of who you're with!!
Awful David Copperfield show. Do not go! Total fraud with a animatronic alien. He is no longer a magician or illusionist but rather a fraud. Stupid show!!DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY!!!

Huge Hotel. In Las Vegas.  This is billed as a hotel with a Tesla charger.  Problem is there's only one Tesla Charger.  Don't waste your time trying to use is because in my case a gas engine work truck was parked for two days in the charger stall.  Additionally with thousands of customers, good luck finding the charger free.

The rooms are very old and much updating is needed.  Two of the lamps worked for one day but needed to be replaced becsuse the outlet malfunctioning.  Other outlets in the room needed to be changed because whatever i plugged in there kept falling out.  The water pressure sucked no matter if i tried to adjust it and it was very hard to get the temperature of the water right in the tub faucet.  It was either too cold or too hot which is very dangerous when you have small kids.  The service guy came in a timely manner.  They use digital keys which is run by your bluetooth on your phone. You need it to access your room and the elevator.  It sucked for me because i keep loosing reception in the elevator.  Bell service sucked too because they close some time i the night and reopen at 7am. The pools only stays open until 5pm and lazy river closes at 4p. Other pools on the strip stays open later but you have to stay there as a guest due to covid.  There is a wait list for the pools. They let 900 people in and then the wait list opens up. I got there 1 hr after it opened which was 10am and had to wait on the wait list for 3 hours before i was called.  Save your text because  my name didn't show up on their list even though i received a text. You have 15 mins after you received you text to show up or they will reject you.  Plus there's no in's or outs.  The only way to get in's and outs and not wait in a line is to reserve a cabana or day bed which starts at $250 (up to 6 people).  The bottle of waterin the room  is $16!! The same bottle of water downstairs in the store was $7!!  Buy you water at Walmart which is 10 mins from the strip or the ABC store in the mall of planet Hollywood which is $1 bottle.Overall the shops and malls on the strip closed at 7p.  Restaurants closes early.  Most needs reservations.   I know it's a pandemic. It's very important to be safe but I wish I knew ahead of time to plan accordingly. Overall most stores on the strip

So incredibly disappointing! We were so excited to stay here as we love taking family trips to Vegas and my son has been wanting to stay here and we love many other mgm properties! We were always a little hesitant because of all the reviews we've read but we finally decided to stay here and honestly was so incredibly let down! We did online check in before we arrived so didn't deal with any of that but when we got the the actual room we were so incredibly bummed the room just felt so dirty! Bathroom had rust and stains everywhere the lamp next to the bed looked like it had blood stains on the bottom chair at the desk was ripped and two small lounge chairs just felt dirty!  Let's not even talk about the fact that we had random people knocking on our door between the hours of 2-4 when our son is trying to sleep! We went to explore the hotel and every worker we encountered was not friendly what so ever! Definitely will not be coming back especially for the price they wanna charge for a hotel they aren't doing a good job at maintaining! Would say the pool is the only bonus but every lifeguard you swim by just gives you dirty looks definitely didn't make the trip enjoyable!

Worst hotel/casino ever!!!! After making a reservation ahead of time they say they gave our room away because of the time we got there 11pm. We were like ok now what? They said we can give you a handicapped room we said no because what's the point of a reservation if you don't get what you paid for after speaking with them back and forth there was a room available "all of sudden". We go to our room which by the way it was the exact Suite that we had reserved. My friends and I were so tired all we wanted to do was sleep. We pull the couch out and see back dots and one sheet so I pulled a sheet off of my bed to give to them and it had red blood stains on the. Disgusting!!!!! After trying to reach housekeeping for 30mins we went downstairs to complain. Once again supposedly there are no rooms available it's 1am already. Once again we're going back and forth they call a manager and he says oh wait looks like a family just canceled they're room you guys can take it. I call BS. Whatever we get to the new room and call about getting more sheets and towels and no answer. We called friend Saturday morning for room service and No Answer! We call to get help from the bell desk NO answer! We call to check out! Mo answer! Honestly worst customer service and hotel I have ever stayed in. They tried to accommodate us by giving us $100 in room service credit and that's it. After staying here for 3 nights it was not worth the stay so never again!!! Don't recommend at all. If only they could of helped us out in another way or given us better service I would of had something good to say.
Not so happy about the room I have. It's so old and seems not maintained well. For the price I should have gone somewhere else.

Poor customer service. I was given room keys that opened a occupied room. Went back to the lobby and was disrespected by JO twice. Instead of apologising for giving me a room that was already assigned to somebody...JO gave me an attitude and was telling me to stay six feet away when In fact he was like close to me. I don't know why MGM hired him when he can't be professional and can't handle stress. I tried calling the hotel manager but he hasn't answered or has given me a call back. Tells you how poor their customer service is. I checked in on 3/19/2021 at night  (11:30-12:00) see your camera footage If you don't believe me MGM.

Majority of the restaurants in mgm were closed. Our room was nice and appeared to be clean. I didn't like how they charged a $300 deposit fee without telling me prior to booking. Also, if you use the app you can check in much faster (and earlier) and skip the LONG line. The app notified me that my room was ready at 11:00am, I think the normal check in time is around 3:00pm. It was very easy and quick to check out from my phone. I was able to get a digital room key on my phone just in case I lost the physical key. Mgm is not in the center of the strip, it is kind of at the end. I would research what placed you would like to visit on the strip and pick a central hotel. We did a lot of walking the first few days then found out about the Dune bus, a bus that runs up and down the strip.

Let me start by saying that even a one star rating is way too generous for this property and it's horrible staff. Look at the pictures I posted. That was the bathroom of a " clean" room they gave us. Obviously they changed our room but after the first day we didn't have any running water. We couldn't shower or flush the toilet, not to mention we couldn't wash our hands. It was horrible. They didn't do anything other than give us a 44$ discount. Wow! And they did so rudely and mean. Our entire experience was a waste of time and money. Will never go back again. They need to train their staff better. I never had front desk people be so rude at check in. No welcomes were said, no apologies were given and if you complained they would argue back. Just WOW! Hope someone in higher management would see this review and implement some changes. It's sad to see a grand property like that go down like this. What a shame. Will never set foot in this place ever again! We had a couple of 100$ chips that we rather not cash and just left.

TL;DR Customer service was terrible for what you pay a night for the room, don't expect any credits/refunds if you book through a third party; you might get stuck in an elevator, you might not ever get an elevator. Housekeeping will come to your room in the middle of the night 6 hours after you've asked for your sheets to be changed because they were dirty when you checked in. I really wish I could give them less than one star. I'll get the easy part out of the way. The pros for this hotel are that it is on the strip and on the Saturday night that we stayed there they had complimentary parking.This stay was terrible. We checked in at about 9pm after driving in from Los Angeles. They have a large parking garage but you have to lug all of your stuff all the way through the casino to get to the front desk. If they had luggage carts I wasn't able to locate one. Check in was pretty quick and easy. We get up to our room and drop our bags. First thing I always do is check the beds to make sure they're clean and make sure that we have enough towels for everyone. One bed was fine but the other had holes in the sheets and there was a what looked like buggers on one of the pillows. I called down to the front desk and they said they would send someone up to change the bedding right away. We started getting ready to head out to eat. After about 30 minutes nobody came so we left to get food and walk the strip. We assumed that they would come while we were out. We got back in at about 1am and stopped at the front desk for towels because I forgot to ask for them on my initial call. I didn't ask about the sheets because I just assumed they had already been changed. We get up to the room and the sheets were still dirty. I called the front desk a few times and nobody answered. The towels arrived a few minutes after we requested them, we showered and went to bed. We decided to put the dirty pillow on the floor and sleep on the sheets because even though they had holes in them, they appeared to be clean. At around 2:15am the front desk calls and says that housekeeping is at the door and is ready to change our sheets. AT 2 IN THE MORNING. I decline because I'm not waking up my kids to get the sheets changed almost 6 hours after I initially made the request. In the morning we are waiting for the elevator so we can head down and check out. There are 6 elevators on this wing and 3 aren't working. You can hear them ding but the doors don't open. The other 3 will only let you go up. 2 of us get on one elevator and 2 of us catch the next one. The elevator goes up and stops on every floor on the way and then does the same thing on the way back down. It even stopped on a floor that didn't have an access button in our elevator. After that fiasco I stand in line to check out. I explain to the front desk lady what happened and ask how they can make it right. She goes and talks to her manager. They claim they can't discount the room because I booked through a third party but they waive the resort fee and they offer us a $50 dining credit. I'm not happy about not being able to adjust the room fee but ok. We ask where can a family of 4 eat in the casino for $50 or less and they say there are a couple places. We go to the cheapest restaurant in the casino and the meals are still about $20pp. We opted for Starbucks because that HAS to feed 4 people for less than $50 right...? WRONG! We end up about $9 over. I head back up to the front desk to ask for the rest of the breakfast to be comped and the lady that helped me this time says I shouldn't ask for anything else and I should be happy with what I've already been given...WHAT!? I'm in the twilight zone now. We go back and forth and she eventually gets her manager after she said that my request was declined. There was some kind of miscommunication between the employee and the manager because the manager thought I was asking for an additional $59 instead of just the $9. They ended up comping the rest of the breakfast and we left. The quality of the customer service in this hotel/resort is really lacking and I will never recommend that anyone stay here or spend any money at this hotel.

Lets start with commending MGM for doing their part in keeping their guest covid safe, many hand washing stations, signs encouraging distancing, keyless entry to my suite. I applaud that! The bellman Martin and Herb for taking my bags up and back down to the lobby, thank for your professionalism. To the gracious, mature curly blonde hair cocktails waitress on late March 20, Saturday into Sunday AM (didn't get her name), we had a pleasant conversation and made each other laugh, memorable, thank you. To the housekeeper (slim Jamaican man I believe) he came to change the aroma therapy diffuser, thank you as well.Now overall the property has done fairly good job of keeping up the modern look. Casino games were all there to enjoy. I definitely feel I have graduated to next level of MLife properties, as I feel this property is quickly falling back with its sister property Excalibur and Luxor which I would never stay at again.The clientele at MGM is tough to watch, I witnessed a family with two toddlers on the casino floor in a red wagon at 1130pm, frat boy walking around in a white bathrobe, gangster types, guests dressed in gym/basketball shorts and dirty T-shirts, a lot of loitering around slots. Now, I get it,  hotels are hurting financially and cannot discriminate. But they could have a dress code at minimum on casino floor. Dressing with class needs to be restored in LV, most of clientele at MGM did not appear to care, in my view. Maybe depends on the weekend events. Overall I understand that's not MGM's job to police.We stayed in the Stay Well Marquee Suite on 15 floor (mountain facing/airport), this was an absolute refuge from the craziness of the casino and other guests. We hung out in this comfortable, modern suite, view of the mountains, watched sunrise come over the mountain range at 630am, it was awesome! You see the whole airport but do not hear any airplane noise. It was fabulous! From my room there is partial view of the Strip. You can see video reviews of this suite online. The only difference is ours had a pool table. Cues included, some missing tips. Not sure if all Stay Well Marquee Suites have that.Few issues, one was with aroma therapy "Ascent" diffuser, I barely, if at all,  could smell the scent even after the housekeeping changed the cartridge. I'm big on aroma therapy and was looking forward to that experience. Another small issue the bathtub had no plug so I could not soak. Last you have to bring an aux jack connection to play you music through their stereo speakers (there was one for sale in the room), I was not aware of that prior to arrival. Remember this is a big hotel so, I understand their probably not fully staffed at this time, so when I called front desk, housekeeping, bell stand, there was a longer than normal hold times when I called from the suite room phone.Overall the room was a haven, curtains opened and closed with push of a button. 4 TVs, plenty of comfortable seating. Bed and pillows were top notch, had good sleep all three nights! Full stock fridge, but we brought our own drinks and snacks (esp with $18 bottles of water, no joke). Stay Well air filter was fantastic and I felt it worked well, loved that! Three port stations, one in each bedroom and one in the living room part of suite. They gave us antibac and masks, but we brought our own, but loved the touch. "Energizing light" and Vitamin D diffuser in shower both were a pleasant feature. Robes were plush! Bvlgari products in the bathrooms, quality bathroom products. Keyless entry onto elevator and front door of suite from Mlife app.If you're an MGM fan, definitely hit this room up, it's worth the money, especially if you want to watch sporting events privately. There was two of us we each had a room. The cliental is not the MGM's fault, but I think it's time to upgrade my hotel experience next time. Most likely will stay within the Mlife properties. Have a great LV trip!

Worst hotel in Vegas. Had to change rooms 3 times. Filtration room, they gave us keys. We got to the room and there is clothes everywhere and someone in the shower. We closed the door and walked back to the front desk. The manager laughed and gave me the second room. We got there and the room was not clean. There was open wine bottles and trash everywhere. Third room we walked into a cloud of weed and cigarette smell. Real bad. Finally we got a room that was normal. But the hallway leading to the room smelled like a dead body. I reported the smell to the staff and they just said it is because the building is old. The room felt like traveling to 1985. The bed was like sleeping on a rock. The hotel management and staff is rude and unwilling to make anyone feel welcome. Not kids friendly. We will never make the mistake of booking here ever again.

So the casino was nice and clean. The rooms were nice. And maid service was prompt. We had 3 rooms, one room did not have hot water. The front desk had to be called 2x, and the second time they were short and rude and refused to help because we didn't want to give them our credit card verification on the phone. We called from our room.Tried to get answers on my bill and they told me to go to the players club. After I stood in a 30 minute line for the front desk. The line to the players club was long, and I wanted food. So I went to Wolfgang Pucks restaurant in the casino while I was trying to call. Great food. VERY POOR SERVICE. I stayed on hold for the players club for over 45 minutes, when they did answer, they said they had to send me to VIP. BUT it would be another 30 minute wait. I said no thank you. So almost 1.5 hours waiting, and got no answers. I know most wait staff hate to bother someone on the phone, and I hate to be that person. So I put the phone on speaker and set it to the side. Still no service. I finally flagged someone down. 9rdered my drinks. It had been over 15 minutes just to put in my drink order.  Had to flag server down again to give my food order. Server never came to the table willingly. Paid, and left.

I was very impressed with this MGM property. I've heard mixed reviews but we decided to try it out for a staycation. I've been coming to the casino for over a decade and to be honest it frustrated me. I ALWAYS got lost lol. With that being said this is an iconic Las Vegas hotel. A little ways from center strip but it is walkable for most people. With tons of food options and a HUGE casino you really don't have to leave, if your a millionaire. The nice thing is you have some cheaper food options just an Uber ride away. The room was very clean and spacious, better than NY NY. I think the number one reason to stay at MGM Grand is the pool area. It was themed well and there was plenty of space. It seemed very slow for a Sunday but that wasn't a bad thing! We scored a spot right along the lazy river which is AMAZING. The lazy river is extra lazy, very very slow, BUT it was wonderful. I highly recommend bringing your own intertube however you can purchase them on property. It was very uncomfortable walking the lazy river for 3 hours... We ordered lunch and beers. $80 dollars for steak nachos and 6 beers. Would have been the same price in the casino MINUS the Nachos. Overall this may be my second favorite MGM property pool. Mandalay first, this one did not disappoint though. The lazy river is large and you can pull up a chair right alongside it. You are not allowed to be stationary in the river, you have to keep moving. They are sort of on your ass about everything here. It was annoying but I know these people are just doing there jobs. Overall it was a great experience. If you have the chance to stay at MGM Grand do so and use the pool!

Well I won a parlay and won a straight up bet at MGMs sports book and the kiosk made it invalid. We went and talked to the manager and the managers manager which they admitted that kiosk has been having issues and that all the kiosks "are terrible and have issues all the time. they aren't very accurate" -floor manager at MGM. Lost out on $4500 due to they machines not properly functioning they just gave us our money back.  Also some of the workers called us "assholes, dumbasses, and said to get out bc we were pieces of shit" -Chuck at MGM

The Spa is a joke! They charge $28 service fee when you can't use the facilities. They have you sit in a waiting room on uncomfortable benches with your robe and they grab you before your massage. For a $140 massage it came to $168 with fees and you still have to tip your masseuse.

What's so grand about this place? The fact that after a 5 hour flight you enter a room at 2am with no running water and concierge doesn't have the courtesy to say hey by the way you do not have running water to take a shower or wash your hands. We're in contact precautions due to covid and other viruses lurking around. Why would this be not an immediate conversation? How is this safe? After using the bathroom and trying to flush was it realized that there is no water. Did they make any accommodations??? NO. Change to another area of the hotel with running water? NO. Did we ask. YES. They were slow checking in. Even slower checking out. Rooms are very dated for such a prestigious hotel. I had a better room in Atlanta City versus this place. Safety was there as you needed a key fob to get in the elevators. Not staying here again. Not recommending this place. BTW this was my first time in Vegas.

This was our first time traveling in a year because of COVID . Just want to say we had a great time staying here and felt very safe ,as we constantly seen employees cleaning . Have lived in California my whole life and have never been to Vegas. I will definitely be back and stay here.

The Famous MGM Grand, we checked in on Monday Night please be advice that anything you speak to management you write down name and position, as soon as we checked in, Hotel key would not work, we call and we were told someone would come and open our door No one showed up, went to front desk and was receive with attitude, when I asked to speak to the manager on shift Monday around 8:30pm the manager remove apparently the resort fees, when checking comes to be that was not done, so this is my problem NO COMMUNICATION, YOU just want people to come and not take responsibilities or a sense of pride in your work.   Checking out time comes and Im told by security to please stand here and you can speak to the manager, waited there nothing, approach some one and Katherine manager tells me that she has 2 people a head and that I need to make the line in the time that I was there she never spoke to NO one at all. This is simple if you only have ONE manager on shift in this BIG MGM Grand, you are over work and this place soon will be a big pile of crap.NEVER AGAIN I WILL STAY HERE, one advice.They have an app, we did not know you have a key on your phone, we did not know that.There was a Tampon in a room NO FREAKING ACKNOWLEDGMENT, so you actually DON'T CARE.

I had a horrible experience at the MGM and will follow up with a detailed letter to the organization, however will share some of my concerns here:I checked in via self-check at the kiosk, using the application.  I went to my room to work until my scheduled dinner that evening.  I ordered room service a flatbread pizza and cranberry juice-the service was fantastic on the telephone and at delivery.I was on a work call, on the bed not completely dressed when there was a loud, vigorous knock at the door and an immediate opening of the door.  Hollered, " Hey, hello, I am in here who is there?"  A woman's voice responded, "Room check, I am checking the room."  I said, "What?! I am in here!"  I was so caught off guard and in shock.  Why was that person in my room, was she coming to commit a crime, steal belongings?  I just didn't understand the purpose.  I called the front desk and advised of the situation and the person who answered seemed just as surprised as I was.  She apologized and said that I would be credited for the resort fee for the day and that she would follow-up with housekeeping and that the person should have known that the room was occupied.  Fast forward, I leave and and return to the room close to 11pm to go to sleep.  I attempt to close the window curtains to block out the light so I can sleep MY BAD THERE ARE NONE.  I have green light shining in my room all night (took video and photos to show) At 3:00am the lights shut off...I was awake and exhausted.  I immediately booked a flight out for first thing in the morning.  I showered, which is where my final issue arises as there was what appeared to be a pubic hair in the shower...I was done.I checked out with a woman who was nice, whom I shared that my whole experience had been a disaster.  She advised that I would be receiving a survey and I should complete with my concerns; so here we are.I AM SO SORRY COSMOPOLITAN FOR CHEATING ON YOU WITH THE BAIT OF COMP NIGHTS...

The MGM is not so Grand... I am in my second room change for the evening. The first room the front vent facing of Air Conditioner just completely fell off the wall and opened up out of know where. After three calls and and hour engineering never showed up. Moving your hotel room at 11pm is never fun. I arrive to the second room which didn't prove picture perfect without the desk chair especially for a business trip. As I asses the room the missing or replenished waters and half filled mini bar kinda make me feel as if the room just wasn't given its best by hospitality. One would think that businesses that survived the pandemic would take pride in consumers and appreciate patronage, that the hotels would be sparking clean, all the bars would fully stocked and things broken once before were fixed. The MGM Minor is of course readily to impose not only a $44 Resort fee but an anmentionable $100 per night deposit for a subpar room with limited or no service. Please disregard the Dinner service on the in dining menu, because room service is operational from 6am -2pm. It was my hope that as the world returns to normalcy after grave sufferance and chaos we would be better. If your reading this take note, it's about choosing better. The MGM is currently not a good hotel choice to stay in Las Vegas. Choose elsewhere

I've stayed here several times and it has always been a delight but today. The staff at the hotel and the experience is great, but your phone representatives are something else.  I'm waiting on the phone for 15 minutes. When I finally reach someone your representative stays silent the first time I tell him I don't have my player code to check for any promotions. He finally answers and asks me for my player code again. Then when I tell him I don't have my player number again, but that you guys usually look it up with my name, he hangs up on me ????? WTF.  People have things to do than writing complaints on apps. Seriously.

The hotel is nice but very out dated. The wall paper the room was coming off and as well in some parts in the hallway. The air conditioner unit was barley working and the bathtub was not draining. There's no refrigerator or safe in the room. The MGM Signature is much better hotel. The MGM needs to be revamped.

The MGM Grand looks pretty much the same as it did when I stayed here many years ago. I'm going to say 3.5 stars but round up to 4. I got a good deal to stay here so I decided to do that. The hotel was included with the flight and I received an extra night for free. Overall, the staff was friendly and helpful. They had a hard time locating my reservation but it was eventually found in their system under my bf's name. It was a weird  situation. Another thing...they let us check in earlier than 3 pm without an extra cost. You have to pay some tourist tax fee of over a hundred dollars. I knew about that already. Another thing I didn't like was that they took out a $300 deposit in case we buy water or snacks in the room or...I guess end up destroying it. There are also sodas and alcohol in the fridge. The thing doesn't even open! I'm not willing to pay $18 for a bottle of a water. There's a CVS and Walgreens down the street. There's also a vending machine in the hallway. The water and snacks are $3 and change there. Luckily, I'll be getting that deposit back.The room was spacious and comfy enough for us. I don't need a lot of amenities or extravagant things, especially when I'm out gambling, eating, etc. most of the time. It was just a basic room with two comfy queen size beds, the usual stuff. The walls are a little bit thin, though. My neighbors all around were probably in their early 20's and partying it up. They were loud and most likely drunk at 2 or 3 am. I remember those days so it didn't bother me that much. I brought my music and headphones so I was able to tune most of it out. Would I stay here again? Maybe. It all depends on the cost. Las Vegas has tons of options. The room was nice and comfy enough. There's also a lot of slots and food options downstairs. It was super clean and everyone that I've seen is wearing their masks. Hand sanitizer and masks were provided in the room. Room service is also available.

I stayed here during the weekend of Feb 19th  There was some professional fights being hosted here are the MGM I Have stayed here many many times, from regular standard rooms to executive suites to the MGM signature I particularly like to stay here during fight nites the energy is lit!!  I have stayed on the same floor as other celebrities and boxers ect This weekend particularly was no exception.  Even though they did not allow any fans in the arena.  My room was clean and very comfortable. I drew myself a nice hot bath   Omg the water ran hot!!  LOVE ITMy view from the room was not so good. It was a view of the parking lot  BUMMER

Worst resorts in Las Vegas, especially Mandalay Bay. Terrible staff at Mandalay Bay. They just care about your money, not your experience. Stay anywhere but MGM Resorts when in Las Vegas. Anything is better than them, their hotels are 0 stars.

DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!!! I'll try to keep this as to the point as possible : I included photos of a few spots we were able to hit during Covid since mostly everything is closed or has limited seating. From MGM you can actually walk through the casino floor and out the back of the hotel to the Las Vegas Strip. We didn't know there was a shortcut until we had walked the longer way three times and had taken 2 taxi trips. These photos are places that are within walking distance from the MGM Hotel on the strip. From MGM to the strip you will pay about $11-$15 with a tip via Taxi. There are no shuttles right now. So rent a car if you don't want to do the walking thing. If it's nice weather we recommend walking because the traffic isn't the best. There is still a bus but I didn't want to ride inside of a closed bus that was FULL. The room: Was terrible. The furniture was old and worn. The bathroom had rust in more than one place. The sink AND shower did not drain so between showers we literally had to wait for the water to go down. Carpet wasn't the cleanest and the mini fridge was HOT to touch. We had to call down to the front desk for more than one reason (I'll get to that). We had a 4 day stay ... they gave us 1 set of towels for two people and when I asked for more we were given 2. We shower everyday.. not sure about others but mmmk, We had to call down because the thermostat was on 80 and blowing cold air like a motel 6. Whew. Two doors down we witnessed a domestic violence situation. Called for help since I thought .. maybe the female would be murdered and they put me on hold... after I told them what was going on THEY CALLED THE ROOM as opposed to coming to see what was going ON. So, I'm sure he was smothering her while he talked to the front desk and told them everything was ok. We left (I was so scared to leave her there but I mean I can't get involved in domestic disputes .. innocent bystanders get killed trying to help) WHEN WE RETURNED she was on the phone in the hallway nude. If you are looking for a young crowd that's rolling around the hotel in handicapped carts and screaming.. playing tag.. I mean.. you found the right place! We are all for a good time but .. not like this. You can tell they room all of the same kind of people in the same parts or the hotel .. it's obvious. The room service bill for breakfast was about $100 for two people . I had steak, potatoes and eggs with a mimosa.. 3 stars and that's because of the alcohol otherwise 1. My husband had pancakes, sausage etc traditional breakfast and enjoyed his meal. There is a Hooters across the street you can get food at for dinner if needed. Everything in Vegas requires a reservation because of Covid and the capacity limitations so call and book ahead and make sure you use a "good last name" (read between the lines) because if not ... "we are full" is all you will hear. Masks were worn on the strip for the most part unless people were smoking or drinking of course. You will see people with the tall slushy drinks you can get them at the daiquiri shop or Fat Tuesday. Fat Tuesday is cheaper . You purchase the size you want and can add shots for an extra $2-$3 per shot. There is a chick fil a on the strip. If you like cheese on your food keep walking because they don't have it. Planet Hollywood was cool to walk through nothing major - again all the restaurants need reservations or you can wait to be seated. I hope this review helped. We will probably stay at the Bellacio next time - IF we come back.. won't be for as long. Oh there's a lit part of the strip that's busy..music.. drinks.. lots of ppl.. Target.. Marshall's.. Ross.. across from your LV, Gucci etc.. that was fun .. lol Overall- all things considered WE had a great time because when you go with great people you always find fun things to do.

Unfortunately my stay was less than pleasant. We upgraded to accommodate our child and the upgrade was subpar at best abs definitely not worth the additional $180 for two nights. There are very minimal accommodations in the room (no microwave, no coffee pot, low thread count sheet like linens, and over priced bar that charges you to look at the drinks). The guest service clerk was moody which ensured that I will never book here again. The mattress on both the bed and the pull out couch are very hard and my husband and I were unable to sleep comfortably. The signature mgm has much better accommodations, do yourself a favor and stay there instead.

Wow!!! What happened to this place ?? 20 years ago we used to come here and it was the hot spot. Now it's become a second world country. It's depressing, ghetto, dingy and sad. MGM Grand is that 65 year old actor that had a hit movie 20 years ago and is hanging on to its golden years only in memory. NEVER AGAIN ... and valet service is discontinued too

I stayed at the MGM Signature Hotel and it was a pretty awesome experience despite 90% of the casino and starbucks locations being completely closed on a Wednesday and Thursday.I strolled around the casino several times and my first evening I was able to dine in at Wolfgang Pucks Grill restaurant and it was a pleasant relief that they were open-- even for walk-ins.I didn't make reservations because I didn't know they even existed in this casino but they seated us anyway. The next morning I was able to get coffee at Johnny Rockets who also does breakfast which was a relief since most of the starbucks except for 1 was totally shut down. I enjoyed walking and getting in some steps inside the casino and also enjoyed seeing more people as the weekend started to roll in-- it reminded me of how Vegas normally was before Covid. I think things are starting to look up and get better and soon beautiful Vegas will be up and running in no time! As for MGM-- it was a beautiful vacation and their suites were amazing, comfortable and very affordable. If you haven't been here yet-- it's a must! 2 thumbs up for the beautiful MGM!

Sitting at the MGM bar playing video poker & neither of the two bartenders are giving any service to customers. They are walking behind the bar restocking, not making any eye contact, & no one has a drink. I have sat here for half a hour playing poker & not one of them have asked what drink we might want.
Terrible place . Not worth a penny . Would rather stay and eat at the Luxor . Terrible staff. The hotel was disgusting, trash overflowing from trashes !!! Like wow

I have it 3 only because the concierge was very kind and when we told her it was our honeymoon she got us a $30 voucher for the restaurant. They also delivered out bags to our room and were very nice. Aside from that. The room we got had hardly any lights, there was wall paper coming off the walls in the bathrooms, and throughout the room. There was also chipped paint as well exposed. We only gambles a few times there only because it was expensive (but that is why happens when your on the strip) was not a fan of the hidden fees. If I were to go again and stay on the strip (easy access to everything else) I will stay at Caesars, or the balagio.
Beware. Rooms small like smoke and weed. Then they they will charge a $1000 smoking fee without telling you . Plus lock out your room key. All with no explanation. Never again! Worst place ever .

Complete mismanagement of hotel during superbowl weekend. Saturday day before the game. Lobby bar and whiskey bar where closed before 1 am. No place to drink other than casino bar which is full since ever other bar is full. With only 3 per table black jack and 4 at roulette they didn't have enough tables for amount people either so you cannot get a drink at tables. I'm here for 1 week from Tuesday to Tuesday and will never come back to MGM grand.

This casino along with their other properties charges you a "Resort fee" this hotel being $44.00 for a resort that is not open for the season. When I asked the hotel operator what I'm getting for my $44.00 the operator was speachless.That should be illegal! Being charged for something your not receiving is a crime.

This hotel is significantly cheaper than most places on the strip. And of course, you get what you pay for. Because of the cheap price, I will review accordingly. The walls are very thin in this buidling. You can hear almost everything that is going on in the room next to you and in the hall ways. So it may be a hit or miss. Depending if you get a loud people on your floor or not.Aside from that, I must say the walking distance to parking garge to check in desk to hotel elevator is very close togheter. Staff here is courterous and polite. Hard to find a place in vegas that doesn't have great customer service. I would probably not stay here again just because of the thin walls. Just really annoying to be waken up by noise in the hall way or room next room over repeatly. Definitely led to some lack of sleep and tireness for this stay.

This casino and hotel was great now the quality and atmosphere sucks. They compare to circus circus now. Smells like marijuana everywere. Are heater in the room wasnt working. We went down to get a room change and the manager name is JD .. gave us the worst attitude. Omg what a horrible experience
Casino was nice and the deserts in this place were real good. Nice we got free parking so we parked here and walked the strip to m&m world and Hersheys world. Will take a stroll around here again.
I just got back from a jog and was super thirsty. It is the desert after all. They wouldn't give me a water. They looked at me like I was some kind of space alien

Great amenities at the casino and hotel, room spacious and comfy, but the app for check in? Forget it! You have to prove identity by adding a second IdMe app, agreeing to full data release, and then upload a pic of drivers license or passport??  Nope. Can't do any early check in if you don't use the app. Boo. Plus...might need to MOVE the chair when you vacuum...we didn't have Doritos.

As Las Vegas Locals, this hotel stay/trip is a staycation with my parents @ MGM Grand Las Vegas (01/07/2021 - 01/12/2021) especially for my dad's belated birthday celebration that I surprised him with. I Booked a "Grand Two Queen Room (446 Square Feet)" BUT upon check in as a M-Life Rewards Gold Member & M-Life Rewards MasterCard Member, we were surprised with a complimentary upgrade to the "Executive Two Queen Suite" with Strip View on the 18th floor (675 Square Feet), Unlimited Access to the VIP Lounge which includes a variety of refreshments throughout the day & night, and a $75 DAILY Food & Beverage Credit (originally it was $50 DAILY but as a courtesy, Jhay (VIP SERVICES) bumped it up to $75 DAILY which was so nice and exceptional of him! Thank You very much MGM Resorts, M life Rewards, and MGM Grand Las Vegas! I want to also give a huge thanks to Jhay who works at VIP Services/Lounge who also checked us in at the hotel! Extremely professional, nice, honest, excellent 5 star customer service & hospitality, respectful, and truly a gentleman who cares about all his guests & goes above and beyond! Thank You once again for everything! We are having a wonderful time and as locals, we will definitely be back and recommend all of my friends and family as well!

OK room but terrible customer service.  No one takes accountability for anything during your stay.  It's run-down as a casino but pays a little better as a result.  Depends on the experience you want to have, but amazed at the complete lack of concern about customer experience.  You are on your own here.  You can play here for better payouts than upscale casinos but recommend you don't stay here...

The worst Vegas experience of my entire life from start to finish. Never come here, it is a scam and a manipulation of your character. Spend the money going to a real casino. The MGM used to be my favorite casino but they no longer care about their customers they only care about profit. Literally any other casino outside of MGM will provide better everything. Cheap hotel rates never make up for cheap customer relations.

Beware the fake paid for five star and Elite reviews . You got a free stay to write a fake positive review defending  mgm massive useless resort fee, massive hold that takes a week to clear, fee for parking, fee for a tiny fridge. Even though hotel is 85% empty. MGM GRAND and other strip hotels greed causes fake reviews.

This is my second time on their dime, so to speak. The first time my wife and I stayed, mid October 2020, we had a very nice room. We also won a ton of money playing slots. A large number of restaurants were closed so the food choices were limited at best, but was adequate. The hotel was suffering from low turnout.Just arrived home from our second trip and it's just sad. The staff is great, they comped us a really pretty suit. They are trying to keep a good upbeat image but the property was almost deserted! Seen Sci-Fi movies that depict this city as empty, for God's sakes its CES week, a room at MGM should not be available! The staff said they weren't at 15% of capacity, I'm surprised if it's 10%. Consequently, nobody was winning anything. Their trying but until COVID is mitigated there is little hope for gaming fun. Great place, great rooms, outstanding staff, terrible covid.

I was skeptical going here based on the reviews but i had a comped stay from MGM for park MGM but bc of covid protocols and them not being opened during the week we got moved here and honestly.....IT WAS A GOOD STAY!!!! NOT GREAT BC I LOST MONEY GAMBLING IN THIS CITY! LOL but overall this was a nice stay. The rooms were clean and had everything you need and we opted not to get housekeeping while we were there but we did ask the housekeepers for towels and other things and they complied always. OBVIOUSLY WHEN YOU GO TO VEGAS ANY HOTEL WILL HAVE RESORT FEES AND OBVIOUSLY YOUR CREDIT CARD WILL HAVE A HOLD ON IT FOR A COUPLE DAYS!!, i hate cheap people crying about that like what were you expecting going to the strip? Go to your local casino if you are going to cry some more about it.I would definitely stay here again, noise was not an issue, obviously also all strip hotels don't give you a fridge but hey that's why you get your supplies at Walgreen's beforehand and get ice from the hotel hallway and you can have a good time!

this place is a rip off . the rooms are nice but some of the fees and rules are over rated .. my husband and i smoked a vape pen pin on the balcony.. they charged us $500. no weed no cigarettes a vaporizer ...... they proclaim they have to deep clean smell out the room but we wasnt in the room so how can u deep clean outside air ??   thats the biggest rip off i ever herd of ...this place over rated ... i wouldnt recommend this place at all !!!!

Spent one night in the executive king suite. No soaking tub. I find it ridiculous for a suite not to have a soaking tub. The room has two showers. Why? I will never know. The staff all around was quick to get rid of you. For a four star hotel the service was not that level. Redemption comes with the food. Amazing choices and a 24 hour subway. The walk to it is incredibly far from the rooms. No need for that treadmill. If sound proofing is a issue stay elsewhere. You can hear the noise from rooms three doors down as if they are next door. Beautiful room

This is my birthday weekend And while all of Vegas has been a marvelous visitation for me My stay at the MGM grand took an unnecessary turn when I had to wait at the front of the line while five people were standing behind the counter doing nothing for nearly 15 minutes before they even acknowledge my presence. I walked up to the counter and ask to speak to a manager the manager stayed in the back literally as I went through a 10 minute back-and-forth with one of the minions about them rectifying that I had no access to Ice.It wasn't until I became somewhat indignant and insisted that he come out that he comes out to speak to me and looks as if though he was in the back sleep. He had an attitude from the moment he came out and it began to escalate the situation not desiring to get into a heated exchange I asked him for who his boss was. He told me that he wasn't going to give me that information basically to go F  myself. Now I believe had I been a white Caucasian client I honestly felt like such a simple request could've been handled with some sensitivity and some professionalism I have never felt more racially violated than in this era we live in now. This gentleman came off to me as an ardent Trump supporter, he was disrespectful and condescending. It is a shame in 2020 that we spend as much money as we do I had a grand king and had walked all over this humongous hotel looking for ice, one of the staff members had the nerve to tell me to catch a cab and go to CVS and get some.It's sad to have such a beautiful property that they lack professionalism and courtesy towards clients especially in a time when the economy is not being friendly to businesses you would think that they would take extra care of the people that they service. But it's going to have to start at the top by making sure that all people are created equal and treated equally with the same kind of service as other people get. #Racist

We booked this hotel off of orbitz and had a wonderful experience. We stayed in a wellness suite which included a sunrise alarm clock, Vitamin C infused shower, a air purifier, And aromatherapy. Upon arrival we broke the seal on our door showing the room have been sanitized. Many of the restaurants within the casino or not currently open however there is a large selection. You do need to make reservations regardless of if you were going to a bar or a restaurant most often you can make them right there at the hostess stand. The beds are super comfortable and suite with super spacious. The staff was friendly and super helpful. We would return in the future.

Not impressed with my stay. Disappointing the way they treat their customers with a concealed carry with permit. MGM is supporting the infringement of our rights. I've heard the argument that they have the right to ban you from their property for any reason, but that doesn't make it right, especially when I've paid for my room and they lock me out of my room.

Very nice hotel and resort! The line might be long every now and then but they're very nice in the front desk. It goes by fast so the wait time is not too bad. The front desk guy gave us a free upgrade so that was nice. We just had to pay for the resort fee which is all normal. They have free masks by the entrance. If you stay here, you get a free goodie bag as well with 2 free masks (1 for me & 1 for my husband), 1 hand sanitizer and 1 small bag. It's cute. Very thoughtful of them.Place is clean. There's additional cleansing air they put around so it's cleaner. I like how they added extra security for the card in the elevator to specific room and floor a person stays. Walking destination to many places. The room rates/price is great! Not expensive and very affordable. Enjoyed our stay here and planning to be back soon. I totally Recommend

This once Grand hotel is now the Grand Ghetto of the Strip. Good...fucking...grief. I dont think I walked 5 paces without the stench of weed. Our entire floor was smothered in that stench. The toilet was broken. All sinks semi-clogged. Parents room TV did not work. Several stary hairs in the awful center sinking beds. Its an absolute shitfest pig-sty, to be kind.Imagine a walmart hotel, ok there you go. Now have fun booking.No fridge, all minibar shit packed in there. Oh also safe wasnt closing had to call someone.Ive never seen a lower quality of people in my life (not wealth wise class and dignity/appearance wise) anywhere in the world than this hotel. Feel sorry for employees here. Never again.Best part? Leaving to cross the bridge to NYNY, shit ANYWHERE ELSE.

3.5 stars ! I stayed here for the New Year celebrations Dec 31-Jan 3.The rooms were nice, clean, I really liked the safety precautions they took all around the hotel premises with available hand sanitizer and washing stations. In the room Included a little bag with cloth material masks (2)  and your hand sanitizer. The room had a great speaker JBL(my favorite). What I wasn't to happy about is that the phone to my room wasn't working. Also they had a dinner room service special for food to place but how if I didn't have a phone. Not a problem I can go downstairs and order. Once I get to the front desk they do let me know if I wanted to change rooms due to the phone ( it's not a big deal) so I didn't but let them know if they can send someone to fix the phone. I told them about the dinner special ( which they had no clue about) and then told me that I couldn't order due to there high demand it wasn't going to be possible. Now why offer something when you now you can't satisfy the customer. Don't a problem again it wasn't until I arrive back to my room. Phone was fixed great! Oddly there was an open can of pop left in the washroom which I know I didnt take to drink but didn't make anything out of it until check out when I see a fee for the beverage taken out the fridge. Line to check out was too long and not worth waiting to dispute a pop but I strongly suggest keeping an eye out and checking the fridge upon arrival.

Looking for more people who have had racist experiences against them at this hotel to start class action lawsuit. Please message me on Yelp with your experience. I need 10 people to get a lawyer to agree to contingency. If you room was dirty during covid too please also contact me as this hotel does not follow state guide lines.

Dang! I don't know if it's because of COVID or not but the rooms have gone downhill here! Feels like a motel 6 with lipstick. You can tell that the cleaning crew only runs the vacuum and wipes everything down. Grout and anything that needs the slightest effort to clean isn't touched. If you are coming here to enjoy the room or use it for anything romantic spend an extra $100 and go stay at the Venetian.

Worst Vegas experience ever! Hotel checked us into a room that was occupied by about 5 gang members who were not happy when our key opened their drug den room. Hotel advertises room service that doesn't exist after 2PM. Sit on hold for 20 mins to speak to the desk and the rude as F lady hung up on me when I asked for a manager. This place is ghetto! Can't wait to leave!

The hotel room looks nice but feels like a 1-star experience. The walls are paper thin, so everything from your next door neighbor's room can be heard - talking, screaming, yelling, curtain adjustment, showering, toileting, intercourse - and smelt (our next door neighbors were smoking pot). Attempted to reach the front desk to request a room change but no one answered. Absolutely terrible experience
They don't give you a refrigerator in your room or a coffee pot. You can rent the fridge for 35 dollars a night. Ridiculous

Absolutely disgusting. If I could give 0 stars I would. I gifted my brother a 3 night stay at MGM for his 21st birthday and this is what we had to deal with. What makes matters worse, is the simple fact that MGM did absolutely NOTHING to compensate or recover -- didn't even offer medical attention to the 10 bites that radiates down his neck to his legs. I am absolutely appalled at the scene I witnessed on my brothers birthday and will NEVER return to this infested place.

This was probably one of the worst stays I have had in Vegas... My room had a funky smell from the min. I walked in. Let the front desk know, they sent someone to clean it, but it still smelled. So they offered to upgrade me to the wellness floor. The room was great, but the TV didnt work and when I went to take a shower, the handle fell off. They offered to switch my rooms again, back down to a standard room. I was tired of changing rooms, so they finally got someone to fix it. The handle was assembled wrong, and there were black marks all over the tub when it was finished; but it wouldn't turn past the half-way mark, so I was only able to take a cold shower. They did offer to make it up to me by adding a $100 credit to my room for dinner. In which I went and had, and charged to my room to use the credit. They ended up charging my credit card for the dinner costs of $100.  I had to call and get the charge reversed, which will take 3 -5 days for the refund to go through. They offered to try to make up for the inconvenience, but it caused an even bigger inconvenience that I had to pay for.The first room I stayed in was only ok, I've seen much better for Vegas. My co-worker complained that his room smelled like smoke. The second room was better I guess,  besides all the broken/ not working items. I would not stay here again. There are many other hotels on the strip that are a better deal for your money.

Hi Everyone, I am compelled to write a nice review for this hotel. We came for the Christmas weekend, and knowing full well the COVID restrictions and concerns throughout the country, I have to say the MGM took great care to keep all things sanitized & safe for all. The rooms (we had two) were clean, restaurants at 25% capacity so definitely social distancing observed, everyone with masks, and continuous cleaning by staff. Courtesy was exceptional from the bell desk to the front desk to the housekeeping & engineering service. When we had a little blip of tv service, engineering came right up, took care of the problem, and an extra courtesy was extended that more than made up for the inconvenience. So if you are hesitating, or thinking about a weekend getaway from the stresses of your home reality, I highly encourage you to consider the MGM Grand for your stay. Prices are EXCEPTIONALLY reasonable right now, so even that is a huge bonus! Thanks for reading and thanks to the MGM Grand hotel for a much needed R & R weekend! Tamaira Danyluk

My wife and I did mobile check in before we arrived. When we got to our room the iron was out, the courtesy sanitization bag was used by the previous guest, and there was trash outside the room. We asked for a new room which they gave us without apology or concern to the condition of the first. At first the second room looked fine, then my wife found garbage left by the previous guest under the night stand, and I found cigarette ash on the night stand. I was hoping to enjoy our visit as much as we did 3 years ago, not a great start to our trip...

I had come in to check in at 10:50am and the employee at the time told me I would get both of my rooms in a few hours. I got my room and the second room was not available even at 1800 (6pm). This employee, Tristin, was so rude and condescending. He literally said we cannot accommodate for all 3 of my rooms being on the same floor when earlier they stated it was quite possible. Then I asked for the manager who was Ryan. I assumed he would take a kind demeanor but instead he quickly stated that asking for something well over 9 hours ago was too difficult to occur. He was being rude but then when speaking to another superior realized his mistake and at least comped the resort fee and gave 2 drinks. This is why I am giving two stars and not one

I loved staying at the MGM Grand. They follow excellent COVID protocol, I felt safe the entire time. They enforce wearing masks within the public areas of the buildings which was nice. The hotel itself was clean and the room was amazing. Had a great view of the strip. Would definitely stay here again.
It's been Been amazing staying here, seeing the workers cleaning and sanitizing through out the day! Enjoyed every day spent here for my 30th celebration!

Was just in Vegas last month & it was my first time staying at the MGM. They definitely were taking their precautions with Covid. Sanitation stations/ mask stations all over the casino floors. Hotel was not overly  crowded. Pool area was great but the only thing was if you weren't physically in the water you need to wear a mask while tanning which was a bummer but overall it's was a great experience

This location was beautiful! Thanks to Priceline my sister in law were able to get a room for such a good deal! The only complaints we had was the In Room dining was EXTREMELY limited and there hours were only from 6AM-2PM. Other than that it was still worth every penny for our stay and the customer service was very friendly. Also the beds were super comfy Can't wait to come back.

I originally reserved a room at the Park MGM and was called to ask to switch to MGM grand, which my wife and I agreed to. The hotel smelled like sewage with a hint of spearmint like they tried to cover the smell. After a night of slots (not one server came to us to offer us drinks after spending a few hundred dollars), we went up to our room and decided we wanted some cocktails but we wanted to stay in for the night. We had sodas in the room but they weren't cold because the refrigerator in the room wouldn't open, which we told hotel staff about and they didn't fix it. So I went down our hallway to grab a soda from the vending machine. I went to every single vending machine on our floor and all they had was water and vitamin water. The rest were completely empty. So I went back to my room to order room service. They said after 2 pm room service was unavailable. Which is surprising especially since it is Vegas. I then asked if someone could bring us up some sodas and I would pay any additional fee, they would not accommodate us. In addition, there were handprints and finger prints on our windows and curtains. Definitely only book here if you just need a place to crash.

For as much as this hotel costs, you get more staying at a Motel 6. No refrigerator, so I'm filling bags with ice to keep my perishables from spoiling. in 2020? Unaccepatable. They don't even have a microwave to heat the food up if I wanted to eat it right now anyway!!! In 2020??! unacceptable. I can't even put my items in the "minibar" fridge, because they charge you $50 if you even touch anything in there. Again..... unacceptable. There's no smoking rooms, there's no rooms with balconies, and there "strip views" are covered by a giant decal over the windows. We can't see anything. These issues aren't "covid" related... this place just suxx. You can do better.

This was my first time staying at MGM out of my many Vegas trips over the years.  After this long 5 day stay, i can confidently say this would not be my hotel of choice.  It is definitely a nice hotel and very large but here is my experience at MGM...  Check-in process was very quick and easy.  $200 refundable deposit is required as well as daily resort fees. Which for 5 days was about another $200.Upon checking in, we were told we had a $20 dining credit per day to spend at a hotel restaurant in MGM. You scan a barcode at the front desk that pulls up a list of what is supposed to be eligible restaurants.  Welp we found that is not the case, most of the restaurants are closed and then the other half are third party and can't charge to the room (that's how we had to use the dining credit) so we got to use the credit one day and that was it. So pretty pointless and not really explained well at the front desk.   Even though the hotel is extremely large it seemed they were only checking in guests on floors 21-29 and not really utilizing the other floors. I say this because once the weekend came, the wait to just get on the elevators  was 10-20 minutes because there were so many people trying to get up at the same time.  Meanwhile the elevators to the other floors were empty so not sure what was up with that.  The room was large and clean.  The hotel even leaves a mask and sanitation kit in the room.  Mini bar was open and fully stocked. Masks are required pretty much at every single moment. My mask wasn't covering just the tip of my nose and i got asked to pull it up.  They are not playing around at all.   For me, location is everything.
