I like to stay centralized on The Strip because everything is right there and can easily walk to any place on the strip and go back to your room at anytime.   Well MGM is literally soooo far down the strip and on those late drunk nights it is not fun to walk all the way back to your hotel.  It's about a good 30 minute walk from the heart of the strip so we did way more walking than usual this time around.

Checked with self check in, located our room. The room just okay, run down and the windows were so dirty. Left yo Ho to dinner and upon return to the hotel we were denied access to our room in the 24th floor but Morgan a female security officer stating if we did not share the elevator we could not go up. With covid you can not be 6 ft apart in an elevator so we went to the manager who took us to our room via a service elevator. We packed up and left to a different hotel. Never have been treated so poorly. Will never go back.

RENA at check in was very helpful and super friendly. She checked us in quickly and accommodated all of our requests. I am very pleased with her service. The room she gave me exceeded my expectations. The entire hotel was amazing. Great restaurants. Excellent friendly staff. I'll definitely stay here again! Thanks Rena!

Finally got to stay at MGM. I stayed one night in the two queen executive suite. The beds are not Queen- size.  They are FULL size. My family are not small people. So sharing a bed was a struggle. It's actually the night before Thanksgiving 2020 during the COVID 19 pandemic. The casino was not crowded. I use to seeing this place out of control. It's strange. I was here in July 2020 and went to the hunger games exhibit. The pool situation was crazy. Mgm limited how many people could get in the pool. You had to go and reserve in an virtual queue. Some people never made it in. I just watch. All in all, I had a good time in this trip. Definitely will stay here again.

This was a pretty great casino before 2005, but since then its been in decline. It once appealed to the genteel but now to the uncivilized. Now littered with western bars and sports bars, its a real shame to see this massive property in decline. A few good real top restaurants, but are very out of place with their current surroundings.

Willa is so sweet and accommodating! She answered all of my covid questions as we are going from San Diego and unfamiliar. She was so patient and kind, explained all the rules and regulations during covid that Vegas has. Mgm should feel lucky to have an employee like her! She was absolutely wonderful!

Beds, are great! But the security doesn't help when hallways are full of drunk people yelling and crying at 2am.  Tv is decent but no fridge that we can use. Most rooms have doors between rooms, this sucks cause you hear the tv, conversation or other things happing.Casino floor is nice but over 1/2 the machines are out of service?  Table min are high. But again this is Vegas and I came  here to dress sexy and have some adult fun!

Never will I ever stay here again ! We been locked out our room all night ! We had to get 4 different room keys ! Each time we leave the room,none of the keys work ! Then they won't let us in because we have to verify what's in the room. Same security every time ! 4 times in 1 night we have to look the same security in the face and repeat the same things in the room. He goes in to look for the same stuff described by the same people 4 times !! Let me mention the reason our room keys didn't  work; our room was dirty they deactivated our keys because they claimed they were going to change our room. They never changed our room but deactivated the keys. Instead of fixing the keys or giving us new keys we had to keep verifying ourselves and items in our room.

We loved our stay at the MGM! This was my 6th visit to Vegas and I just couldn't wait to stay at MGM. We went for a girls weekend for mine and our bff's birthday! We chose the MGM for easy access the Shakira concert we were attending. We hope to visit again once the pandemic is clear!

Was able to check in early with no extra fees, valet wasn't open so we had to park in the parking structure (pain), all employees practicing social distancing and wearing masks, COVID protocols were in place, but was not enforced in the casino.Room was super clean, view was alright. The thing that I didn't like, we had to wear masks in the pool area, even when we were sitting away from people. We were able to remove the masks, when in the pool? That didn't make sense...we were closer to other people while in the pool.

The plandemic ruined the whole experience. Hotel overall nice room was nice but ridiculous they charge you still full price for resort fees when more than half of their stuff isn't even open. Starbucks line was always packed because they only had one open. Most of their restaurants were never even opened. People can walk around smoking but yet I take a drink and don't immediately pull my mask up and you bet someone is there to tell you to do so. Only thing that was great was TopGolf they let you enjoy yourself without telling you to put a mask on every 5 mins. Overall not overly impressed definitely wouldn't go back during this stupid plandemic.

Grand they are not lying the property is freaking huge.Check in was fine I was in the west tower on the 9th floor.  Nice room modern very clean all white bedding.Stocked mini bar big TV only had one small chair and table. No couch.Everything was compliant my room was sealed before I entered.Be prepared to walk a lot getting anywhere is easily 10 minutes from your room.  Especially the pool was a bit of a trek. Be prepared to wait for almost everything the staff is very limited but happy to serve you.Pool was great arrive early or reserve a chair. Did that on Saturday and really enjoyed it. Not cheap 60$ for the chair for the day and 45$ for a big vodka red bull in a MGM lion cup.  Was tastey but I wasn't drunk enough for that price lol I had a small fruit cup for 6$ cheapest thing on the menu. I also brought my own float which saved me about 10$ not a huge difference but I had my own float and enjoyed it. Only bring floats shaped like rings or it could be turned away. They do charge 6$ to fill it. Everything was very spaced apart limited capacity. Everyone was respectful.  The property is a bit taunting there's still no shows or trains running. Which is one of the major selling points of the MGM.Still never fully figured out how to get around till after 4 days lol.I'll be back for a shorter stay next time and hopefully it will be more fun.

I'm an MGM player so I get all my hotel rooms free...  and this was a "tower spa suite".    It just wasn't all that.  I appreciate all they did to make it Covid clean.  But I just wasn't that impressed with the service or amenities.  I guess I always thought the MGM was way better than my usual haunts (NY or Luxor), but it just isn't.  It's probably hard to judge a place during Covid, but there just isn't much going on at the MGM Grand now.  Dining options (especially during the day) are just non-existent.  The staff seemed to have no idea what was open so getting recommendations was impossible.  Places that are listed as open (Cabana Grill) are in fact NOT open and you won't know that until you walk the mile to get there...  no one can tell you and the website may SAY a place is open but it isn't.There also isn't much to see at MGM Grand.  Our room was fine - comfy bed and nice spa tub.  The slot machine selection is OK.   I did find that their drink service while you're playing is very good.  Probably the best at any of the MGM properties I stay at.  Room service is more readily available but very pricey - a $9 charge for any order and the menu is pretty limited.  But it's nice to sleep in and order food - too many casino hotels aren't doing room service now.  If you want to leave the hotel and grab a cab or Uber/Lyft you have to do a bit of a hike and they don't really tell you that...  the signs are sort of deceptive (you're only one floor away from your ride!)...  it's actually a bit of a walk so don't call a car until you're there...  it's not nearly as convenient as it is at other properties.   Staff was friendly.  We loved the Lobby Bar and when my SO found his cash-out ticket stuck in the machine we got help pretty quickly.  But I have a choice of MGM properties to stay at and I just can't see the MGM Grand being one we would be in a hurry to go back to.

So frustrated when we checked in to the MGM Hotel we requested that we needed a room near the elevator as my husband cannot walk that far.  Yes of course they said.  We get to the suite and it's at the very last room down the hallway.  My husband called and got nowhere.  I called and ask for a different room or an upgraded one.  Nope she said every hour we need to call and check to see if they may have a similar room closer to the elevator.  Lack of customer service would be the nicest thing I could say at this point.  Won't be coming back.

Rooms are clean. Casino is clean. They do check your temperature n wear gloves. Fast food court good food only thing is there's no one sanitizing tables sit at your own risk.  Slots not paying out I spoke to some ppl I told them I agree. There were no jackpot winners in 4 days we were there.

I am so disappointed from start it was just a disaster when we ran over a glass jar in the parking lot... Then when we get to our suite it's filthy you have stains on the toilet inside the toilet and also nothings been clean in the room as far as the tables and the countertop in the surfaces are concerned... It's ridiculous and it's stench in here also they say on the website that this room comes with a refrigerator so I have a child that has a special diet so that's why I got the room and the refrigerator is full of soda and hotel snacks ..... Disappointed .... not to mention the customer service the female who was checking me in was so rude and so short patient I am so done with it mannered customer service. However the bell man who took our logic luggage upstairs he was very nice so he deserved a really nice tip and that I'm happy for.
Got a rude receptionist, room I was given got bed bugs. Service sucked every where. Couldn't even get a drink unless I had helped calling for help. Never staying here again.

WEED, WEED, WEED!! I really wanted to leave a better review, but the problems were just too bad. They WHOLE place REEKS of weed. The casino, elevators, hallways, even our room. The hotel does nothing. I felt like I was in a fraternity house. The hotel has gone Ghetto

I had a terrible experience yesterday at the MGM pool. I booked a room at the mgm signature tower and was not aware that there was a difference between the two properties. When I arrived at the pool I was turned away and told it was because we were not guests or the casino. I explained that I would gladly pay and that we just wanted to have lunch by the pool and our property did not serve food. I was told I could not pay and if I wanted to utilize the pool I should have booked at the actual MGM. When I explained I thought they were the same the manager on duty Soren was extremely rude and exclaimed "oh you knew". I was very offended and felt extremely discriminated against. Another manager ended up allowing us to come In and apologizing on sorens behalf however I'm extremely offended. I won't be back and I'll be sure to tell everyone I know about my experience.

Room fees are DOUBLE the room cost. Marijuana permeates the entire floor, outside, strip and surrounding area. Skunk weed. It's gone totally ghetto. Additionally, Las Vegas Nevada is dead.At less than 10% capacity.No buffets open.No shows.No conventions.No coins in slot machines ( all paper tickets ).Jacuzzi's are outlawed.Homeless littering the streets.Crime through the roof.It's filthy like San Francisco.It's ghetto with swarms of loitering listless drug addicts.The smell of marijuana permeates not only only the streets but the hotel rooms all smell like skunk weed.The smell of sewage often overpowers the smell of skunk weed.Remember free drinks at a slot machine? No longer. Now it's $11 beers and you go get it yourself.The Mob has become weak.The police can't keep up.MGM, which controls most of the hotels and casinos seems to have given up.The city of 644,000 people is bankrupt.Las Vegas Nevada is dead.Next year it will be a ghost town.First hand report. I thought you might like to know. I will not go back until they clean it up.#lasvegas #lasvegasnevada #deathoflasvegas#dontgo #novacation
My favorite hotel in Vegas. Get the spa suite! Place is clean and well run and not overly crowded. Staff is friendly and the food is really good. And I always seem to win here!
Love this hotel but with Covid Las Vegas is. It the same I was there for a week and it was very dead , not much entertainment but definitely a sight to see

The stay was good until we checked out. Would have given them five stars had I not had to deal with the BS after check out. Went to check my email and saw the receipt from my stay. They had charged me for every item in the snack and refrigerator area of the room. We had removed all of the items out of the minibarrefrigerator that were "placed there for our convenience" Per the little sign on the counter. For those of you that don't know... This is the mini bar area that charges a crap ton of money for the items. We removed the items in order to put our own drinks it said refrigerator. There was no other refrigerator in the room. And there is no microwave. I had to call customer service to inquire about the charge. I didn't even have to mention what the problem was before the man piped up that he saw what the problem was. He explained that the mini bar area is weighted and At check out if the items are not exactly as they were upon check in that you are charged for each item. I told him that every item was still there and that we did not use any of them. We removed the stuff and put our own drinks in the refrigerator. He was very rude and said that we are not supposed to do that. I told him no one told us that and there was not a sign that said so. He said there is a sign and that I was welcome to come back and see it. I could not believe that in the middle of a pandemic when Vegas is already suffering financially that they would treat their guests this way. I would expect customer service to be spot on during these times.Screw you MGM. Oh and your slots are too tight for my liking...

Horrible STAY ! Housekeepers are thief's. my room tub was stopped up and  look to had Bed bugs . I asked to upgrade was and denied ! They however did move my room , but was later notified with 20 officers at my door with false information! My medicine bag was lost and my room where housekeeper were the only ones there ..and was never found House keepers are criminals, this was the worst stay ever !!ruined my trip and would not refund me ! Stay away ! South Point is my normal stay and it's beyond the best

1 stars... cause the room... but really 0stars... So we're here in the MGM Casino playing the Price is Right.... right next to the lobby... and one of these Top Flight Paul Blart yellow shirt Security walked by us... cause theses drama people and we were looked... passed by us sayin... are u playing or being Nosy.... "BEING NOSY BITCH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!" Wtf was it to u... mind your own fukn business!!!! Dumb ass mf... Don't come to stay at the MGM GRAND... Rude af....& we got the king bed suite on the 10th floor room 242 fuk that... we're moving to the Trump hotel

This place has gone south fast!  Just checked in and there is a shots fired at the main entrance.  Smells like weed all over the place.  Get up to the room, call for my bags and it's a 30-45 min wait and I need to stay in my room.  Last straw, call for room service and the don't offer it after 2pm!  Are you kidding me?  I was at the Wynn a couple of weeks ago and didn't have any issues like this.  Only positive- Scott brought our bags to the room and he was professional and pleasant.  I have stayed here many times over the years and was saddened to see it slip so far, so fast!

Rooms are nice and clean. Staff are great and helpful. Lazy River is nice. I was in shock when I saw so many people not wearing masks and no social distancing in all areas including elevators, pools and gambling area of the MGM Grand Resort. Also MGM announced in social media no smoking allowed and there was smoking all over the gambling areas with people not wearing mask so they can smoke making you very uncomfortable.

Everything was perfect, except for the check-in staff. The person who processed our check-in had an attitude and did not explain things, such as the price breakdown, thoroughly. Nevertheless, this place quickly became one of my favorite go-to spots in Vegas because of its excellent pools and pristine interior.

The service is absolute garbage. There is an emergency shut off of water last night. No hot showers this. And then when I get home they want to check me out my key didn't work. I said there was no hot water I need extended check out. I was in my Room for 5 minutes and to to housekeeping comes by and asks me to check out.  I did not get to shower and my key did not operate . I was stuck in  the hallway with my dog.  This experience will never happen again.

Just like everyone has mentioned before they are complete thieves and the facility is so overpriced and dirty. Extremely disappointed in the price that was paid for the quality and cleanliness of rooms and facility. For some reason our deposit was never returned either; we do not have pets or smoke. Disgusting place, we did not feel safe staying here. Security does not try to de-escalate situations, they turn a blind eye. 2 am we woke up to a couple fighting in the hallways and a woman screaming for help. I would not recommend to anyone and will not be staying at any chains by the MGM.

I have stayed at the mgm grand 3 times . This had to be the worse experience. When making my reservation we requested that the rooms be near each other . They didn't help with that. The person at the front desk wasn't informative with times that restaurant or pool seemed like they were getting off their shift . Had to move from the 1st room because it smelled like a cigarette box and the Tv didn't work . Then our second room was beside a room that was spoking marijuana all day long and it came thru the connecting doors and I asked to be moved again and they said they would get back with me and they never did . I had to call twice before they moved us . Very unhappy with the trip

I wish I could give MGM a 0 star. However they will get this 1 star thanks to Mike and has horrible customer service at the casino bar. I went to the bar and I played the slot machine's. I asked Mike for a Don Julio margarita and he advised me that I would get what I get. He passed me a drink and walked away. I'm not used to this type of service when I'm spending money at the casino. My hotel the Aria was totally different. I came here for a suite party and decided to play the slot machine while I waited for other guest to arrive. I don't think I would ever come back here again. We talked with two different bartenders and it was the same type of service. No thank you. I'll past.

Stayed here over Columbus weekend. Overall pretty good experience considering the vid. They are definitely strict on masks and keep the place clean. The one downside was the crowd was a little sketch.

Worst service at the pool. I understand it's Covid and they have to follow capacity guidelines but the man at the front was extremely rude (short Hispanic man). After explaining we had a cabana with family he raised his voice and stated he couldn't do anything because of capacity. He asked us to call the party we were with, we tried they didn't answer since they were in the pool. I asked if he can walk with us to the cabana since we knew the cabana number but he refused to do anything to help. After arguing with him for 10 minutes he allowed one person to go in making us 3 wait. Totally disappointing considering 1300 was spent. I understand there are rules but there should be a nicer way to treat people who have spent that type of money.

We had a great stay. Check in was smooth, the attendant at the front counter was very friendly. Seems all Covid compliance was in place....so that made us feel safe. Most food venues were closed due to Covid so I can't blame the Casino. We were able to go off strip and grab some food. The pool was great. They did enforce the mask requirements when out of the pool and at the bars which again they were doing the best they could....the guests for the most part were complying. The room was comfortable and clean, just right to crash after a busy day on the strip. The lighter crowds during the week made it easier to stroll the strip but you have to plan your meal plans due to the Covid closures. No buffets open right now. All in all Vegas veterans can have a good time but I'd call in advance for information on shows and clubs. Now is an opportunity to explore off strip for local restaurants and places. There is a lot to do locally. Thanks Mgm staff for a good visit. Brian

My husband and I checked in on 9/18. As we start to walk away from the front desk I slipped on some water. My husband and one of the guests helped me up and not one staff member bothered to ask me if I was okay. I had to wave down a manger and ask him to please have someone wipe the water, he did not leave from behind the desk instead he called to have the water cleaned up and went behind a door. As embarrassed as I was we stood next to the water to make sure no one else would fall. A very nice man got there to clean the spill. We went up to our room and later came down and went about our evening. I was a bit sore but didn't really feel the pain until the evening. I called down and asked for an ice pack and they had someone from security bring it to my room and took an accident report even though it never crossed my mind to report it. We stayed the weekend even though I had to take Tylenol for the pain. I wasn't going to make a big deal but the disregard for my safety and well being really upset me, had I been someone else I would have stayed on the floor screaming for an ambulance. I have called and left several messages for Ryan Gregory the director of operations and I have not received a call back. A simple acknowledgement of what happened would be the right thing for them. I will not stay here again and will ask my friends and family to do the same.

The one thing I didn't like, they don't offer late check-in. The front desk person had major attitude, but because we checked in so late she did extend our checkout hours, so that was a plus. The room was spotless, no noise what so ever, near the rooms. They do offer their guest a cute care package with two mask, hand sanitizer, stylus/keychains! A very comfortable and relaxing stay. Because of covid, there wasn't vale parking.

There is bodily fluids on the wall, right next to the head board. Staff was extremely unhelpful. We missed our reservations for zip lining.  It took 2 hours for a room change and we had to move all our own things , wait in line for a new key, and the staff acted as though WE were the nuisance! Have us 2 ($25) gift cards for a drink although THREE people were registered. Jake carrigan was very rude as well.

Have been here twice within the Covid epidemic and both times I've been impressed with the level of cleanliness. All of the restaurants downstairs are great - haven't had a bad meal once, the rooms are updated and look very nice and comfy, casino area is never-ending, you get free drink and food vouchers at the Sports Book, the security is attentive. We had very obnoxious neighbors who were literally banging on our connected wall at 3am, and security came within 5 minutes and made them party more quietly. Overall, this place is worth the price and I'll continue to stay here when in Vegas.

I have stayed in the hotel once previously. It is a lovely resort. The atmosphere is pleasant. I have enjoyed a couple of their restaurants, Wolfgang Puck's Bar and Grill and the buffet. Also have enjoyed a couple shows there, Ka and David Copperfield. Never had any luck gambling here though, not a bit at all.

Beware, if you enjoy vegas for the atmosphere and like nice hotels and casino do not come here. It is the sketchiest environment I've visited. People are loud, drunk, racing through the casino on motorized carts. Staff is unhappy and not helpful. The one plus was the lazy river cabana. We adored our hostess. If you want to feel safe in your accommodations look elsewhere.

Extremely disappointed to find out i got charged 50$ for two phone calls made to my cell phone from our rooms phone . Each call was under 1 minute . My husbands phone was dead & he called me w the rooms phone & I guess that was 25$ a phone call. I can't believe that calling a cellphone from California is considered long distance . Those phone calls were urgent & my bank statement has a hold of 95& for it . Makes no sense .

We had a blast there during our stay until my son had an slight emergency situation at the pool area in which the emergency medics had to be brought in. The pool staff all helped out in making him feel calm before the medics arrived. The staff even gave him an inner tube a cookie and an icie drink After the whole ordeal.I would like to thank the pool staff manager, security team, and the medics for there awesome way of handling this situation. You guys rock !!!

My boyfriend and I had a date night and decided to book a stay at MGM grand sky lofts. The loft we had was on the 19th floor, very stunning room for 1500 square feet, it actually felt like our home loft we live in. Interior is very modern, the setup of this loft is simple, master bedroom on the top floor with the master bathroom suite. Bottom floor there was a half bathroom once you enter the room, then you see a set of glass stairs with a table right beside it. On the right of the room there is a living room with a slide door for the patio. The patio was huge & spectacular with a view. Great for relaxing & chilling with your significant other or friends.There is a mini bar in this loft as expected, it did came with a price of how much the drinks & snacks was.Check in was a little wait though,...Over all, we thought this place was amazing. If you get the chance to book a night or two at one of their lofts, you will love it. By the way they are the only rooms at MGM that has a patio.

Tried to get a suite with a Jacuzzi after 5 days at Arches/Zion NP. Didn't reserve online so the chick at the desk asked her manager if we could book the suite then and there and....Nope. We were willing to drop 500 (for two nights and three days)!! Plus, it was my first time in Vegas. Went to NY NY and got a killer room with a 2 person hot tub for about $150 less. Maybe I'm bitter but I will probably never look to book a room at the MGM whenever I plan to go back.

Not all all that impressed with this property. First night our shower was backing up, and our neighbors were smoking weed all night, and the room would not cool down. Went to the front desk to change rooms. It was $150 to upgrade our room. We opted out of the upgrade as that was not what we were looking for. Instead we were given a lower floor with a worse view. We are overlooked the airport and parking garage which is very noisy with the jets taking off all day...  We will continue to stay at other resorts moving forward, MGM is not for us!

I'm staying in room 402 on the 19th floor and I go to use the restroom and I stepped in a pile of water and there's water dripping off the ceiling coming out of the light fixture and now the water is getting all over the carpet in the bathroom is flooded so I called the front desk and tell him what's going on and the lady at the front desk doesn't even say she's sorry or maintenance will come right over.  The front desk lady says " how many bags do you have?"  And I told her I don't know?  I just got everything unpacked tonight and said .  And she asked me the question again how many bags do you have and I told her I don't know why do you care what time is it anyway it was 2 o'clock in the morning now it's 2:20 in the morning and I'm still waiting for someone to come and help me.  I originally had to use the restroom and this was all occurring and that hasn't changed and nobody really cares here and nobody's coming and the only thing they care about is how many bags I have where are you I will go stay somewhere else because this is really been a horrible experience they could've at least said I'm sorry specially at 2 o'clock in the morning when there's water coming out of there like fixtures in the ceiling that's kind of dangerous to me because electricity and water don't mix I feel like I could be electrocuted to death or might've been and they don't even care I didn't say they were sorry one time we will move you to a another room which was a worse room.So they said that they would move me back into an accommodating sweet and they put me in this stay well section which the beds are hard as rocks.They get you to come to the hotel by saying you can go to the lazy pool which that's why I came on my whole vacation to go in this pool and now they say oh you have to sign up for a gigantic waiting list they don't tell you but when you check-in you'll have to go be there first or get on a waiting list of 17,000 hours and if you get to make it in the pool well you're lucky so if you go kids and you really want to go to pool or you're celebrating your 55th birthday like I am well you better be sure to get there at 7 o'clock in the morning and stand in line like your head some rock concert because you're not getting in and your children will be disappointed sitting in the hallway like I see mothers with these floaty's sitting there just sitting there and sitting waiting.  How hard is it for children to sit there because I know it's difficult for me.Well I buried my husband who was my best friend and after 251/2 years cancer took him.  Now I'm waiting for hours to get in some stupid pool...I've already cried more tears than al the pools combined.  I just came to escape the smoke in Portland because it was making me sick.

MGM Grand is okay but not fantastic. It just isn't my style I guess. Or maybe COVID just sucks the life out of everything.... probably the latter.We stayed here in July 2020 and it was hard to find food. The resturants all had weird hours - if they were even open at all. Plenty of guests.... I mean the place was packed to the gills but so little food options.We stayed here for the pool.... which is AH-MAZING! Loved the pool and would consider staying here in the summer again just for the pool. We had an issue with our key working on our phone but they upgraded our room for our trouble - which honestly wasn't an issue for us. Those things happen.... but we appreciated the room upgrade. We had a fantastic unobstructed view of New York New York across the street. They provide plenty of complimentary masks and they even had a huge tube of hand sanitizer in the room for us as well as some other little COVID do-dad's.  I might consider giving them another shot after the pandemic is over..... if we ever get there.....

I would give this MGM property a zero if Yelp allowed me to.   Just left there after staying for a 2 night comp they offered.  After the $39.00 resort fee, deposit, resort fee tax and room tax, It cost me almost $300 just to check in.  Then I was locked out of my room after the 1st night because they precharged a a room charge prior to check out.  Because of past fraud issues I lock my card when I am not using it.  Anyways, when my kids and I came back upstairs from the lazy river, our room wouldn't open.   I went downstairs and when they asked me to pay another $100, I told them my wallet was in the room safe.  They preceeded to tell me that my kids and I needed to be escorted by security to get my card from my room.   Are you kidding me?  So security meets us at room,  opened the door,  came in the room without permission and demanded to watch me get my wallet.  In front of my Kids! I refused and told him I needed to drink water, use the restroom and told him he was making me incredibly uncomfortable.  They treated me like a criminal,  I've been going to their properties for years as I am a local and this is how they treat me?  Fast forward the security escorts me back downstairs to give them my card, completely humiliating being escorted by security to the front desk where people are lined up to check in.   Then they tell me they need to charge another $226 instead of $100 to add to my deposit.   Mind you, comped rooms by invitation and less then 24 hours of arriving and only one room charge I have now been charged over $500 on my debit card.  Then, at dinner I went to turn my card back on and they charged another $144 totally unauthorized!  When I called the front desk after dinner they were once again incredibly rude and told me it was for extra incidentals and another resort fee and taxes which I had already paid upon check in.  To top it all off the room was filthy.  Long black hair on the floor and public hair in the shower.  Just a disgusting experience over all.  Caesars properties would never have put my family through such an inconvenience nor would have humilated us in such a manner.  MGM is full of unethical staff and they financially rape people they give comps to for past gambling and stays from conferences.   Unless you're staying in The mansion area or Skylofts, you can bet on low moral and negative energy.

Where to start...The people in the room next door - the conjoined room - smoked marijuana every single day during our 3 day stay. Our room absolutely REEKED of marijuana, almost as if we were smoking inside our room. My boyfriend and I called the front desk multiple times to see if we could re-locate to a different Tower Spa Suite, to which the front desk said they had zero availability. The only thing the front desk persons suggested is that we call the front desk, so that Housekeeping can come upstairs to spray our room with air freshener. Upon the 3rd time calling to get our room air freshened, it took housekeeping over an hour to come up. The housekeeping person even suggested that we re-locate rooms...we told him that front desk said there was no availability. He said there was nothing else he could do other than give us our own bottle of air freshener! Thanks, MGM! You couldn't do ANYTHING for us other than give us a bottle of air freshener. Just FYI... we do not have an issue with marijuana, it just SUCKS waking up and falling asleep to the smell. That's not what we paid for.Our first and second night of our stay, we had no working television service. It was happening periodically both days. By our 3rd day, we weren't having issues with the TV. Overall, I would not recommend the MGM Grand to any of our friends and family. This hotel was very disappointing.

Booked a "Tower spa suit"with a connected "grand queen room" on 8/21/20.Was told on the booking date the rooms will be connected, I double checked with phone rep, telling her I was bringing young adult family members that Needed to be close via the connected room, she confirmed with me, the rooms will be connected. Upon arrival 9/11/20, the check in clerk said your rooms are not connected, I spoke to a manager, he reiterated what she said, he ultimately said all I can do for you is to wave the resort fee. Also asked if I wanted to relocate rooms Saturday night if connecting rooms available ( I said yes, but no connecting rooms available) I told him, I was supposed to have a connecting room available to me right now, he stood his ground, repeating I'm sorry, I asked multiple times how can you make this situation better? He kept saying I'm sorry. Our room was not satisfactory, stains on ceiling, paint chips near doors, window treatments falling apart from the outside. The price was decent, the casino floor was nice, pool situation not good, due to Covid, I'm never coming back to stay at MGM grand, staff unprofessional & couldn't problem solve an issue they clearly botched up. Even with Covid limitations this problem was handled poorly, and I received no call from M life side, explaining the mishap! I felt like I got caught in the old bait and switch routine! Be aware, when booking connected rooms, don't believe what MGM grand says they have available, because upon check in it, it's a gamble on what you will actually get!

Nope. Just nope.Our room still had stuff from the previous guests. Our room smelled like cigarettes and weed. It was incredibly strong everyday, so I think our neighbors were the reason. It was disgusting. Trashy ass people. People screaming and fighting. I'm just gonna leave it at that. We go for the Lazy River. I understand certain protocols would be in place, but their rules are absolutely insane. You either have to be COMPLETELY out of the pool, with a mask unless you're actively eating or drinking, OR in the lazy river but constantly moving through the river. Want to sit with your feet in the water? Not allowed. Want to be submerged in the water, relaxing with your friends on the sides of the river? Not allowed. We ditched the river and hit the adults only pool. I will say, security was on it though. They definitely were doing their best to keep the weirdos out.
MGM is just not the same during Covid. The cocktail waitresses seem over worked and tired. All the hotel employees seem over worked and tired. Are they understaffing? What's going on

Poor Customer ServiceRoom had no hot water had to switch rooms when getting in the new room our air didn't work slept in temp of 89 in our room uncomfortable Room service came in to service our room while we where gone (New Sheets & Towels) where supposed to be brought in, nope only towels they made the bed with the same sheets even when they seen that there was food stain on themthe quality of everything was very poor, definitely understand things are changing but the prices are the same we want good service for what we pay!!Could be cleaner especially while dealing with the COVID-19 situation

This was honestly the WORST Hotel stay I've ever had in my life. Explanation coming but if you read nothing else read this: This hotel is NOT covid safe AT ALL. Their AC cycles air from room to room. We had an employee confirm this after our room smelled like smoke, but we don't smoke, and it didn't smell like smoke when we arrived to it. If cigarette smoke can travel from room to room...so can covid. On to the review. We booked 3 nights. Saturday, our last night of our stay, was free. So we arrived on Thursday night to a parking lot that reeked of cigarette smoke, a lobby that smelled like old hotel, and a front desk person that literally took 35 minutes to tally up and charge us for 3 resort fees. Why it took that long I'll never know. She told us the hotel is non smoking in the rooms. We don't smoke so all good. We finally get to room 1 and it REEKS of cigarette smoke. I don't have a good sense of smell and it was overwhelming for me. Called the front desk and they explained it goes from room to room through the AC system. Great. Now I'm worried about covid but they offer us another room. They recode the keys and we head to the floor below. Our keys aren't working with the elevator anymore. Spend another half hour at the desk fixing the keys. Then we arrive to the second room and no cigarette smell. Great. However, the room is old, dirty, and needs updating. Dust still on the window sill, burnt edges on the mirrors, stained couch, chipped furniture, and sunflower seeds on the floor. Clearly this hotel hasn't had any work done since opening in 93, and isn't cleaned well either. More reason for nervousness with covid. So we sanitized everything and went to bed. Woke up in the morning and the room smelled like cigarette smoke. Again, we don't smoke. So while we're out we decide to cancel our free Saturday night and cash in on a comp night at another hotel. That's right. We cancelled a free night. But we still had to stay Friday night.So we go out for the afternoon and when we get back the room smells even worse of cigarettes. It's a giant ashtray at this point. To top it off there is a loud buzzing that sounds like a vacuum going non stop. We assume it's cleaners next door. GF takes a nap for 40 minutes and wakes up to still buzzing so she calls the front desk who says they will send up maintenance. I didn't want anyone in the room but us and then I went to listen and realized it was the AC that sounded like a vacuum.  I call the front desk and ask for a refund of the resorts fees to which they agreed. They offered a third room change. I reluctantly agreed. While I'm on the phone we get a knock at the door. Probably maintenance since they sent them up. Open the door and it's a security Guard. They sent up security not maintenance. I said we were good, closed the door, and had had enough. We packed, paid for a room at another hotel even though we paid for last night at mgm, and we booked it. I will NEVER go back to mgm grand. Horrible service, dirty, and a covid death trap. Stay away.

Don't go until Covid 19 is over.  The website says pools are open...that's a lie, there are limited details and pools are pretty much closed.  Most restaurants, bars and everything else closed!  Wait until the election infection is over.  Not the real Vegas experience.

This review is based on our 2019 stay:There were many aspects of MGM that I enjoyed, but overall I was rather disappointed with the services provided. I booked this trip to celebrate my boyfriend and my anniversary, because I've heard great reviews, but overall, I don't think I would stay there again.When we were checking in, I asked about our $50 food & beverage credit, and the woman at the front desk gave us a helpful slip listing the restaurants where we could use the credit; she also mentioned that room service & pool service were included, so we were quite frustrated to find out at the end of the stay that it wasn't part of the "food & beverage credit" package....After check in, we were given our room keys and we went up to the room. The room seemed fine at first, but as we started to get settled in, we noticed lots of problems; the TV wasn't working, the phone wasn't working, the shower floor was super dirty, and the shampoo & conditioner in the shower were used (the seals were broken and they looked dirty on the outside). We were so freaking tired from our trip and we just wanted food ASAP so we tried to call room service to use our food and beverage credit (jokes on us- apparently room service isn't included in the credit even though we were told it was, but we only found that out at checkout) and we couldn't reach the kitchen so we called on our cell phone. When someone finally picked up, they said we had to call from a hotel phone. We said "we are in the hotel in our room, but our phone isn't working" and they just hung up on us! So unprofessional!We went down to the front desk to convey our frustrations and they told us we could switch rooms, which we (of course) happily did. When we got to the new room the TV was working and the phone was working, but the light on my boyfriend's side of the bed kept turning on and off periodically without us touching the light switch, which was so annoying when we were trying to sleep. Also, the bed didn't have a sheet cover, which was so gross and it made it difficult for me to sleep soundly; our mattress was straight up exposed underneath the main sheet.... YUCK! SO unsanitary!! I just kept thinking about all the people who had slept on that bed & all the kids who have wet the bed on that mattress; there was no mattress cover to protect us from those germs! -----Fun fact: Most hotels keep their mattresses for 3-7 years so with 365 days in the year and with the beds being occupied on average 2/3 of the year (but most likely even more prior to COVID 19 times), that's 243 days per year (times 3 years is 730 days!)!! That's 243 days per year for the mattress to collect skin cells, body fluids, etc. and without a mattress cover, those skin cells & body fluids are just getting absorbed into the mattress!!!! I mean you never want to see the bare mattress in a hotel especially if the mattress isn't even clean/new and I could tell it was old because of the stains!! It's really unsanitary to have guests sleeping straight on the mattress.I really enjoyed the casino staff, but the hotel staff left much to be desired. During both check in and check out- the attendants weren't smiling much and seemed to have some attitude. As someone who works in the customer service industry, I thought it was bizarre. Especially since the front desk is the first and last interaction that guests have with the business- it should be a positive one.....Also, as I already mentioned, the kitchen hung up on us when we tried to order room service from our cell phone (because our hotel phone wasn't working), which I didn't appreciate.I really didn't like the room itself, but since we had already requested to move, I didn't want to move again. The carpet was sticky and hard in the corner by the mirror/TV, the bed didn't have a mattress cover (again-YUCK!), the bathroom door didn't fully close, and the shower floor was rather grimy.

It is a very large hotel that seems a little out dated , I stay at another property nearby that is more geared towards my tastes.. When. I stay here a balcony suite is the only way tO go, again tho old . Great Staff though, the Butler Service is good too這是一家非常大的酒店,似乎有些過時了,我住在附近的另一家更符合我的口味的酒店。 我住在這裡,陽台套房是老去的唯一方法。 雖然員工很棒,但是管家服務也很好

I recently stayed in the Mgm Labor Day week worse Vegas experience.the grand queen room I stayed in looked nothing like the advertisement,it didn't look cv-19 sanitized,good thing I had my Clorox wipes .the pool I signed up 10 am they didn't call me until 4:37 pm & pool closes at 5 pm best thing is the gym .LADIES & GENTLEMEN DONT STAY AT MGM ....HORRIBLE

Checked in at 4:30pm and room was not ready.  Was informed I would get a call or txt when room was ready.  Had to check front desk at 8:30 pm to see if room was finally ready.  Room was very nice.  Food was great at international smoke.

I have to say I was very disappointed with my last stay. I've stayed at MGM dozens of times. I've actually stayed there 4 times this year alone. We've  even stayed in the presidential suite a few times.. This last experience will be my last experience with them. Theybhad me in the North tower which way on the other side of the casino. After busting the mission to my room we get there and our view was horrible. I know you don't always get the grand view but looking at an ac unit and a wall totally killed my Vegas vibe. This literally sent the tempo for the first night in Vegas which was a total drag! So disappointed!!!

Holy sh*t lol, the MGM has gone down hill! The guests are so trashy, blasting music in the hallways, one guest next door was screaming their head off at her man, something like how she always does everything for him and he still hurts her, she threw his stuff out in the halfway, then she kept saying PERIOD! But then in the other room next to us, these drunk girls were partying, we heard everything. One girl was doing something that her dad would not be happy about in the bathroom, I didn't know what that noise was because I'm a child of God, until the next morning when her and her friends were bragging about it in the bathroom while throwing up hungover. Then one girl said "can I get an ohhhhh yeaaaaaa" but my gf was there with me so I couldn't respond. Point being the walls are paper thin.

Ok so where do I start ? My family and I traveled the 4 hour drive to MGM never staying there before we had heard great things so we wanted to try this hotel. Day 1 after the long drive we finally get to our room after waiting 40 minutes in registration line to get keys which ok Covid less staff I understand but then the hellish nightmare begins. We get into our room finally and our AC is literally blowing out hot air and I mean hot so we call front desk where a woman tells us we have to wait for a work order to be placed so we sit in heat ok bad first impression we wait over an hour on our vacation in our hot freaking room until finally we get upset enough to call front desk again. 15 minutes later finally what must have been a maintenance man about the same age as Father Time knocks at our door comes in and just stares at the unit as if he had no clue what he needed to do mind you family vacation old man trying to fix unit kicking in the vent cover because he couldn't get it on right after just opening a vent further and using a brush to clean the unit. Ok we decide to go out and the man tells us it's fixed and it should work he says should ??? So we get back to room rather late first night in Vegas come back to a hot and I mean hot room at 1 am we call down and request a room change or someone to come back and fix it so our journey begins we go downstairs to speak with Manager a comic book collecting living at home with mom still kinda ass hole who apparently has no idea what manager means but I will get to that later. He gives us a new room and states oh it's a slight upgrade so we are like ok he's trying to make it right this ass hole gives us the wrong room number however when we get to the floor the bell hop is sitting in front of entirely different room number and tells us oh this is the room they told me so we try to open the door after being told room keys transfer but of course keys don't work so at 1:30 am we are walking back downstairs across hotel just to get a freaking key from asshole again who apparently thinks he's a manager. We finally get that taken care of after an hour of walking hotel at 1:30 am in the morning this same manager tells us oh I'm so sorry let me give you a 100 dollar credit to be used ANYWHERE IN Hotel wrong again guys couldn't use it at all this room was about a 1000 bucks and he gives us a 100 dollar credit REALLY !!!! So finally smooth sailing or at least we thought . We call 4 different times for our luggage to be picked up as we sit and wait for over another hour to have our luggage brought downstairs. Seriously people HOSPITALITY apparently is not a word this organization can define , comprehend , or even understand STAY THE HELL AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL AND PRAY THAT THEY LOOSE ENOUGH MONEY DURING THIS PANDEMIC THAT SOMEONE WILL BUY THEM OUT . These people have absolutely no business running a hotel in Vegas  find some educated people to run this place and maybe just maybe you might have a chance in the future. If I was treated this poorly how many others experienced the same thing . Thank you for ruining my family's vacation MGM or should I say Shit Hole Palace  you guys did an amazing job of ruining my daughters  21st  birthday I truly hope you go bankrupt find some real owners who actually RUN THEIR CASINO hell even the MOB organized crime lords understand HOSPITALITY YEAH THEY MIGHT BREAK A FINGER OR TWO LOL BUT THEY AT LEAST CARED ABOUT THEIR GUESTS !!! Will never in my life stay at this place again I hope it burns !!!

They charge you $250 a night and you have to sign up for a pool annnnd if you are lucky maybe if you sign up friday you will get it by monday when you check out already. And the lady's best response when I got upset I was waiting for 7 hours to get into the pool on 113 degree weather, was WELL SIR THERE ARE PEOPLE THAT'S BEEN WAITING FOR 9 HOURS! So basically you paying $250 to just sleep! So be smart about it! Very very disappointed!

Horrible experience we came to stay here for the long weekend and we couldn't get In to the Pool due to them meeting there capacity but why would they book that way my 10 year old daughter wanted to Come for that!! NEVER STAYING HERE AGAIN!!!

Where do I start.... while we found our view of the AC units funny it was just the tip of the ice berg.The hotel room:-As I was showering I began to smell something funny and then it hit me it was weed! Now I don't smoke my husband doesn't and my baby most certainly does not either. So someone above us or below was smoking and the smell made it to our room. It's even funnier when you realize it's a smoke free hotel.-having to hear the planes taking off all throughout the night and the loud music of people coming back at 3 amThe pool- we stood in line it moved fairly quickly we got chairs, however my first mistake was going to the bathroom. When I tried going into the pool area we where in I wasn't allowed because they were at capacity. So I had to wait to go be with my husband and baby. So once I was in I tried going into the pool, but surprise surprise the pool itself was at capacity. Now I would of understood this if it wasn't for the fact I witnessed people going in and out but I wasn't allowed to go in really? Never staying here again

Do NOT stay here during this time. There are several better options on the strip that are better prepared to handle the current environment. This is my 3rd time to Vegas in the past 2 months and the Paris has been excellent. Their customer service is horrible and managers seemed too overwhelmed to correct situations handled incorrectly. I ordered room service at 10 AM, called back at 12pm because I had not yet received my order. I was told the lady had just left and was on her way up. 1 pm comes around and at this point I just call to cancel the order and make sure I don't get charged. When I call back again Sharlene says there is no order showing in the system. I call the front desk to make sure I won't get charged, and they tell me they have to do an "investigation" before they can assure I won't get charged. Investigate what? The food never came, Sharlene in the kitchen (who I talked to each time I called) just stated she never even put in the order. Then to top it all off they even tried to charge my tip for food I never RECEIVED. STAY AWAY unless you have money to waste.Update: Charlene (manager) ended up getting everything resolved and the order taken off. She apologized that it took so long. That's who I recommend you speak to if you're in need of a resolution.

I could go on about the pure shitness of this place but I'm next in line to get tested for covid after leaving the Bates Motel.P.S. if you are ordering room service you better hope you don't get Charlotte because HONETYY is going thru it.

Customer service is horrible.  From the moment I walked in at express check in.  The attendant walks me through the first set and when it asks to scan your phone, the attendant left, I had to go find her.  The western Bar/restaurant I stood at the entrance as two guys behind the bar and two bar tenders looked at me. After a few minutes I walked in , only to be challenged by a gentleman for walking in with a beer.  He said, Dump it or drink it out side... well that could have been handled differently.. like sir, you can't bring that in here , but you can finish it outside the bar, or something more friendly.

MGM was very clean with workers making sure everything was disinfected and well maintained. I stayed for 3 nights. My room was a regular king suite, MGM even included a little care package with masks and hand gel due to COVID-19. Staff was extremely helpful! The hand washing stations with masks made me feel comfortable. Great job MGM! I'll definitely be coming back!

The valet parking is unavailable right now but no big deal since the parking garage has enough space. The mobile check in was easy to use just make sure you have the MGM app already downloaded on your phone.  You have a digital room key on your phone but it's strongly suggested you get a room key card in case your phone battery dies. Keep in mind you need a room key to access the elevators. And you only get access to your own floor. Which makes it very inconvenient when the ice machine on the 7th floor isn't working and held together with duct tape. I reported it to the staff but nothing changed. And you can't use the stairs unless it's an emergency. But at least the staff was friendly and the room and hotel was clean.

We just spent a weekend in Vegas. We booked online (Expedia or Priceline- don't remember) & stayed at MGM. Prior to- we were a little concerned over the pool situation. Some folks were saying it's first come, first serve & others were saying book chairs or a cabana or you won't get in. Since I knew there would be no shows or clubs open - being at the pool was vital. So I booked lounge chairs for Saturday & cabanas for Sunday & Monday. Although pretty spendy to book- it was worth it. I didn't have to stress over trying to find chairs or somewhere to put stuff down. Saturday & Sunday were extremely busy. So much so, they had two check-ins & waiting lists for those that didn't make it in before 10am. Yes! 10am...by that time they were reaching full capacity (1/2 due to COVID) & you would need to get on a wait list. Hence if you have reservations you don't have to worry about that. The staff were super friendly... Especially our assigned Cabana staff- Byron & Gary. Those fellas did awesome & were super helpful & very personable! As far as the hotel. Yes they had masks, hand sanitizers available everywhere.  Some restaurants were closed, which was a bummer. So we left to other areas to eat. One thing that really bothered me was the constant smell of marijuana. Although there are signs discouraging from smoking it, there is nothing in place to stop it- I must say that I gladly wore my mask to help with the MJ smell. Lastly they had mobile check in. We tried doing it because we preferred that option, but the system could not find our reservation, so we had to stand in line & get key cards. Which was no big deal since it only took about 15min. But if you can do mobile check in I would highly recommend. Also not sure how new this feature is, but one thing I noticed is that your key card only takes you to your floor & the lobby. So if you get on the elevator & don't have key card you can't even ride up to your floor unless you get lucky & the person next to you is going to the same floor. I kind of like this added safety feature. All in all not the same Vegas, but we made it work. If you are going just for pool, gambling & people watching then you should have no issues.

The MGM made fraudulent charges on my room and credit card for the mini bar which was NEVER touched. They also did this to my friend who staying with me. They charged multiple room service orders when it should have only been one. After a nice relaxing weekend, it's so unfortunate to have to deal with this. The checkout and billing process has been a nightmare. I was refunded the mini bar charges, but I literally have hundreds of dollars worth of charges to my room and my bill still doesn't match up. I'm still having to call back and deal with it.The MGM is a nice stay if you don't mind them stealing all your money by the end of it. This review would have been very different if this didn't happen. We had such a nice time at the pool!

I am so disgusted on how the MGM Grand treated and harassed my husband (Veteran with severe PTSD)on our 10th anniversary vacation (July 9th-July 12). We arrived to the MGM Grand Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas on July 9. That day everything was great. On July 10th, we rented pool bed pod on the lazy river. Again we were having a great time until a woman came up to our pod and stole our MGM Grand gold lion souvenir. At the time me and my husband were in the lazy river in front of our pod when the woman stole it and my husband walked up to her as she was trying to get into the lazy river to run off with it. He stopped her (no physical contact was made), told her that the souvenir did not belong to her and that he witnessed her stealing, drinking from it, and trying to get away. She confessed and my husband took the souvenir from her. I followed her around the lazy river because I want to make sure that security would kick her and her party out of the pool and hotel before she strike at another person's property. The security came and I identified to the them where the woman was, details on what she looked like and what she was wearing. The security guard saw the woman and told me that they would be on it. I walked back to my pod and I find my husband pissed off because not only did the woman try and steal the souvenir, my husbands wallet was missing $100 bill and our pod looked like like It was rummaged through. A total 4 security guards came to us to get more info. We explained again what had happen and the security guards told us again that they were on it and they will question the woman if they see her. My husband found her and her party back at their beach chairs getting ready to leave. My husband explained to the security guards were she was. They didn't care enough to see where or anything. My husband was very angry and irritated as we left the pool. Once we came back into the building my husband was was like 30ft In front of me and I notice a security guard yelling at my husband to put a mask on. I ran and told the security guard that we were sorry because I had his mask in my bag and we just came from a ordeal outside and forgot to put them on. He was rude and said I don't care he needs to have it on ( I've seen many people at the hotel not wearing a mask and nobody treated them in this manner). I told the security sorry again. This security guard just kept badgering and harassing my husband which cause to trigger his PTSD. My husbands body stiffen like a rock his fist clenched to his sides. I explained to the security guard they he has PTSD you harassing him is making matters worse. The security guard perceived that as aggression towards and said that my husband raise his fist at him which was a lie.He did not raise his hand to the security guard. At that point the security guard called for back up and yelled at me and my husband that we were we trespassing. The security guards back-up came and escorted us to a side door in the hotel to the outside. The formation of the security guards felt like they were trying to jump and beat us up. And yet the security guards were still harassing my husband, which was making the situation even worse. I can see my husband ready to explode. So I took the necessary action to defuse the highly volatile situation cause by the harassment of the security guards by shoving my husband to the floor before he actually explodes and hurts someone or himself. Once my husband was on the floor, I tried to kneel next to help Him understand where he was, who I was, and to apply DPS (deep pressure stimulation) which can help calm down the nervous system in people with PTSD. Then security grabbed me by my arms leaving me bruised. As I was trying to explain the the security guards again about my husbands PTSD, I seen one of the security guards arms go around my neck and his foot on my foot, he threw me Down on the floor. They handcuffed my husband and in the struggle his knees were bleeding ( they did not assist him with first aid). They let me up after they took my husband inside. I got up and notice my left had was hurting. I grab my stuff and they escorted me to a lunch room in the security building. I explained to the security guards that they need more training when it comes to dealing with PTSD. The supervisor security guard came to tell me that the police were on there way. When the police came they told me they were called for domestic violence. I was shocked. I explained to the police the situation. She went to look at the video tape of the incident. She then came back and told me they I was correct on what I did to diffuse the situation and no charges were to be filed. The supervisor security guard then told me we have been evicted and now considered trespassing on the property. I hope that anyone interested in going to the MGM Grand in Las Vegas reads this review and understands how the MGM Grand treats veterans or any of their guests.

I checked into the MGM Grand Hotel in Las Vegas on August 26. On the way to the pool, the ground was slippery, which caused me to fall and seriously hurt my knee. I couldn't walk. I was disappointed!!!!

So I booked through southwest vacations and let's just say it had to been a lot of small writing.The hotel for the most part was very clean from what I saw. There were mask and hand sanitizer all over. Their is plenty of signs all over to promote social distancing and the staff made sure to remind guest to wear their mask over their nose and mouth.As far as everything else with the hotel... so I did mobile check in it was very easy with mobile check in you can check in and out your room and your key card is also on your phone. Which you need a key in order to work the elevators. I was aware that their was a security deposit so that wasn't my issue my issue is that I didn't know it was going to be $300.00. I was thinking around $150 so it would Of been nice to know the full price before I arrived but whatever I know better next time. They have a fridge that you can't use and if you do take anything out you have to pay and no microwave. The store that has the snacks is wayyy over priced but if your desperate you have no choice. Their were only a few spots to eat that were open at the mgm that wasn't really a issue for me. However make sure you bring CASH and watch out for those people trying to sale timeshares  their is literally 2 of them on each block. Between them and the cartoon characters trying to get tips for pictures good luck.I will return to Vegas just not to stay at mgm it's cool but just not for me!

My room was downgraded/missing amenities that I paid extra for. The cleaning staff stole jewelry from out of my room (yes, I am certain, or I would not otherwise make such a claim) and did absolutely nothing to clean or tidy the room other than make the bed. We had lights shining directly in our windows at night and the main lighting inside the room was burnt out. This wasn't one of the $30 a night rooms either, it was a king suite, so I can imagine what the bargain room experience is like. I will say the most of the staff I interacted with directly were friendly, although everyone seemed to have a different understanding of what the rules were. I would strongly urge folks to stay elsewhere.

Absolutely the most horrible hotel you can ever choose to stay specially if you want to get some relief from your stressful life. The room is disgusting and dirty and imagine during Covid19 this is absolutely wrong choice to pick this hotel. The most unprofessional staff who doesn't have a bit of respect for their customers. If you want to choose this hotel, my recommendation is THINK TWICE. I asked for a manager in lobby ro go over what's going on guess what...!!!it has been 11 minutes to talk to someone and no one is not even coming to talk to me. MY God, this place is horrible. That's it.

I booked my trip, through American Express, for a few buddies and I to get away for the weekend.As I always do with every Vegas trip, I request a room upgrade. Unfortunately, they were booked to capacity and was denied. Okay, no biggie and my loss due to COVID regulations. So it goes.Firstly, the demographic of the MGM has just hit rock bottom. From what I've heard from locals I know, downtown has a cleaner group of guests. Again, nothing to really be bothered about; maybe the MGM did some marketing campaign to a specific income demographic or whatever, simply to increase their occupancy and I get it. No fault of theirs, just keeping rooms full.So, I get to my suite and the first thing I noticed is the blackout curtains are tattered and frayed at the ends due to the sunbeams coming through them. Yeah, a little upkeep would be nicer.Lay my bags open in the closet, go to the bathroom to shower, and I notice the wallpaper is peeling off the walls. I'm sure someone had to' have seen this and reported to "engineering." I'll get to this later. I take a shower and the bathroom floods... More than likely because of the cracked shower base.After I finish mopping up my own bathroom, I call the front desk to tell them I can't do this and officially requesting a room change and don't care how much I have to pay. The concierge apologized and transferred me."Engineering..." The phone responds.Evidently the policy of the MGM is to now have their guests submit their own work orders as their hotel falls apart. Okay, I'm over it... Two of my buddies arrive and I meet them in their rooms.The first thing one of them says is that he just turned down a room upgrade so we could all share the same floor. Wtf?!? Turned around, got on the phone again to tell them this is not tolerable. They immediately transferred me to engineering again to submit another work order. This is like a comedy movie at this point. I didn't know if I should just leave, complain more, or what. Unfortunately, there were four rooms checked and six people would have to change to other hotels on the same day. Not going to happen because of my bad luck. I accept my fate and vow to never stay at the MGM again.On my way over to the second buddy that checks in. His room had the cute security badge over the door/jam stating that the MGM cleans and sanitizes each and every room. That would be great if it was actually done because there was foundation and long hairs all over the bathroom.Gross!!!!I immediately got on the phone with American Express to tell them that they need to help me out since they were my booking agent. The rep was pleasant as can be and ended up apologetic as possible saying that the MGM was no assistance with them and that American Express was filing some type of formal complaint because of how inappropriate this was.Okay, I'm not even close to being done!!!On Saturday night, all my friends passed out, I decided to go gamble a little. As soon as I walk out of the elevator lobby and onto the casino floor, this older ratchety lady, probably mid 60s, walks up alongside me, with a 6'5" God awful tall thug behind her. She politely asked if I'd like to party. I declined and walked on... Not the first time I'd been solicited by a streetwalker. She then pulled down her face mask, half her teeth were missing as she says "I'll suck yo d***."Bursting into laughter, I declined again while the pimp pulled her by the arm to find another victim.As I made my way to the card tables, I noticed that the casino was a full-blown brothel!!! I'm not talking bunny ranch or 5 - 7 rating type stuff. I'm talking the darkest part of the alleys must have a direct connection to the casino at the MGM because it was full of real-life pimps and hos!!!!I can't even tell you how awkward it was seeing some 30-something guy playing the slots while a street walking prostitute is sitting in front of him spread eagle, all while a pimp is standing tall behind his property.This is not a fabrication in the slightest. If you want to walk down this reality, just walk through there at 5am on a Saturday morning! When I saw security walking around while all this was going on It was then that I realized this has to be blasted on the net. Apparently management must know about this because it just happens in broad and open view of security cameras and actually armed security!It's only a matter of time before they find woman dead in the casino with needles hanging out of their arms or gang violence kills someone.Whatever you do, if you value a clean room and no problems, and probably if you like security, spend an extra $50-100 and go to the Cosmo, Wynne, encore, I mean, heck... ANYWHERE!!!Also, I placed a complaint with the MGM, no response through their review service, and no response. American Express responded with apologies on their behalf though.Never going to an MGM show, venue, or hotel again.That's just my two cents.

We had a rough start upon check-in. Our first room was dirty so the front desk quickly moved us to another room. Upon arrival to the second room, we were punched in the face with a weed and cigarette smell in our room. Both housekeeping and security(Carlos) were helpful trying to pinpoint the smell and providing us with an air freshener. Unfortunately the smell got stronger and we were needing to move rooms once again. We went down to the front desk pretty frustrated and wanting to speak to a manager. We worked with Cecilia at the front desk and she was amazing. Incredibly friendly, compassionate, and comepletly turned our experience at MGM around. She showed really strong leadership skills and was extremely professional. Definitely an employee that stands out and reccomend requesting her at check-in.

Wanted to get away for a couple days with my family so we decided to book here.  After we got settled in we noticed our television wasn't working, I called downstairs to the front desk and told them the issue. the attendant said she'd send maintenance right away. A couple of hours go by and still nothing. I call back and speak to someone else who lets me know that maintenance is gone for the night and that they'd send someone first thing in the morning and to comp for my troubles the "resort fees" for the first night would be taken off.  Morning comes and maintenance man arrives and is fixing the television, while working the desk glass breaks. He calls downstairs and request a room change, we pack up and go downstairs to the front desk to get our new room keys (while my niece was in virtual school) when we encountered an employee who was actually a "Karen" she said "they can wait in line like everyone else" and instructed us to go to the end of line. I refused- having already been inconvenienced by a faulty room the last thing, I was going to do was wait in a long line especially since my niece had to get back to school!  I then asked to speak to a manager because the Karen at the front desk had a really bad attitude. "Darrin Goodly" the hotel operations manager said he would exclude the resort fees for my entire trip. Upon check out I ended up having to paying the fees that were suppose to have been excluded. Very annoyed, disgusted and turned off by the MGM and their staff, please be aware if you plan on staying at this hotel Chances are you're gonna have faulty hotel electronics,broken furniture and rude front desk employees in the form of a Karen.

I feel this hotel casino is pretty outdated compared to some others on the strip. Caesars is outdated too but at least spacious and convenient to get around. MGM does not have that set up, rooms are cramped. I felt unsafe in the self parking. I felt unsafe in the dog park that was more a get together spot (speaker set up and all) for weed smokers. I just didn't like the vibe at all this weekend. It was very crowded and felt unsafe overall to me, I went home and left pretty early.

No hot water in one of the two bathroom sinks, the shower or the tub, trash found under the couch, no trash cans, non working television, and the armchairs in the living area were visibly very dirty. Suite number was 27-341. After complaining, was moved to the same suite but a floor down 26-341. Was comped a night sans resort fees and taxes for the mess before. Get into the new suite, no hot water again and this time, the electricity in the bathroom did not work nor was the a/c working properly. Also found a pair of children's underwear hidden by the curtains on the side of the nightstand.  Filed another complaint. The issues with the lack of hot water and the thermostat were not addressed until the following morning; the day we were checking out; there was no point by then.How is housekeeping getting away with not properly cleaning the rooms? With the amount of money those suites cost, more care and concern should be exhibited. I will never stay at the MGM again. One incident is maybe just a coincidence but having several problems on different days shows that there is a problem here.

Disgusting and disappointed.My wife and I booked a suite for our anniversary. Sewage and clumps of hair bubbled up into our shower. Art on the wall was stained from prior flood damage. The desk had mold and chunks missing underneath the glass tabletop. The air conditioning barely worked. Management was not available despite visiting the front desk and calling twice.I'd chalk it up to bad luck, but the condition of the room was inexcusable. youtu.be/-unPnPb26fAyoutu.be/l-0ADAdmqWk10/10 would not stay again. This was nothing but a grand disappointment.

Stayed at MGM during this shut down 8/21-8/24 - i would advise staying away from Vegas until things open back up! 2-3 people working checkins on a Friday afternoon - 30-40 minute wait, room service took over a hour, pools you can get in unless you're there by 9:30am - otherwise you sit on a texting que with no answer about how long it will take - both Fri/Sat never got in ... Sunday got access at 1pm ... Pool rules are insane! Mind you, I'm not a crazy anti masker - but you gotta wear one regardless of anyone is within 50ft of you or  (straight to jail).... because SCIENCE ... you sit with your feet in the water (jail), Slide fully in the water you're good .... while at your chair if you're drinking your beer no prob ... as soon as you stop drink - believe it or not - straight to jail Anyways - don't waste your time! No bars open, service is waaaay slow typical standards while rates and resort fees stay the same!

Overall not a bad place to spend teekend, but if you're going to charge me $15 for a chill cheese dog - please make it a good one, not one that tastes and looks like it came from an elementary school cafe.Check-in  was greatBellman were completely understaffed, but did their best,Food was overpriced and poor quality (tasted like a school cafeteria)Rooms weren't clean - wtf?  Trash under the dresser. Hair in the sink.We were in bed and people came walking  into our room - they issued keys to new people that just checked in. - wtf?Service was slooow.  Again not the workers fault, staffing wasn't scheduled correctly.This is not a COVId19 issues - I was in Vegas a few weeks and stayed at Encore and It was great !!MGM is no linger a 5* hotel

Disappointed!!! Was excited to book this hotel for 1 night while on my way to Zion. The main reason for booking the MGM was so that my 12 year old daughter could enjoy the pool area. After we checked in which was pretty easy, we attempted to access the pool area. My family was stopped by security and told that the pool was at capacity and we would need a reservation. Since we only booked for 1 night we did not get to enjoy the pool area in the 107 degree heat. My complaint with the front desk was met with no sincerity and the manager did not car either. At no point was I advised we needed to reserve a pool time. Not prior to our booking nor at check in. Once again, very disappointed. Further, the hotel is at best a 3 star compared to other Las Vegas hotels.

I love gambling at the MGM it has a nice size and not overcrowded with slot machines and players . Plenty eatery's and shops for miscellaneous needs. I wish there were more floor waitresses there is Def a shortage . But overall I recommend

I would have given this hotel a better rating but this was the best they deserve. Truthfully I understand it's during a pandemic and their are certain rules we have to follow but it's getting a little ridiculous. I had a fun time when I first got here.
