My husband rented a day bed at the pool and they told us we had to keep our mask on even if we were just sitting there which I understand and complied. They said that we don't have to wear it if we are actively drinking or eating. Of course I had my mask on at all times but right when when i pull my mask down to drink my water someone would come running over and tell me to put on a mask. They would tell me to put on a mask while the water bottle in my mouth. At first I'm was okay with it since they were just doing there job, but they kept on doing it like they were singling us out. Every time my husband and I would take a drink they would come right over. I would see groups of people walking by with no mask and no drink and they wouldn't say a thing. Oh and also the lifeguards were not wearing their masks either. And they were doing exactly what we were doing. Sitting there! So I mean it's a weird time right now. I would just wait for this too all pass before you stay at a strip hotel in order to have fun.

If you are coming to Vegas you can stop by for a picture but besides that spend a little more money to stay somewhere nicer and cleaner. This place is cheap and you will get what you pay for, so go somewhere else. My car was only parked for a few hours and had a badge removed, doesn't feel safe to have my car here. The casino is dull and smells like smoke. The room was not well cleaned. Windows had smears inside. Carpet wasn't vacuumed properly. Hopefully they rebuild this place soon or tear it down.

Been here 19 times.  This time it was terrible.  Slow service.  Couldn't go to the pool once.   All the restaurants are closed and room service stops at 2 pm.  You can eat overpriced nasty food in the food court.  25 dollars for a cheesesteak and fries Also. It must have been an all black lives matter event at the hotel.  Disgusting people spitting on the floors, fighting with people.    With no pool access we stayed in our room for 3 days.

This sucks made reservations to enjoy a weekend in the pool and we cannot get in.  Vegas sucks will not come back until covid ends.  Working hard in the medical field to not be able to enjoy a weekend in the pool and sun very upsetting
first time we stayed at the MGM hotel we did not sleep because of the excessive noise of the people in the hallway you could hear the noise outside ... I will never stay in this hotel again

Man, I'd really love to rate MGM higher......I remember back in the 90's this place was the Queen of the strip, but not so much anymore.  She's worn out and dilapidated.  Room service ends at 2pm, huh??  Are you kidding me?  Who the heck is ordering room service at 2pm??  How about 10pm-6am, your in vegas for goodness sake.  We were there in July 2020, on a good note, they are very COVID Compliant, cleaning all the time.  Food options are limited, so plan accordingly, late night options are subway, johnny rockets, and pizza place??  That's fine for your kids, but wifey is going to want something more.  My recommendation, skip MGM and book at Venetian or Bellagio and have a higher-level experience.

MGM resorts typically take very good care of their guests. Except, for Greg in security and his coworker decided to make it a poor experience. I will tell you about the good first.When I first came to Vegas about a couple of years ago, we were supposed to stay at MGM Grand. Lyft at the time (in fact, they never had it together until COVID) could not figure out the difference between MGM and the Mariott. So, the driver took us to MGM, but obviously she couldn't figure it out and thought that I was at fault. Lyft is messed up, trust me, I know since I drove for them.We ended up at Signature by mistake, which is on the other side of MGM Grand. Even though it was not MGM's error, they automatically switched us over to Signature. This was very cool and I loved Signature and have not really been back. This time, because of the pandemic, Park MGM closed. They were very helpful again and switched our room and comps over to MGM Grand. I totally forgot this was where I was going to be some time ago! Great! I got to stay at MGM Grand. So far, they have been taking very good care of us. Their hotels are elegant and they provide fantastic customer service.The security, however,is in desperate need of training. So, I realize that nobody really knows what to do during the pandemic. I get it and I cannot imagine working directly with the public right now and I am very thankful that I DO NOT work in public ANYMORE. Please note that I have been wearing a mask prior to people freaking out over toilet paper. I am pro-mask and I wear it any time I go out. I am cozy with a mask!So, I was sitting at a slot machine with a hot cup of coffee. My drink was sitting next to me and I would pick it up every so often to see if it cooled. I am actively trying to take a drink. Next thing, the security guy tapped on my shoulder, "I'm afraid you will have to put your mask on." I guess I have to drink with a mask. My business partner tells me that I must be holding the drink. As I played on, the security guy was lingering nearby. I was thinking hopefully, he will be present when I am drinking because I know exactly what he is doing. He was only watching me and waiting to hassle me. So, I begin to drink again and this time I am holding me drink. He tapped on my shoulder again, "I know you don't like wearing a mask, but I'm afraid you will have to wear it." So, now he is lecturing me of all people about the mask? Really? Really. I cooley ask for his name and he said "Greg" and he continued to go on his tangent about me being an anti-masker. I stopped him dead in his rhetoric, "Greg, I have been watching you walk back and forth over here and you are harassing me." I am sure he was intimidated, who back talks security in Vegas? My business partner stifled a laugh and he joined, "She was holding her drink." Greg starts to bail and continues to talk about masks being required and walks away from me. I told him, "I'll be talking to your supervisor, Greg." Yep, I went in for the kill because this stopped him in his tracks and he comes back to repeat himself, but it was a lost cause. I scared him off, but his coworker was lingering now. We went to the other side of the casino. I see security, but not as often as Greg. Everyone is drinking their drink without a mask, playing holding their drink without a mask, and people have their mask under their nose and removing the mask to speak. In addition to this, Greg ignored social distancing guidelines. The slot machines are filthy with spills and ash and the last dirty hands that touched it. Why was I singled out by Greg? Due to the other resorts being closed at the last minute they were jam packed with people so again I was rubbing elbows with everyone and drunk people were getting in my space and other patrons were crowding into the elevator when there was a limit of 4 people! MGM Grand may possibly be another victim of the pandemic. Vegas does not have a way to recover from the pandemic since they police the wrong people and do not place a limit on how many people can enter.

I do not suggest staying at the MGM Grand hotel. They will lure you in with low prices on google or travel sites.  However, once you get here you have resort fees which you GT no benefit.  No refrigerator in rooms, at check in I was given the wrong keys, the mlife staff guy acted annoyed to be working, and when we went down to the pool to see what we had to do for our reservation pod which we paid 160.00 dollars for the guy at the pool gate told me that there is no guarantee that we would get into the pool area even with the reservation.  I then received a phone call from Anthony telling me no matter what I would get in and that the other guy was wrong. Real organized! This is not a COVID-19 issue. This is let's see what else we can get out of them.

Kinda disappointed, brought my family here. The hotel entrance is way too far the parking area too long of a walk for older people. Also they charge $20 for a small pool float and $24 for the biggers ones to use in lazy river. And casino although nice smelled to much of marijuana and cigarettes! Probably will not return again or refer to my family back home.

Awful Covid management at this hotel.100 degrees pool side and no one within 50 ft of me but the second my mask dropped below my nose I was swarmed by security.However it's ok to be smoking without a mask on foran extended period of time. Covid fears smoke and people within 6 ft of each other in the pool.At the very least, you can tell the employees find the rules insane but are just doing their job.
One of the worst hotels on the strip.  Hotel does not actively enforce patrons to wear masks, too many people entering the hotel.Do not come to this hotel!!
Stayed at mgm around 10 years ago. Absolutely huge and stunning facility. Plenty of activities and fun to get in. Conveniently located at the beginning of the Vegas strip.

Let me start off by saying I have stayed in Vegas over 100 times and frequent MGM Grand during these stays.  I will never stay at this hotel again, ever.On July 17 my wife and I were celebrating our 26 year anniversary and decided to call it an early night and came back our suite to enjoy some takeout food and went to bed. Shortly before midnight, we were awoken by pounding on our door and the phone ringing in the room.  I answered the phone and was told that security was at the door and I needed to answer.  As I answered the door and to my surprise, there were 2 uniformed security guards, a security supervisor, and 4 Las Vegas Metro Police Officers waiting for me.  They told me to step outside where I was handcuffed, searched, and questioned while my wife was also pulled out of bed and questioned.A report of domestic abuse had come in and MGM security directed the responding officers to my room after "verifying on CCTV" that the suspect (me) had entered my room.  This is impossible because I had only left the room once to go get ice for dinner.After realizing that nothing was going on, the officers and security left just as quickly as they came, and at this point my wife was terrified.I called the security supervisor on duty who turned out to be extremely arrogant who offered nothing more than just a procedural explanation for what occurred.I then called the front desk and asked for the manager on duty who finally had offered some sort of apology for what had happened and assured me that either the security director would contact me, or one of the directors of the hotel.To this date, I have heard nothing from the hotel. I am by no means a whale where my money would make a difference to the resort, just a regular patron who was involved in an incident that could have been handled in a serious, sympathetic, and professional way. In a hotel that can tell what time it is on someone's watch with their camera system, I find it very likely that someone did not do their due diligence in investing where to send police.I write this poor review not because of the incident, but because of managements lack of taking ownership of what happened and offering a simple, "we made a mistake, we are sorry" by contacting me.I have made the decision to never stay at the property in the future, and for what it's worth sold my shares that I had in MGM resorts.

While we understand it's a pandemic and we are trying our best to adhere to the rules, I find it absolutely ridiculous that one of the pool attendants kept coming up and picking on us for the smallest of things (we were following the rules fyi). He walked up to us 5 times and made it a point to make us a target while other people around us were not following the rules. When we made it a point that he was doing so he was being really rude to us and not going to anyone else, he was being more rude. My first time in Vegas and that really ruined my perception on MgM and this whole city. Soooo annoying.

Honestly this room didn't meet my expectations, first off i found trash inside one of the drawers, and after looking into pictures, i didn't get a bath robe, we got the tower spa suite, and was missing the bathrobes, the wall paper ripped off! very disappointed, also in the pictures it shows a nice view, and for me just nothing! A green light that's all the view i get

Dirty as h*ll. Tv in both rooms didn't work. Ice machines didn't work. No fridge/microwave. Also, 90% of crowds were  ghetto as can be. Workers were so lazy idk how they have a job. Dirty elevators, dirty hallways, very run down Won't stay here again.

I really appreciate the safety measures MGM has in place during the pandemic. Hand washing stations and hand sanitizer are available throughout the casino, and masks (required at all times) are located by the elevators.  All bars are closed except the ones that serve  food. Expect to pay $16 and up for a cocktail, and food must be ordered with drinks (even if it's a tray of dollar pretzels). Many visitors must have known about this because they came with their own beer. I carried around my Hydro Flask filled with alcohol, and it wasn't an issue. Cocktail waitresses still serve complimentary drinks while gambling. Because of physical distancing requirements, the number of people at the tables is extremely limited. It's especially hard to get a spot at roulette and poker in the evenings. Slot machines were fine and stillpaying out despite the hardships the casinos are facing. The district restaurants and shops close early, so plan accordingly. As a matter of fact, most shops on the strip closed by 7pm. I cannot stress this enough: book your chair/daybed/cabana the moment you book your room. The pool is operating at limited capacity, and many guests were angry because it was full and they couldn't get in. Believe me, you want a spot by that lazy river. It was quiet and so relaxing! Our server was outstanding, the food was delish, and the cucumber cooler was so refreshing. It cost a fortune, but we expected that. I brought in a small MGM bag with some beers, and it wasn't an issue. Masks must be worn at all times unless you're in the pool or ACTIVELY eating/drinking. We saw some anti-maskers rightfully get kicked out after a couple of warnings. I even got told to put it on in between sips. The double beds in the west wing were so uncomfortable, but the room was nice and clean. I brought my Lysol and sprayed everything for extra precaution. A complimentary bag with masks, sanitizer, and two styluses will be waiting for No valet available, but there is complimentary parking in the structure. It's a long hike, so pack lightly. Do bring a gallon of water and sunblock with you because it's expensive to buy here. We had a fantastic time, and I never felt like my health was in jeopardy. I will definitely stay at MGM again.

Of the MGM properties that I have stayed at, my stay at this hotel was the worst experience yet.The bulk of the hotel staff were rude and not engaged. One of their front desk managers was downright snotty.The hallways and rooms wreaked of the odor of pot. So much for noon smoking rooms. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Not the MGM i remember.  This place is a dump.  Room smells like cigars, finger prints all over frigerator and cabinets and this is suppose to be sanitized?  What a joke.  Called guest service they said they want send me an air freshener and an ionizer..

I stayed this hotel request Non smoking room with my two Kidd's but the whole floor was smelling weed couldn't sleep my wife allergy to it I call guess service name Theresa very rude she said we can't control that I wonder when I check in they said all rooms are in the hotel non smoking this place worst than a motel MGM I will never stay in here any more super bad

Went on vacation this past weekend and stayed here, and it was the worst experience ever. I totally understand the COVID rules and all for them, but there were so many people wearing no mask and not following the rules. Not only that, but every single day the hotel lobby, casino, parking structure, rooms, and hallways smelled like weed out entire stay. There were so many rude, loud, obnoxious, annoying people staying there that the hotel had so many extra security there. My family and I have been staying here for the last 5 years, and we will not be staying here anymore.

We have stayed here plenty of times always had a good experience we know coming to Vegas during a pandemic it would be different I applaud the hotel for the Precautions taken hand sanitizer mask and sink washing hands that's why I gave 2 star you can see workers Clearly  sanitizing But, the hotel needs more security Walking thru lobby casino it seem everyone was smoking weed , people not wearing mask Was there 3 days and unable to go in pool due to full capacity I understand no valet but why Iam being charged resort service their was no resort  experience not even close ghetto people hanging in and outside hotel saw 2 fight s outside hotel Someone clearly not staying hotel was in elevator sneaking in drunk not happy at all will not be staying here again

It pains me to write this review, as my family and I have been loyal MGM visitors for years. We visit Las Vegas and stay at MGM approximately three times per year, always in the Marquise Suite. We are Mlife platinum cardholders, and have the credit card as well. Unfortunately, after our most recent stay, we have decided to take our business elsewhere.  We are returning home today after a four night stay at MGM, which was unlike any other.  Although the experience at the pool was a joke, and many of our favorite restaurants were closed....it was to be expected due to the Covid pandemic and wasn't a serious cause of concern. The issues which cannot be overlooked are two-fold:First, our suite wreaked of sewer water. The smell would come and go throughout the day. We did request our suite be serviced and were advised that it is the water in Las Vegas and nothing could be done about it. As previously mentioned, we always stay in this suite and never previously experienced  the issue. Further, if MGM is aware of the stinky problem they should do something to mitigate the issue (i.e. air filtration system, air deodorizing system, etc...). Under no circumstance should patrons pay the hefty price of a suite and  have to endure  a stink like that. Disgusting!!Secondly and more importantly, was the change in clientele at MGM.  The patrons were unlike anything I previously experienced. It was terrifying. I have never been afraid to be on the casino floor, however this past weekend was a different story.  Many patrons were relatively young, loud, aggressive and confrontational. Although I have come to expect there will always be a bad element in the evenings, as some can't handle the booze they have consumed, I never expected to feel unsafe throughout the day. Although there were a good number of security within the casino, I didn't feel they did anything to control inappropriate behavior that permeated the entire casino. It began the minute you exited the elevator as tempers flared due to the social distancing efforts of security. A simple stroll through the casino became a very difficult task, as I had to take alternate routes to avoid congregated groups of younger visitors that were yelling, cussing, pushing each other around, smoking marijuana...I can go on and on.  The security and staff were quick to enforce mask guidelines, but did nothing to enforce the inappropriate conduct of many of their guests. There were people smoking marijuana on the casino floor as they played slots and stood in the common walkways.  Prostitution was brazen in the evenings....I watched and heard prostitutes approach men and openly proposition. (*This occurred near the lobby, where there were always several  security officers on standby.)  I repeatedly questioned why the officers did nothing and have come to the conclusion that MGM is willing to put up with this conduct in an effort to keep business coming through their doors.Although a loyal MGM visitor, I think it is time my family and I take our business to another property. I will not allow the safety of my family to be compromised.

Came to celebrate my daughter's 21st, was hoping and expecting for an amazing stay. Sad to say that wasn't the case. The resort is beautiful however staff may need additional customer relations training during this pandemic. People have been stressed out for the past few months and are looking for some relief.  The staff should not be adding on. Several people and myself were not only reminded about our masks but flat out harassed! I was in the middle of drinking my beverage and immediately scolded for my mask being down meanwhile multiple people around me at pool not wearing them including staff!! We were followed and threatened. I was very disappointed that I paid as much as I did for 3 nights and was treated so rudely. Also bell service took 1hr 30 min! After I called again they said they had no record of my request. I will NOT be coming back to MGM will spend my hard earned money elsewhere where I am treated with some decency as a fellow human being/American. Period!

Usually I do not even leave reviews. I feel like they do nothing to help the expedite at hand. However, avoid this hotel at all costs. The customer service is horrible they don't care about your money and they absolutely do not value customers. Please please spend your money else where

I have been coming to MGM for years.  While rooms are cheap during Covid.  My wife and I just wanted to get away and support Vegas. We wanted to have a good time with some pool time, eating out and sleeping in.  Restaurants were limited but good.  Pool experience was horrible, mid week was fine but closed too early, but Friday and Saturday were impossible to get into the pool even if willing to pay.  We waited on wait list for 5 hours in advance.  We could have gone to other hotels or locations to have had a better time.  I hopeful management will read this and respond then make adjustments.  We will need to consider other options in the future.

What a disappointment, the only reason we booked this hotel is because of the pool amenities. We just attempted to spend the afternoon in the lazy river and the facility is at capacity. Why would anyone come to the MGM during this pandemic if not to enjoy they pool? To spend their entire vacation locked in their room? Everything else is closed, you can't even go to a nice sit down restaurant or buffet. DO NOT RESERVE A STAY OR GIVE THEM YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY. We are leaving tomorrow morning and didn't get to do what we planned, the MGM is pretty empty, which is confusing as to why the pools are full. Come on MGM!!

Stayed here tues-thurs as a staycation. A lot of hotels are offering no resort fees for locals so we are taking the opportunity to stay at the wonderful hotels vegas has to offers during this time. This hotel has gone downhill in my opinion. Everything is extremely far to get to, from the pool to your room to parking, to even get out to walk on the strip. They are dog friendlyOur hotel room was a suite and at first glance everything seemed nice and well put together. In reality the couch was old, had stains and sunk in from everyone sitting on it for years, the mattress was sunk in the middle and needed to be tossed out, just little things here and there that were broken, there were remnants of a party previously to us being in the room, trash on the ground and a few stains on the sheets. We didn't realize there were different pools for different ages and we took our 2 year old to the furthest one from the entrance, I have now come to realize after reading the sign when we got out that it was the adult pool because OMG!  when we first got there it was couples all on each other in the pool, out the pool I called it the sex pool. They were all 1 shot away of having just one big orgy  the next day we went to the first pool which was the family pool and it was better. The waitress was amazing and very tentative. I didn't catch her name but she was the skinny black lady. I ordered a slushie drink and a blue moon which was around $30. There are plenty of places to eat in this hotel so you won't go hungry or have to venture off the property. The room service is VERY expensive so steer clear! It was like 20 bucks for a muffin and grapes. If it was alcohol it would be ok but not for a muffin and a grape. In conclusion it was just ok. Nothing to dream about or want to come back to.

MGM during Covid. Here are some details.Check in was by far the easiest I have ever experienced in my entire life at any hotel. Download the app and it's even easier. There is no valet, only self parking. We drove up to front, unloaded our bags and husband went to park truck. They do have Bell desk still available. We checked our bags and proceeded inside to get some physical cards for our room. I received our room number 2 hours before our arrival which was at 1pm. I didn't pay for early check-in, I just noted it was expected time of arrival.There are a couple people to help at check-in, but it's mostly Contactless. I used my barcode on my phone to get extra keys by scanning my room number on to tablet and inserting keys on my own. You can get up to 4 keys.We were physically in our room within 15minutes of our arrival. A super plus in my book. Especially when you have 3 kids with you.The room... it's clean and they will in fact still come to service it everyday. I did my own little Lysol spray down but feel if I wasn't able to, we still would have had a clean room. They put a little tape at the door seal that states the room has been sanitized as well as on the remote and other highly touched surfaces in the room.A little about the casino and masks. They have masks and hand sanitizer throughout the casino. Wearing them is being enforced while walking around. It's not just enforced by security but most hotel employees also. They provide you with a nice little welcome kit in your room that includes hand sanitizer, 2 MGM masks, and the touch less keys you see all over TV.They do have the social distancing circles on the floor at some spots like entrance to elevator, stores and high traffic areas, but it's not super enforced because it wasn't very busy.Playing tables have the plexiglass partitions and machines are every other open. You are still allowed to smoke and drink but have to be actively doing it to have your mask off. All shows are cancelled still and the food court had 3 places open. Johnny rockets, pizza place and Asian cuisine. To eat at a restaurant you need to have reservations, no walk-ins.On to the pool. It is open and the lazy river is open as well. On our arrival, we were able to get down to the pool around 2:30pm and still find a spot. Lounge chairs are at half availability and we were informed that when I called. But we were able to get in both days no problem without renting anything which we thought we might have to. Pool process.... they will let people in until it reached the given capacity. At that time they will start a waitlist and call you when you can come in. If you want to guarantee a spot with all day access,they recommend you reserve a chair, pod or cabana. We didn't need to do that and based on the price of them, were very happy we didn't. Same rules apply for the masks in pool. You do not have to wear mask in pool or walking to and from it. But it is enforced at your lounge chair which makes you sweat even more. That part was not fun. And I'm assuming that they are understaffed because the first day it took forever to get a drink and they don't allow you to walk up to purchase your own. Day 2 we brought our own snacks and drinks for the kids because waiting for them would not have been feasible. Our cocktail waitress was hustling getting drinks out to everyone, so kudos to you Alina! We appreciated you keeping mom and dad hydrated. Over all the stay was great. 2 negatives and the reason for 4 stars. The toilet in the bathroom of our room was super annoying. The tank kept refilling every couple minutes and it was loud enough to be heard from the room. I even took the top of the tank off to try to fix it myself and no luck.2nd would be for the mean security at the pool. Fiddling with masks at the pool is hard and something you need to get used to... tack on kids into the equation and geez! Anyhow, he happened to be walking by as I had just put down my drink to cover my child next to me who was cold. This security yells from across the lazy river " Mrs.! Put your mask on! This is your first warning!" Was really rude and uncalled for. My son looked at me and asked " mom why is he mad at you." I wish I would have got his name but I didn't want that incident to take over my time with my family. From someone who works at a hospital and wears a mask for 12 hours straight days in a row, I'm the last person that needs to be lectured. MGM should really educate their employees on how to NOT  let the recent situation in this world take away from simple human decency and treating people with kindness still. People like myself and my family giving places like this a chance are part of the reason they still have a job right now.  Overall I would say that I really liked how less crowded it was and look forward to visiting again.

I do understand these are different times during this virus. But the overall experience at the MGM was lack lusting. I wish they could be more specific on their website about what to expect when you get here. It's mandatory mask policy. But yet you could not wear a mask if you're smoking poison cigarettes in the casino. You don't have to wear a mask when you're outside around hundreds of people at the pool. when you're walking around inside the casino no one is social distancing. But they randomly enforce social distancing for in room dining. I couldn't even order a pitcher of water due to the social distancing rules. Blew my mind. On top of that they serve everything on TON of plastic plates but serve food in real plates at the casino restaurants. So much for classy taste. I must've gotten 20 plastic containers for my in room dining. What a waste. And horrible for the environment. These policies that are in place during this pandemic makes zero sense to anyone with a logical mind. No ones social distancing down in the lobby but yet they enforce it when I want to get room service for two people in a nice quiet room. Nothing is normal in public anymore.

Had a good stay overall. Gym didn't have many machines but enough. Pool was great outside of the security harassing some individuals about wearing masks but walked right by others.. oh well.. make sure you have breakfast at Wolfgang puck...the best meal there..

When we got here, from the get go, not only was the customer service horrible, but also had no access to pool/lazy river (due to covid). Also, when we checked in, our room was not ready and it was after 5 o clock.  We reserved mainly at this hotel  because of their lazy river and were sadly disappointed. If you are coming here because of that, forget about trying to access it , unless your willing to pay $400+ for a daybed. Then they will let you in. Def never staying here again.

Stayed at 2 different properties while in town and MGM Grand was by far the worse of the two.  Have over an hour long wait for the pool, half of the tv channels don't work and I feel completely swindled on their $50 food/beverage credit when almost none of the restaurants are open and half don't accept it.  Finally settled on eating at the Loser's Club where I paid $8 for what amounted to a pre packaged gas station sandwich.

After a long drive I was expecting to get in to a clean room... besides that the check in experience was good, the room was not what I was expecting. After I open the closet, I find a dirty towel in the floor (but they have this sticker in the door to make you feel the room is extremely clean due to the Covid-19) in one of the beds you clearly see that the sheets where dirty. I called front desk to request a change of sheets but took forever to answer, I ask one of the nice housekeepers in the hallway to help me change my sheets and she very graciously took care of my issues. Needless to say, I will look for another option in my next trip..., I just got here and staying in till Sunday

Non smoking room smells like a thousand cigarettes burningMysterious hair on the toilet AFTER cleaningNobody enforcing masks in the casinoWater outage and the front desk has no information no update. When it finally come back, the water has a weird smell and appears to be black color.Plumbing issues, water not goin down. Seriously, my first time here and it is definitely going to be my last time.

The only reason to go to here is the pool. We stayed 3 nights, Saturday to Tuesday. After check in around 3pm we were told the pool was at capacity and you can only get in with a reservation. We asked for a reservation as they close at 8pm and it's currently 330pm... the girl said they don't take reservations anymore... so I asked for one the following day... she said they don't take them that far in advance SMH. Mind you, the person enforcing this was a 19 year old girl who couldn't really explain why we couldn't go to our own hotel pool after checkin...So we suck it up and go the the pool then next morning and arrive at 10am. We have a great time and attempt to buy a reserved chair, bed or cabana, price for as not a concern. We were told it's too full and they can't do it...So we ask if we can get a reserved bed for the following day (Monday) and willing to spend whatever (quoted around 400$- 500$ for it) the girl in charge said, no she can't, the lazy river is closed during the week.So we were bummed but continued buying food and drinks expecting Sunday to be the only and last day. We asked a lifeguard about the lazy river closed during the week and they said it's only open Friday Saturday and Sunday.Well Monday comes and we wanted the pool experience but knew it was "closed" so spend the day on the strip. We come back and are walking to Top Golf and see it's not closed and people are having a great time in the lazy river. We run back to the room and hit the lazy river with animosity towards all lifeguards and employees. Whoever is in charge or reading reviews and knows the decision maker of pool staff; should give everyone a slap on the wrist for giving bad info. Remember we were ready to throw down cash for the pool but did not because we were told it's closed by multiple employees.

So we went during the covid 19 on a trip to the Mgm grand on the 4 th of July weekend  Every year we go to the Mgm since it's our favorite hotel Unfortunately this time with all the restrictions the trip didn't start to fun cause on the phone they haven't mentioned the pool wait of 3 ours list every morning which was ridiculous, after coming to Ian that was very rude to us with no customer service what so ever And was disappointed from our vacation.I had received a phone call from this AMAZING GUYART BRASCIA which he is customer development Executive, and boy this men works magic!He is absolutely amazing at his jobHe made sure they fixed all the unpleasant experience we had, unlike past years where we enjoyed our stay. Ian from Mlife was so rude but not Art !wow what a guy Art is! What a guy!!! He took care of us and really made sure we leave with a great taste like every year. So sorry it took like a week to write this review but Art thank you so much for taking the time from your super busy day to fix everything and take care of the problem we had with Ian, and thanks for your caring and addressing the issue we had with him.Also I want to say a special thanks to such a sweet lady from Mlife that every trip she takes care of us her name is Iris she is absolutely Lovely!!! These are the type of people that make the MGM hotel top of the line for me ,you should most definitely make sure you keep them at the hotel , they are a great roll model for all other employees!!! And make the MGM a great name hotel!So thanks again and you will definitely see us again at you resort!

I had stayed at MGM many years ago (8+) and always loved it, the pools and lazy river were great. I'm not sure whats happened recently, but the atmosphere has completely changed. :-( We took the family for a 3 day weekend, just to swim and relax. I completely understand Vegas is an adult playground, but thats no excuse to allow DRUGS poolside. On three separate occasions there were people doing drugs out in the open and in front of my kids. Twice at the pool and once in front of the hotel at valet. I listened to the first 150 times the F word was yelled in front of children, and excused it, as they are adults and free to enjoy. It wasn't until someone yelled 50' across the pool 'N----er, thats why your not getting any pu--y" 2 feet directly in front of my kids that I was pissed. The N word was thrown around consistently by different people. Completely inexcusable behavior. Possibly my responsibility or brining a kid to a Vegas pool. However, I will say even as an adult i was uncomfortable with the environment and drugs.

I wasnt going to post a review but after the treatment we received I will literally never go back. The people working the pool entrance are a sham, they were allowing their "friends" into the pool while entire families with kids were waiting outside the ropes. We went to speak to a manager about the situation. We explained that we had our items already on chairs by the pool and the short ugly door woman was being rude, felt like she wanted us to pay her to get into the pool, after we talked to the manager, also it seemed like it was his first day as a manager because he had no clue what to do, we walked all the way back to the pool, he spoke to the rude woman about her behavior and she thought it would be cute to tell him to send us to another pool. He tells us to go to the "signature pool", we went and they were having a private event. This rude ass woman knew they were having an event there and sent us there in purpose to be even ruder than she was before. So we go back to speak to the manager, he doesnt want to come out to deal with the situation, he sends out other managers, he finally comes out does nothing again, by this time we are already frustrated and booked another hotel to stay at while talking to him. We requested a full refund of our remainder of our stay there. He LIED and said he issued a refund. He then ran away, like literally ran away with the rep that was standing there. We waited and waited because we can see that the refund wasnt even processed. He finally came back out after 15 minutes of us waiting and other managers going to get him. We were beyond angry at this point. We made him call hotels.com to process the refund. During that he tried to call security on us to kick us out of the hotel with all our stuff still in our room. All so that he wouldnt have to process the refund. Wow. The security guards were beyond ridiculous barking like dogs and trying to yell in the lobby as if that would scare us. It didnt. When they realized it disnt they said we were going to be arrested for trespassing when our stuff was in the hotel room. People were actually clapping and cheering for us when we told them to "f off". We finally left after having to deal with this nonsense bullshit. Also, this MGM Grand hotel has cameras in your room. The smoke detector has a camera, the clock has a camera and there is a box with 4 sections for "snacks" near the tv that has cameras in it.  Do not stay here not only because the staff are rude and incompetent but because now you are being recorded in your room. Disgusting.

I appreciate all of the efforts for safety with all of the sanitizing and enforcement of wearing masks and social distancing...  BUT a couple things you could do better: in the food court give more serious consideration to wiping down the tables and wipe down the top metal parts of the chairs where everyone grabs them to pull them out to sit down; in the hotel -please start changing the filters in the air-conditioners more often. Ours was almost completely clogged and disgusting.   AND the High Limit area is not monitored well enough as we saw several cases where strangers were NOT social distancing from other guests as they should have been.

Do yourself a favor and NEVER EVER EVER stay here. Ever. I'm going to go FULL Karen for a minute. And I don't even feel bad about it. I never write bad reviews. But my blood is boiling. From the check in, to the cleanliness of the hotel room, to customer service, everything was downright disgusting. The shower we were supposed to bathe our daughter in was covered in long black hair. I have blonde hair. My husband is bald. Obviously not us. My daughter, while playing in the room, found a dirty, disgusting shot glass under the nightstand. This is in the COVID era. Where everything is supposed to be extra clean. The mirror in our bathroom was broken, the carpet was ripped. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall...What kind of establishment allows that? And to top it off, we were on a non-smoking floor and the entire hallway smelled of weed. I complained, and they literally did nothing. They laughed it off. On check out I asked to speak with a manager and was left standing there for 15 minutes. CK, a woman part of the check in staff, told me she told a manager and literally said she didn't have time for me, and walked away to help someone check in. I had to go find a manager on my own who claimed he didn't know I was waiting for him. I told him (Darrin) about my experiences. And he smirked and said "sorry" and shrugged his shoulders. He literally couldn't have cared less. I'm beyond disgusted by the customer service provided. On top of that, there is a man named Danny So who is a manager on the floor of the casino...he really topped it off. I was gambling with my husband at the table. Betting on roulette. It was me, another man and my husband. He came over and told me to stay 6 feet back if I'm not gambling. I explained I was and he walked away. Two more men came and sat down. Now there are 5 men and my husband playing. Me standing next to my husband, still playing roulette. He came up again, told ME to stand back as only 6 people are allowed to play. He didn't ask one of the men to leave. He asked me. Even though I had been sitting there and playing for quite some time before the other men came to play. Both my husband and I were shocked, we got up and left. To top it off. As we were checking out. The line to check in and out took over an hour to get through. They had three individuals working. Sunday morning. July 5th. After a holiday weekend. Three people checking out guests. I understand needing to social distance. But at what point does having a line of 75+ people in the middle of your lobby cross the line of unacceptable. Isn't that worse than having people standing 6 feet apart all checking out at the same time? I will never ever be staying here again. Not worth the money. Not worth the headache. Not worth feeling dirty in your own hotel room. Not worth being mistreated by a misogynistic asshole. Stay ANYWHERE else. Just not here.

Do not go to Vegas during this time.... finally made an attempt to run away with the kids for a weekend. Waiting 4 hours in the heat of July to get into the River Pool with a 4 and a 1 year old with a clueless life guard standing at the entrance who couldn't give me a simple time frame of when I will be able to enter the pool. After we finally gave up and left the whole day wasted and it was too late to do anything with the kids. Aside from that the casino upped all their limits and it was really bad vibes... won't go to Vegas especially the MGM in awhile.

Sucks I reserved a king size bed and nice view. They gave me 2 queen beds and no acces to the pool.At least 80 % of the people were complaining about something.. dirty bedrooms, very unprofessional staff.

Not a good experience.  We booked a room on July 3rd for the express purpose of hanging out at the pool.  We walked all the way out only to be stopped and told we needed reservations.  We didn't and were told it was a 2 hour wait.  We checked the MGM website before booking and NOWHERE does it tell you about this.  We go to the front desk to lodge our complaint only to be told the hotel has nothing to do with the pool area and we have to go talk to them. At this point we just want a refund since we're locals and go home.  That was fairly painless but the way we were treated was awful.  No apology and the desk couldn't have been more rude.  I miss old Vegas where you were treated as a customer rather than a dollar sign.

We booked this hotel during the covid pandemic just to get away for a day. When we checked in there was no one to wipe down the card machine between people and nobody seemed to care when I asked about it. But the worst part was when we walked into our room that was marked with a seal on the door supposedly cleaned to par, it was not. There were chips on the floor under the tv stand. Empty makeup container and soda bottle under the desk and to top it off the people before us put a face mask over the smoke detector. Obviously whoever cleaned this room was partially blind. The mini fridge was opened already and the previous people's bill was still up on the tv. It was so not ok and the managers and front desk people didn't seem to care when I brought it to their attention. Horrible experience over all I felt dirty.
location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

review_text: Stayed here one night. Place was clean and staff was friendly, for the most part. I guess we we're supposed to have masks in our room complementary of the hotel. We did not, and I did not know about them till after we checked out. When I asked about them I got a run around about getting them. Keep being told to talk to different people. Finally they had me talk to a manager about them and he got me one but after saying. They are complementary we don't have to give you one.  Other then that our room was nice and clean.

Taking in consideration all of the closures and restrictions due to COVID-19, the MGM maintained their hotel very well. Early morning, you can clearly see all of the staff hard at work cleaning and scrubbing the hotel from top to bottom (literally not a stain on the carpets). For the most part, they did their best to support and serve the guests, but there were a few bumps in the road. Elevators were a bit of a nightmare. We were asked to form lines in order to maintain social distancing within the elevators, yet they remained packed full once you step in. At first arrivals only about 70% of people were wearing masks. Within a couple days, the hotel enforced a rule mandating that masks are required upon all movement within the hotel. This was very reassuring and made us feel a lot more comfortable. They had hand washing stations spread out through the casinos and hand sanitizing  stations absolutely everywhere. They even provided unlimited masks next to all sanitizing stations. The temperature inside the hotel was very cold, but considering how hot it was outside, it probably helped more than hurt. Maybe, keep it a little warmer though, because going in and out between the two temperatures is a good sure way of going home with a cold. We were not too pleased with the organizing and prioritization of the bell desk when checking our luggage on the way out, but it was nothing compared to the overall decent experience we had. It might be a good idea to only take a short trip to Vegas at the moment due to all of the closures, but there is still a decent amount of exciting things to experience.

My bride and I are here at the MGM Grand on our second day of our week long stay. So far a few disappointing aspects to our visit. First the mobile check-in process at the MGM. We lost out on 2 comp nights on my MyVegas account. Normally we speak to a live person when we check-in and mention MLife and MyVegas comps, but due to all the Covid crap, we skipped that step as per their recommendation. I was not able to redeem all the comps. I spoke to both MLife and MGM, and neither would help because we were already checked-in. No credit, no nothing. Second, the pool situation. Lazy River is only running on weekends and the hot tubs are closed until further notice. However, we are still paying 100% in resort fees. Third, as to be expected, a lot is closed in terms of restaurants and shops. There are a lot of people here and have all been bottle necked into specific areas in spite of social distancing. The biggest positive of the whole trip is the cleanliness. If this is of concern, everywhere you go in the hotel you see people cleaning and sanitation stations everywhere. Our bathroom is not 100% clean however, kinda disgusting actually. I will be contacting the front desk.
Courtney made checking into the hotel a pleasant, positive, and fun experience. Everything was absolutely perfect. Thank you so much Courtney for going above and beyond! You're amazing!

DON'T EVER STAY AT THIS RACIST HOTEL!!! If you're Mexican or black you won't ever get treated well and you will be targeted. Jeff and Scott at the front desk were horrible, when I tried to address the racial issue I had with their security they were not having it and they were very rude.

If I could give this hotel zero stars on here, I would. For the price you pay, they are extremely cheap with how they treat their guests and the accommodations they provide for them. No microwave, fridge, or coffee maker. Even hot water has to be provided through room service. Lazy river is only open on the weekends, and pool was filled with cups and garbage. Extremely stingy hotel and I am extremely disappointed. Save some money, go to a motel instead. At least you'll get the proper amenities for the price you pay.

i was DISCRIMINATED against! It was my first time going to the MGM Grand, Monday June 22nd 2020.. I just celebrated my birthday and decided to go to Vegas. When I check in everything seemed fine Until I went downstairs to play the slot machines at the casino. I noticed a security guard by the name of "Hacob" Walking around me for hours. Then when I finished playing the slot machine I mingle around with my friend, started talking to people inside the casino because they were friendly. Noticed that "Hacob" kept staring at me and walking near me. He then out of nowhere asked for my ID, mind you I've been at the hotel for hours and I've seen him walk past me for hours and also I just checked in the hotel not even three hours ago. I asked him why he didn't have a valid reason, then just vaguely said it's for age verification just so he can have a reason to look at my ID. I asked for a supervisor, and when his supervisor came I asked her why does he Need to see my ID. She stated that they do check random IDs for age verification. I stated that he's been walking around me for hours, if he thought I was under age he should of been asked me for my ID. Mind you he did not ask anyone else around me even people that looked younger than me for identification he only asked me. I then got frustrated and asked to go to the front desk because I felt I was being discriminated against by being the only black person in that area also I thought it was something deeper than just age verification because HACOB made it very vaguely on why he wanted to check my ID. I don't know if his assumption was that I didn't have a room there or I was a prostitute but for him to ask for my ID out of nowhere And he's been walking around me for hours, I felt that was a problem. We then go to the front desk where manager "Steve" was there. I explain to him everything that happened and he told me blatantly that there is nothing he can do about that. Mind you I have everything on video. I then asked him to ask the supervisor what is the security guards name because I want to file a complaint he told me that he will be able to get that for me so he leaves and go to the back. He comes out with a change of heart stating that he wants to make things right because he spoke to the supervisor, a white woman, about what happened and wanted to grant me $75 in food and beverage money. I was so upset because when I explained to "Steve " He did not believe me. Only when a white woman told him what happened he then try to accommodate me. I told him I felt he was not trying to make me feel better he just wanted me to leave the front desk. I was so embarrassed/hurt because I was not taken seriously until a white woman spoke for me which is not OK. "Steve "did not care about accommodating me in order for me to feel comfortable staying there after I told him what happened. He felt he was doing right by just offering $75 of food and beverage Credit. He didn't want to tell me his last name because I told him I was going to call corporate and File a report against him and the security guards at the MGM Grand. "Steve " then told me that if I didn't want the $75 credit I need to leave the front desk because I am disturbing the peace. "Steve" should be fired because no manager should act that way towards hotel guest!

Literally the worst experience I've had at a hotel we get a room had just got done from driving from Temecula and visiting family just wanted to get a room and go to sleep we get in the room and immediately we noticed a screeching noise coming from the toilet we dealt with it I figured we could just close the door and you would hear it less, then we went to go take a shower and the water was boiling hot we cannot fix the temperature no matter what we attempted do the water would stay boiling hot then we went to go and brush our teeth and the water had completely turned off we had no running water. At this point we're already a little upset with the room so we call and complain and they said that the water would be off for two hours due to plumbing issues which explains the hot ass shower then said we can get water from the minibar and wouldn't be charged. Then we try opening the mini bar and it's locked then we called back and she said she will send someone to come open it for us and no one ever came so my fiancé called back complaining once again and they finally decided to move us to another room and told us to call them back when we got to our new room now, So here we go hauling our luggage to this other room we open the door and there is people already occupying the room sleeping in bed we of course startled them and I was mortified. I Instantly walked out feeling embarrassed my fiancé was livid we went to the lobby to complain and immediately asked for a manager in which the lady literally looked away from us and did absolutely nothing about a request instead try to help us get into another room only to come find out that she was trying to send us back into the room that was already occupied again now my fiancé shouts and says "someone please get me a manager you guys are just standing around doing absolutely nothing I've asked for a manager and no one is doing absolutely nothing about it" finally a woman rushes to go get a manager and the manager is already rude as hell to my fiancé telling us "You can get a refund and go somewhere else if you'd like" all because my fiancé knocked on the desk aggressively but he's pissed off and why wouldn't he be? We're here hauling our luggage up and down this hotel no one can seem to get us into a room or help us out and we asked for a manager and all they can do is comp us the resort fee which honestly didn't happen till the next morning. Because at check out the lady was still trying to charge me my full amount which told me the manager did absolutely shit with comping anything, this hotel is literally garbage we will definitely not be coming back and I honestly deserve my full refund.

Haven't been here for awhile and I super excited to experience the remodel they went through a few years back. I usually stay at Aria or Bellagio but wanted to experience the lazy rice this trip. I'm a loyal MGM guest and usually Platinum status but lost status over the past year. However I'm an MLIFE credit card holder and again usually love MGM properties. I booked a 2-night and because a great rate I book the Spa suite. Disappointed. These are located in the South tower which I didn't know they had. So you walk through a door and you instantly feel like you're going in the back where the staff goes and wonder if you're allowed to be back there. It feels like it's an old section of the hotel and to make some more rooms available they just added this section. Paint is chipping on the door frames and the room just smelled old when walking in. The room is a nice size be deceiving in the pictures online as you think you're getting something special and in the grand tower. This tower is only 3 floors high. The scary part is the 2nd elevator is stuck open with a 6" drop from the floor to the elevator. We almost stepped in it. Luckily the other elevator made some noise so we knew it was coming. We are also here on a Thursday and with the limited amount of people that are staying and traveling due to COVID and can't imagine why they couldn't have put us in the grand tower and a nicer section of the hotel.  This is the most I've been disappointed with MGM hotels in years. I'm giving two stars because the casino is always nice to hang out and gamble in.And the most disappointing and frustrating experience is the lazy river is closed. The main reason we came to hang out in between gambling and their website says it's open. The main attraction to the Grand Pool complex.

Considering everything going on with the Covid virus. It wasn't bad. Yes you have to wait a little longer to get on the elevator. Entire place has new carpet and there are hand washing and sanitizing stations set up throughout the casino. Not everything is reopened. They are only allowed a 50% total occupancy at any hotel now and all hotels are running on skeleton crews until business returns. All in all, my wife and I had a great time!!  It is what it is at the moment. Once life returns to normal, if and when. Vegas will be Vegas again!!  Just happy to be out of the house and helping the economy. If you are looking for Vegas to be what it was, be patient. It's a slow process obviously. We understood that. Hell even Disneyland will be at half capacity when it reopens with reservations in place and I'm sure everything won't be as it was. Just go to Vegas and have fun with what's there!!!

I wasn't too impressed with the MGM. I knew coming in that it wasn't going to be on the Bellagio, Wynn level (and it's priced lower accordingly). The problems we encountered started at checkin. There are multiple signs saying to use mobile checkin. So after 10+ minutes in the mobile checkin line, struggling to get a key, an employee comes over and tells us mobile checkin isn't working (despite all of the signs). Then we had to wait 1 hour + in line to get our room key. Other than that, it's tough to tell with Covid reopening to give a far yelp grade. Lots of things were shut down (restaurants, sections of the pool, room service hours, etc), but that's understandable. Not sure I would come back with all of the other options in Vegas. Not great, not horrible.

The worst experience stay at a hotel in Las Vegas. Me and my girlfriend got back to our room at the MGM Grand around 1 in the morning from visiting family. We went to take a shower and the water only came out super hot (problem one) but we didn't complain. We went to brush our teeth and the water stopped working (problem two) so I called the front desk to let know the water didn't work and I was in the middle of brushing my teeth. The water got turned off for 2 hours for repairs. The lady from the front desk said take water from the mini fridge and we won't be but the mini fridge was locked (problem number three). They said they would send some up with water and someone to fix the mini fridge (problem number four)but no one came. Then there was a loud noise coming from the bathroom. So they move us room to only have us walk in on people sleeping in the room! No one helped us move our bags and then when we got to the front desk the lady tried to put us in the same room we just walked in on people. The manager that night didn't want to really help or compensate us for everything they put us through. All they did was put us in a room finally and take our $45 fee off. I would not recommend going to the MGM Grand they do not care about there customers. We didn't get to our new room till 3 in the morning.

Stayed here over the Father's Day weekend this was not my favorite stay the majority of plug outlets don't work In The room Water damage on the Cieling fridge was jammed  wall paper was all marked up. Not a luxury feel for a place like Mgm. Due to Covid the pool area was swamped with no real distancing there was trash everywhere, the lazy river was a mess and people treated it like a party and if you have kids stay away as there is cursing and sexual behavior galore. They need housekeeping to be cleaning up beer bottles and drink cups at all times. I won't likely visit this resort in the future. The beds were comfy though.

I hate to think MGM practices discrimination against Blacks, but my husband and I were escorted from MGM Las Vegas for no justifiable reason other than the fact that we are black. Upon checking into MGM Las Vegas for our two night, prepaid reservation, we were told that due to COVID-19 housekeeping services were only available upon request. After a late night, my husband and I decided to sleep in the next morning but were startled when an MGM employee  abruptly bursted into our room. We informed this person that we had not requested housekeeping services and asked that he not come into the room while  we were unclothed. However, the  employee insisted and continued into the room. We called the hotel frontdesk to report the incident and MGM security responded in defense of the employee. While at our room, MGM security kept the room door  propped open with their foot and we asked that they move their foot to allow us to close the door so that we could get dressed.  Due to concerns for our security and safely and the unresponsiveness of MGM management, we called Nevada police. When Nevada police arrived, they informed us that MGM management had permanently restricted us from all MGM properties and we were immediately being escorted from the premises.  When we asked MGM security why we were being forced from the property and denied our second, prepaid  night at MGM Las Vegas, MGM security provided no explanation.  Being Black does not give MGM the right to intimidate and disregard concerns about our privacy and security. I ask that you please look into the systemic racial discriminatory practices of MGM Las Vegas.

We have been staying here for the last 2 days. Took 3 days to get our room cleaned. Asked numerous time to speak to a manager. Only way we could was to go to the front desk and wait in line behind people who were just checking in. The only positive staff experience so far was at the bell desk asking for another key. DO NOT STAY HERE! Runnnnnn

We had books a 2 bedroom suit fro 6 people at Mandalay bay, but it did not open so they moved us to MGM Grand. @ days before arrival i got a notice on the app that our room would sleep 4 at mgm grand. I spent almost 2 hours on the phone and calling back when i got disconnected to make sure we could sleep 6. Over the phone i was given incorrect information and then suggested to "throw a sheet on the couch and they could give me a pillow" After another call I was promised 2 roll away beds.When we arrived, no roll away beds were in the room, then i had to spend another 1.5 hours speaking to front desk and housekeeping, who told at at first that they did not even have roll away beds. Finally 2 roll away beds weer bought to our room.We were put in the 2 bedroom marquise suit. It is dark, old, worn and smelled of smoke. (I am attaching pictures of stains, tears and holes in the furniture.We checked in using the app so (our temperatures were never taken) Meaning any guest who used the app to check in was not screened.When i went to get a room key card, the staff member asked if everything was ok, i told her were had a rough check in. Her response "Well it is not fun for us either, it is really busy today" and she walked away. That is ridiculous!As others have mentioned their was no social distancing, they closed the lazy rivier after I called days before to make sure it was open. (They changed to only be open on weekends) The 3 pools were not open. Only one main pool packed with people all on top of each other. Mind you we paid a $40 per day resort fee, for only one pool to be open and packed with people. Such a waste. I only sat staff cleaning the escalator to the parking lot twice on out 5 day trip and one cleaning the water feature near the elevators. I never say anything clean the elevator buttons or other high touch surfaces. Masks are recommended and most people are not wearing them. I often smelled marijuana in the casino floor and in the hallway walking to our room.I knew going in they would not clean your room during your stay, i did read the 7 page |safety plan" however they did not follow thought with cleaning and social distancing. We felt unsafe. We will never stay here again and I want to warn others against such a horrible experience.

Very much disappointed in the state of the room broken sink,dirty bedding,leftover earplugs on the floor behind bed house keeping is lacking big time for a hotel this caliber I expected more for my first time

I recently stayed in one of the Penthouse City View Suites.  It was large, but had a dated look to it.  The front door did not close properly unless you closed it tightly by hand.  Due to the pandemic, the room service was only from 6am-2pm.  Also, you have to call and request housekeeping if you need it.  The MGM app said my key would be ready on my phone when I arrived, it was not, so I had to use the front desk.  Also, the first drinks I tried to charge to my room did not go through; they said somebody forgot to push a button when I checked in.  If you need a slot attendant on the casino floor for any reason at all, expect to wait at least 20 minutes for somebody to help you out. Also, expect to hear the same five songs on the casino floor on constant rotation.  The bed was extremely comfortable and the shower was fine.  No refrigerator to keep drinks cold, no coffee machine in the room, and very little snack options available in the room made this "luxury suite" not so luxurious.  Very helpful staff for the most part and great slot machine selections were the saving graces for this hotel.
Overall a great renovated hotel in Vegas! On top off the COVID!! They are clean and have great processes in place. Great atmosphere! Had a great time!

Booked the Stay Well Grand King, but when we got there, the front desk advised they booked all the kings; gave us a double queen with a strip view on the 16th floor. Room Staywell Lounge is CLOSED. There are two family pools and one pool for 18+, which are all pretty small. Lazy River is closed, so you can't access half of the pool space, making the pool area very crowded, which doesn't seem safe considering COVID-19. People were crammed in the pools. I paid a resort fee but didn't use the pool or wifi, so it was a waste of money. I asked to check out at 12pm, and the hotel rep was accommodating. Free parking during reopening. This is more of a family hotel/casino vibe. The lines get long waiting for the elevators going up to the room; if guests don't have a mask, they must ride in a separate elevator with their respective party. The StayWell rooms have a special set of elevators to use, so there were almost no lines going up to the Staywell rooms. Many people in the casino act as if COVID-19 never happened, many are NOT wearing masks, and don't respect social distancing standing very close to you.

Check in was super fast and easy with the app. Only prob I had was the door sealed was off the door when I checked in so I don't know if my room got actually cleaned and disinfected before I got in there like other rooms and also the  toilet was making a loud noise like it was spilling the water so I called engineering and was waiting for over 30 mins and never showed up so I left and when I came back the issue was fixed.
Great service. Great rooms. Not as much people like usual. A lot of tables and slots are closed or temporarily closed due to Covid19. Its nice to be out after months of stay at home.

My last stay was from June 8th-10th this year. Prior to this, I"d stayed here a number of times but never had so many issues.  I don't know why things were so terrible this time around. Social distancing was challenging.  There were wash stations throughout and hand sanitizing stations but it was pretty often that I saw kids taking gloves by the handful and masks by the box as well. There should be someone at those supply stations to kind of regulate the number of items that you are able to take from their dispensers at a time. Also, people are getting into fights where the elevators are.  People cut into lines and of course that makes ppl go nuts. People in the elevators do and don't wear masks. The ones that don't should be in their elevator car on their own. I understand that it can be a pain to wait for the next one but it might be for your safety. Ugh!! I was very disappointed during my last visit. There were housekeeping floor managers snapping at their house keeping team members. There were bits of something in my bathroom sink basin.  I'd looked in the mini bar fridge in my room to see how it'd been stocked. I noticed there were several items missing and that there were some things in the fridge that had been moved and were off of their sensors. I immediately went to the front desk to bring that issue to their attention. They said that my room had some charges on it already but that they would remove them and that they'd send someone from the mini bar team to check it out and to remove the item that was off of the sensor. That NEVER happened. I also had an issue with the mini fridge that I'd requested for use to store medication. I turned the level of coldness down to a 2-3 but it still froze my husband's medications. The ice machine on our floor wasn't working although I'd checked all throughout the 2 full days that we were guests at the hotel. We'd not put up a do not disturb sign on our door but still our room wasn't ever refreshed. I mentioned this to the desk when I checked out and they said that because I was a gold M Life card holder that they should have told me that I'd need to request for housekeeping to come in. I don't think that should have had anything to do with my status in M Life card. It should have been something that all guests should have been told upon arrival.  I'd also wondered why a seal wasn't ever put onto my room prior to my arrival to give us some sort of reassurance that our room had been thoroughly cleaned. The answer I got felt like BS. The person I'd asked about this was another house keeping team member. They said that it was sort of a luck of the draw sort of thing, some rooms got those seals and some didn't. I did NOT at all feel confident that MGM took my health and safety as a priority.  I understand that this whole situation with all these new practices are NEW. . . but if the hotel has so many discrepancies and has so much trouble with these new ordinances, maybe they weren't really ready to open?!?! Anyway. . . Robell was the one MGM staff member who was super helpful to me. He was on top of things and did his best to try and resolve a few of my issues that I'd had during my stay.  uggghhhhhh. And then there is the parking lot. Portions of it are blocked off and it makes it a million times more difficult to exit the lot but also to access vacant and convenient as possible parking spots. Top Golf opens 6/18. So, next time I'm out there, in mid-July, we'll see how things go.

This hotel is extremely over hyped. First off I booked a Room with one king bed for my husband & myself and when I got to my room there was 2 queen beds. Upon further inspection of the room I noticed a huge dead moth, which is really disgusting seeing that due to the pandemic you can already see that they are not cleaning rooms properly.

Absolutely the worst experience at a property in Las Vegas I've ever had and I come on a regular basis. First off the social distancing they tried but never happened in the elevators. Second I got flea bites from either the hotel cabanas at the pool or a pod that I got the pool where I had the worst experience at a Las Vegas pool and the worst service. Calling the front desk was impossible. We had to use our cell phones to try to call the front desk.Understandably this was the first weekend that this hotel is open but the quality and service was absolutely a nightmare. The fact that I have flea bites and I had to go to the doctor to get medicine because they got so bad this is the first time that's ever happened to me in my life and I work with dogs. I do not recommend this hotel I recommend spending the extra money and going somewhere a little bit nicer. Another negative was when you cashed out from gambling you never got the change you only got the dollar bills not the actual change. So many negatives so such a bad experience and I even called the front desk to complain about this with you avail or response of how terrible and experience we had. Go somewhere else, too bad they didn't actually take the time and clean the place from fleas while they were closed for a couple months so who knows how to sanitize this actually is. The only positive was this hotel was trying to work with the whole Covid issues but they could've done a much better job. I do think I got Covid from being in Vegas this past weekend.

It's a really beautiful hotel and located right on the strip. We got our room for a really good price since Vegas is just starting to reopen, but we were really impressed with how friendly the staff was with check-in, wearing masks and they also had hand sanitizing stations all over the hotel and casino. I would definitely have given 5 stars, but unfortunately we didn't have any warm water in our room, and we were slightly disappointed that the lazy river was still closed.

The place is okay. It's gone downhill. I thought with the pandemic that is going on that the casino would be cleaner. Not so much. Saw disposable masks on floor when entering an area. Went back an hour later and was still on the ground. Machines not cleaned every hour or whatever their protocol is. Dirty cups, lime wedges,  other trash on a lot of the machines

I am not happy. I booked 2; King bed rooms with a walk-in shower. But when we got to our rooms we noticed that we had 2-queen beds and it is a tub/shower. They did not let their guests know there rooms were being downgraded. I called the front desk & was told that our rooms are an upgrade. I told them that 2-queen beds and a tub are not an upgrade from a king bed and walk-in shower. All they did was apologize. I then looked online the room that I booked is still being sold. And also King rooms for the Grand part of the hotel; which we are staying in. I went down and spoke to the manager (Darrin) about this issue. I then told him that the men staying in the rooms are 6' and that it would be comfortable for them to have a king bed and for me a walk-in shower since my knee is not working correctly. He checked his system to see if their are any rooms available tomorrow with a walk-in shower. He said to call the front desk at 1pm. Besides the walk-in shower. We won't know what the room is going. Update: We got king size beds. Our room does have a walk-in shower but the other room still has a tub. The queen beds were harder then the king bed. The walls are very thin. We could hear music and people talking. I would not recommend MGM Hotel Casino. The lazy river is not open.
theres being throwup for the past 4 hrs by foodcourt restroomhasnt being cleaned up smells horrible
The is review is for the MGM pool. The lazy river is not open. They told us that they hope to have it open next week but they don't know for sure. The regular pool is open.

If you're coming to Vegas stay anywhere but here. There was no water upon arrival and they do not have maid/ cleaning staff on hand. When I called to talk to housekeeping I was told that it is stated on website that they don't clean the rooms because of Covid-19 which sounds backwards to me. Housekeeping associate was Natalia. When I asked to a manager she said none were available and directed me outside to find one. When I finally did find a manager I was told they indeed to do not have the staff to clean the rooms and it would not be cleaned.

This isn't a review of my most recent stay, it's the review of my ATTEMPT to book a room by calling the reservation line.In the midst of the pandemic I know they've been shut down and are excited to get back open, just as I am to get back to Vegas myself.  I called the reservation line.  Expecting a version of "Thank you for calling the MGM grand reservation line, my name is _________, how may I assist you?" - instead I was greeted with a monotone "Hello?"   So the awkward opening of this exchange went:MGM - Hello?Me - Hello?MGM - Yes?Me - is this the reservation line?MGM - Yeah, can I help you?I then explained that I was coming to Vegas in June for work/play and I was offered a room at another hotel on the strip, but I've always enjoyed the MGM properties so I was hoping to possibly book a room here if the prices were comparable.  The response was a very long, but quick, (and again monotone) sentence along the lines of:MGM:  "Okay we have our King suite in the tower, that includes a full king bed, at out special rate for our Mlife Gold members is $47.99, after taxes and fees it'll be $207.44, your deposit today will be $53 you can put that on your card, can you please give me the first four digits of the credit card you plan to use?"Okay, there's a lot to unpack there.  I then explained that on the MGM website the rooms were listed at $39 a night, is that information correct?  Is it cheaper if I just book online?
