To which I got an annoyed response along the lines of:MGM:  "Those are the cheaper rooms in the other tower."(Side note:  I'm referring to them as "MGM" because the person STILL hasn't introduced themselves and given me any kind of name)MGM cont: "If you'd like to book those the final cost will be $197.15 for both nights, can I get your card number for the deposit?"So I then tried to continue to clarifyMe - So it's basically $100 a night to stay at MGM.MGM - no sir, as I explained the rooms are $39Me - But you said the final cost was $197 correct?MGM - yes....Me - so 197... divided by 2 nights... means the cost is $98.50 a night.MGM - No the ROOM is $39... the resort fees are what take it up to $197.Me - I understand that, so the bottom line is the best rate that you have is $98.50 a night.MGM - No... the best rate I have is $39 as I mentioned before...Me - Okay... how much would I have to pay, in total, to sleep in a room at MGM for one night?MGM - .....Now I know I got a little snarky at the end there, but it was frustrating to have Mr/Mrs "I don't know his/her name because they didn't bother introducing themselves" condescend to me about basic math, especially since they obviously knew the point I was making.  I have another review on here from last year when I stayed at Aria and got destroyed at a high limit black jack table in 10 minutes (on some really bad beats)... where the dealer, AND pit boss, both laughed and condescended to me without any empathy or kindness.  I understand those are the risks of gambling, but to have the employees not even ATTEMPT to soften that bad beat in any way (chat, joke, a "that sucks, I'm sorry") seems to be a common thread in the MGM properties now... Employees talking down to the customers that are spending money... or ATTEMPTING to spend money, in this reservations case.Anyway, I digress.  I asked the reservation line if there were any rates in the $120-$150 range TOTAL.  I was told I would have to reserve the room at full price then talk to the front desk when I get here about any discounts... So I'd have to chance it... and as I've learned lately... Gambling at MGM properties isn't a very pleasant experience.  So I decided to stay at another hotel on the strip, and I'll probably be allowing my Gold status at MGM to lapse and build my tiers at a new place.  One that may show a higher level of BASIC customer service.  I used my Mlife credit card to pay for the room... I wonder if the new place has a credit card I can apply for instead.

Used to be nice.... 20+ years ago. Now it's just huge and dated. Carpet needs to be replaced or at the very minimum shampooed. The whole place smells stale. All of the good restaurants are gone. The only reason to come over here is Ka. I did not feel safe at the taxi/Uber line. There were a lot of scary looking people on drugs, and no security people to be found. I ended up just walking to where I needed to go.

We had had a reservation for about five months and we were asked to sit at the bar and order a $28 glass of wine and my husband ordered the whiskey on the rocks. As soon as we ordered the drinks our table is ready. We were offered a table next to a baby and a high chair and I refused saying that I would like the table in the corner away from the baby. I was told that that table was reserved for somebody with the reservation. I told him I had a reservation for four months and that I would like to sit there. The waiter was a complete a hole and told us that things just come out as the chef prepares them. II ask what was in the fennel salad and I was told fennel. The waiter was a complete dick. I will never go back there. The food was mediocre and the atmosphere was  everything of that that asshole. We will never go back to a Tom Colicchio restaurant.

Decent hotel, definitely way better options on the strip. It is considerably cheaper than other hotels on the strip, so if you're on a budget this hotel will do. Here's why I knocked off a couple stars:Our hotel was dirty, there was hair all over the sink and toilet and there was used tissue left on the counter. Pretty gross. We decided to eat at their breakfast/brunch buffet, and boy was it a disappointment. I definitely would not recommend. Food was not good at all there. Their dessert bar they had was disgusting as well. So many options, but not one good thing. Don't waste time eating here- Vegas has way better breakfast options.

Don't stay in this hotel!!!!! We had a water shut down for a few hours no water no shower no flushing toilets. I booked a room with a jacuzzi that didn't even work and they said they couldn't move me because their were no more rooms with jacuzzi In them. What's disappointing is when I booked the room I was looking forward to using the jacuzzi that's precisely why I booked that room. That's the reason why I didn't mind paying that price but very disappointing!!!! That should of told me before I booked that it was out of service smh!!!

I didn't have a room there, but 5 stars for them being proactive about shutting down due to coronavirus. Also, even more kudos for keeping the doors open after the shutdown!I was walking The Strip and desperately needed a restroom. In, out, no problem. I really hope MGM takes care of their employees during the shutdown. I talked to several people at different casinos who are afraid for their jobs.

We were so surprised by the lack of amenities here. No microwave, no coffee pot with comp coffee and no fridge! It is very eco friendly with their room items, But for us the resort fees went on and on. Not friendly with the pocket. I don't use the hotel phones and a swimming certain times of the year is not an option. Ooh and the parking as a guest, with the ridiculous resort fee,that should  be free too guests! WE paid an extravagant resort fee for nothing. At least the covid virus got us out of there earlier! I thought the rooms would have been more first class because of the name.
Hard to believe I've been on hold for 3 hours... seems like they aren't doing nothing at all

IF YOU LIKE TO SMELL SEWER WATER STAY HERE! I had a horrible experience at MGM Grand. It will be my first as LAST time here. The whole outside of the building and inside of the room smells like SEWER. I asked if they can do something about it and they did NOTHING after they said they would. I had to buy febreze and and spray the whole room everyday. There is urine in the elevators. The staff will not accommodate any request. I asked for a later checkout the first person told me $50, then another one said $75, then went up to $375.. All for a later checkout?! I will NEVER RETURN TO MGM. It's old and you can tell there's no updates. Take your money to another hotel on the strip. They do not care

Ok, check in was good and the room was clean  but the moment you arrive . Your fresh meat, everything costs a fortune and is lackluster. Food quality is pretty bad and a $$. Monday morning 3/9/20 went to breakfast and was served room temperature water and cold coffee. Went to the buffet for dinner 40.00 a person and the staff did not even serve water. Had to walk over to the refreshment area. All you can drink beer and wine, on a buffet line really.... Carving board was pressed turkey and was either prime rib or roast beef that you could hammer nails with. Breakfast was 30 a head at the Ave Cafe for a scramble and a coffee. Watch your bill, adding stuff and charging extra. The casino bar was good .Dave the was knowledgeable and a good bartender. Had a beer at the "Tap", 16 bucks for a 24 ox anchor steam. Last time I was in Vegas was in 2007, has become a rip off and a cash gouge. I only lost 5 dollars in gambling. Had a brain dead milanial finger my casino chips at the roulette table. Had no facial expression, I was a bit upset and he got up and lumbered away from the table and the petite Pinoy female running the wheel did nothing about his behavior. I'm a young Boomer 57, there are rules in the casino. Good luck Las Vegas and in my opinion, it's " Snake Eyes". Poor manners and rude folks and I almost feel that the Rat Pack are rolling in there Graves.

When planning our spontaneous trip to Vegas we decided to stay here. We booked the cheapest (and smallest) room they have, the West Wing King. Upon check in they upgraded us for free to a grand tower room!! Great customer service and so friendly! Hotel is clean and the beds are SO comfortable! Will recommend to anyone coming to Vegas

Horrible Customer Service! I Booked a Roll in Shower Stay Well Room online. Even got a confirmation from them that said, "Roll in Shower" in the email! We checked in, went to the room, only to discover it was a Tub Transfer Room. I Called the front desk. The person I called said they were the same. They are NOT the same. Any person with a disability will tell you that. I asked to talk to a manager. After being put on hold for 15 minutes, we hung up and went to the front desk. The first thing the staff member we talked to said was that I must've made a mistake. Even after I showed  him the email from Their Own Reservation System showing that the room I reserved was listed as a "Roll in Shower", he refused to acknowledge that I was right. Eventually, I again asked to talk to a manager. He went in the back, I thought to get a manager, but he came back without a manager, only to offer us a downgraded room and $50 Food Credit "For our Trouble." We took the deal even though it was nowhere near enough for the way we were treated because we were exhausted and just wanted to get on with our vacation.My main questions are1) Why are Roll in Showers available on the Stay Well Reservation page if, "They don't exist"?2) Why was I never allowed to talk to a Manager?3) Why did their staff assume that I made the mistake? Isn't the customer always right?4) Why was the solution to my complaint to offer us a "downgraded" room?I have Relayed these concerns to the MGM Grand, but doubt I'll receive a satisfactory reply, so we will probably never be back.

MGM Grand is a dump just like all the other Mlife properties. MGM International can't even afford to have someone monitor their yelp and other social media pages lol. Clientele is really low rent. Room service comes on plastic plates. Machines are tight like everywhere else.

We go to Vegas every year. This is the first time we've stayed at the MGM. We paid to upgrade our room and I would hate to see what a non upgraded room is. This was no more than a standard room. Believe or not we upgraded to a better room at the Luxor for less and it was amazing.  The room at MGM just had a regular tub/shower and a chair in the bedroom.  View of part if the pool. It was the beginning of February all the pools were closed and still had to pay the resort fee full price. The buffet is probably the worst on the strip. I asked for a refund on the upgrade or resort fees and was simply told sorry. Will not be back. Mandalay Bay or Luxor hands down better

I've stayed here a couple of times. MGM has one of the best pool areas in Vegas. They have multiple pools on property and a large lazy river (I believe it's one of only three properties that have a lazy river). Also, one of their pools has a waterfall. When it's 115 degrees outside, there are plenty of options to stay cool. I enjoyed floating around the lazy river on a tube while drinking a large Fosters. This is Vegas and finding anything cheap here is like searching for water in the desert. The tubes are an additional fee to rent and beers are expensive but that's expected when visiting Vegas. The views here are easy on the eyes. It's nice looking up at the palm trees and the clouds in the sky.

Who doesn't know about the MGM Grand on the Vegas strip. Had the luxury of staying here on my first visit to Las Vegas. It's beautiful. Big, bold, lots of lights, gaming slots, indoor night club and tons of restaurants. Visited the gym located by the spa - it was clean and friendly. Stayed on the 17th floor facing the airport and with a good view of the  Luxor/ Tropicana and the air strip. It was a 5-8 minute walk to the actual Las Vegas strip from the front lobby but you can cut through the inside of the  MGM grand and end up on the actual strip. It is located at the beginning of the strip I feel. Hakassan night club was fun but make sure you grab a card or ask one of the promoters (quite a few hangout on the strip) to put you on the  guest list. Just helps you skip line btw. We were on Stephanie's list and honestly I just met her out on the strip one day. Drinks average about 18-22 bucks a drink so be ready with your wallet. Those are LV club prices Also went to the Brad Garrett comedy club. Bought tickets online an hour and half before show time. Hilarious lineup but the drinks are so so so so overpriced. We spent about 80 bucks with an included $10.98 gratuity for just a table of two It was me and the husband We only got 3 drinksBut otherwise great experience 5 lion roaring stars

The buffet is not that great and extremely overpriced. We added the tip in when we paid for our meal. I'm not sure what we were tipping. We never were asked if we needed anything after the host seated us and had to track down someone to get a couple of napkins. We stayed in a Stay Well room which was nice but it took over 15 minutes for the bathtub to drain and the sink also drained slowly.

GET THE STAY WELL ROOMS!!! Apparently they're the rooms with purified water and air purifiers!! Something I wish I would've known earlier than wondering what the StayWell sign next to a couple floors where about, then having to google it haha.  I highly recommend these as my room smelled like sulfur from the bathroom (sink and shower drains). Plus the air down stairs is sooo thick with smoke you'll be begging for some clean water and air!!! (Ps the cheapest bottle of water in the casino is about $6-8 so I recommend going to a store half mile off the strip and stock up!) When i checked in, my check in was fine, but as soon as a friend who was coming with wanted to get a room (they just got a flight and figured a room would be available sense they have so many. They gave her a hard time on prices and availability, despite being told many times over the phone that it wouldn't be an issue and we could even get our rooms on the same floor, just ask again during check in. As we did, and still got a good amount of attitude from the counter person. Im talking taking our IDs and going into the back room for atleast 10 minutes to come back and say "I guess we can make this work".... Otherwise they need to get a better way to the pool. I dont care what you say. If you keep saying you have 6.5 acres of pool... how does it take 15-20 minutes walking from my room to get there... in a towel mind you. You literally have to walk through the entire casino and hotel, passed the Ka theater etc etc.... technically, if you look at google maps. You cross a street to get to the pool.  Which was closed at the time lol.

Strictly went for the casino for a friends birthday we entered the casino about two to 3 AM completely sober we did not have any drinks we did not partake in any party activities we go to the gift shop to purchase a juul and the clerk tells us that the price is going to be just about $20 we are super surprised we confirm the price before purchasing because it was unusual how cheap he had said it was. He confirmed with us a second time what the price was . We agreed before we can ask for a receipt or get a receipt he he quickly helps the next customers so we didn't worry about it . The next morning we are charged 70 dollars . Be careful for their unethical practices. Chances are if they are willing to go out of their way to cheat you over an item in their gift shop then chances are their games aren't ethical either . I have been to Vegas four times I live in California and do plan on visiting Vegas again but never will I ever be caught in such a trashy establishment. I am a woman of taste I make sure I am an ethical woman when it comes to business and practicing my work and I would never support or be seen in an establishment with such low ethical practices. A good business doesn't need to scam you out of your money because a business worth spending your money at you will do it voluntarily. I am embarrassed to even think that I was associated with MGM over the weekend and I will never make that mistake again and believe when my friends ask me what hotspots to check out in VegasDO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME

I stayed here for the first time this past weekend. I must say I was not impressed with my room at all. The only reason I can give three stars is because the customer service was on point! Thank you for that. My room was in the West Wing which I think must be their oldest rooms. First the hallway is like a mile long . When you walked in the room you basically walked into the bathroom. There was a door to the toilet but it was all open , when you step out of the shower you're basically stepping back out into the room. The chair was cute but super uncomfortable. The floor to the shower was peeling. The room was clean though and the bed comfy ... kudos for that. I won't stay again but if you do don't get a room in the West Wing.

The MGM Grand was once a great property that led off the Las Vegas Strip. Sadly that is no longer the case!It has become a run-down, filthy facility that seems almost dangerous to it's guests, especially the West Tower rooms. The rooms are dark, dirty and so far from the casino and restaurants that one must wonder how they received the necessary approvals to build a place this large and spacious that the time spent walking is truly annoying and unacceptable. My room's shower was not seriously cleaned by anyone and the television constantly was off line. The hallways remind me of a 1960's public housing project with filthy walls, carpeting and poor lighting. I personally saw a room attendant use a dirty towel to "clean" the shower floor. It was disgusting. The stench from the casino is almost unbearable and the time to ban smoking is here and now. There is no justification to continue smoking unchecked and I feel for the employees who must endure this every time they enter the casino area. The one thing I will say is that the person who checked me in was Melyania who was professional, cheerful and accommodating. The MGM needs more employees like her!The resort fee is a complete rip-off and the place is in dire need of a face lift. I hope management looks at these observations and make some serious corrections to the facility itself. I cannot recommend.

The only negative thing I have to say is the customer service is way below standards at the Spa. I was there for a convention, so I knew that I couldn't book an appointment because I wasn't 100% sure I could make it. I found myself with 2 and a half hrs of free time and thought let me go see if they have someone that could do a manicure and pedicure. There is a desk at the very beginning, which I waited at for 15 minutes before being able to talk to anyone because A. They had a lady going through her entire emails looking for a discount in her emails (which they were a little rude to) and B. The only other lady was in the middle of 3 transactions. 2 other people walked out of a door behind the desk, but just ignored me. When the lady who had handled the 3 transactions was finished, she told me I was in the wrong place and had me go to the actual Nail Salon (would've been nice to have it posted somewhere). When I got there the Nail Salon lady told me that she didn't have time right now because, she just took a walk in right before me. So, I could have gotten them done, except I had to WAIT too long at the initial desk.

Sadly the MGM has had better days and is past its prime - needing a lot of TLC.  We arrived to a line of over 20-25 ahead of us at checkin waiting at least 30 minutes to checkin...only to find our room wouldn't be ready for several more hours.  We were directed to the luggage service to drop off bags, who were prompt and efficient.  A few hours later, I received a text with notification that our room was ready.  We went to pick up our luggage to avoid a wait to have it delivered as we needed to change for a scheduled meeting.  This round at the luggage stand wasn't good.  The automated kiosk wasn't working and the staff literally ignored us.  Once to our room we found the space was good, but the room itself needs a lot of tlc.  The most notable lack of care was several areas where the wallpaper was discolored and coming off the wall and then a dirty bathroom (floor not clean nor the tub surround tile) and the shower curtain was visibly stained or dirty.  Our bed desperately needs to be replaced.  It was very uncomfortable and any movement made the frame squeak/rub against the wall.   I had to rethread the blackout blind on its track each night...otherwise the room was full of light.  Whenever an adjacent room came or went, it sounded as if someone was trying to open our room lock.  It was startling to say the least.  And the doors have NO secondary security locks/latches on them.  Sadly we had 2 separate occasions where we had NO water-just air coming thru the pipes.  And another 2 separate occasions with NO hot water.  So frustrating.There is NO in room coffee - paid or otherwise and the fridge is stocked with overly priced items that if you attempt to move for your own items result in a $50 fee.

We stayed here for 5 days, over a weekend for our wedding in Las Vegas. It was about $850 for 5 nights. I really liked the location, right on the strip. There is a whole mall underneath the MGM with shops, restaurants, and an IV recovery place called REVIV. The rooms were very nice and clean. We had a great view in our room. It had plenty of room for me and my bridesmaids to get ready. We had a hair and makeup team come to the room for us. The hotel has a great buffet and the MGM Grand Buffet. We ate there for brunch. It is expensive, $30 per person. But I feel like everything in Vegas is expensive.

Worst customer service imaginable. They promise things and don't deliver. Lies, lies, lies. The Vegas casino market is too competitive to deal with a property that treats their customers like they don't matter. And their employees know it!  A bartender comped me a $150 tab because he understood the crap I had dealt with. Stay away at all cost, it just isn't worth it.
Nothing special but at the same time no problems either besides no way to reheat food in your room so don't bother taking anything home

**NOT KID FRIENDLY** EXORBITANT $40 Resort Fee added DAILY to your bill at end of stay NOT included when booking your room. BEWARE. Where do I even begin with place??Let's start with check-in. As my husband was waiting on the long check in line, my little kids were tired and I saw there are NO BENCHES OR CHAIRS provided in the lobby area. Not a SINGLE a thing to sit on. So, they sat on the FLOOR. Within 5 mins a security guard comes over and tells me kids CANNOT sit on the floor and must stand. Hello, what are they to sit on? He tells me MGM once provided seating but since non-hotel guests were sitting on them, they were removed. So, they penalized hotel guests along with non-hotel guests by removing ALL seating. So thoughtful of them. #2- Main pool was closed and the closest heated pool was, and I am not kidding was a mile away. You could see the MGM building from the pool it was that far. Nice considering the ridiculous mandatory resort fee includes the use of ALL pools. Also pool closed at 4pm! #3- No microwave and fridge is stocked w hotel food and drinks and if you empty it out to put your stuff in there, you WILL be charged. #4- Extremely dated hotel room and we were on a non-smoking floor but room smelled dimly of cigarette smoke. It wasn't strong but if you hv a sensitive nose it will bother you. #5- MGM is not centrally located and old. If you're a childless adult and like a modern, sexy, centrally located hotel, try Aria or Cosmopolitan. Aria is particularly gorgeous. #6- There was a fight exhibition going on and the lobby area would be packed!! If you like large crowds by all means stay there. The one thing I did like was the shower had great water pressure. And that was pretty much it. Upon leaving I complained to the front desk about the seating and lack of pool experience and she agreed MGM is NOT a kid friendly hotel. Also, she wasn't concerned our stay was sub-par and sent us long. She pretty much embodied the overall attitude of MGM. Never again.

This place is definitely over rated $42 a day added for resort fees after the cost of the nightly rate! Parking over priced ! Rooms nice and clean but pretty plain in consideration to the fees , taxes and stay fee. Paid for a strip view and for a roof top view with a piece of the strip. The resort itself has so much to offer but with all those resort fees it's almost better not to do anything if you are on a budget. But who visits Vegas on a budget anyways!!! I'd stay here again if I get an amazing offer but won't be my choice for a strip stay again.

We go to Las Vegas usually twice a year and this was the 2nd year with a convention we attended being there so we stayed there again thinking maybe last year was just off for them. Upon arrival extra long waits to register. We checked our bags and when they arrived we mentioned the light next the bed was flickering and wouldn't stay on. We checked the plug and didn't help. The porter said he'd send someone to fix it but no one showed so we called down and no one ever showed. We also had a $30 credit for food and drink per day and when we checked out they said we only got about a $35 credit total because we didn't use it st the right places and room service wasn't one. What??? On top of that they charged us a $30 late check out fee. Besides our charge for an upgraded room (strip view but the window was filthy) we had another $430 in charges and the manager didn't care to honor any of it or even cared to know more about the flickering night stand light. It's a dive and won't go back to the MGM even if the convention is there. I believe our company is not going back either. Not friendly staff. We like Vegas but not there.
Absolutely stunning! Loved it. Visited for the first time. Attended NDWA National Domestic Worker Aliance & electoral candidate conference
location: South San Jose, San Jose, CA

review_text: Not what I expected for the MGM Grand, nothing Grand about it just an  average hotel. $90 bucks for room service breakfast which came in a paper sack, not on a cart with trays. No in room coffee, it's quite the journey to go get coffee.Very disappointed.

We stay here every time we come to Vegas. I love the location, all different kind of room options, always clean, staff is always friendly and accommodating. We love the lazy river and pool options.  Enjoy there are so many restaurant and entertainment options within the hotel from fancy sit down to food court grab and go. Love Brad Garret's comedy club.

Omg... SAVE YOUR $150 PLUS  per night..... PLUS PARKING. !!! Employees OBVIOUSLY hate it here.  Shana ? (Manager) in the Losers bar (should have known when I walked in) was so RUDE. You can read my other reviews.. as I'm not wasting more time I. My life on this.  All I know... is I'm disputing this on my credit card.  GROSS.

All around poor experience. For a 4 star hotel, the rooms were filthy and outdated. There were multiple mishaps during our stay including the water going out, the toilet leaking and being locked out of our room despite confirming having late check-out. From Wednesday evening it was noted that an eaten tray from room service was left outside our room by previous guests. Despite daily maid service it was still there later Saturday afternoon when we checked out. I know this is a multibillion dollar conglomerate and my complaints mean virtually nothing to this business, but would alert others to perhaps stay at a newer property. Also find it absurd there is no coffee machine in room and you are penalized if using fridge for personal items and for not buying the 30$ can of Pepsi inside it.

Stayed here over V-tine's weekend. The last time I was here was 15 years ago. It was not great then but this time, I could clearly see that time has not been good for the place. We booked a king bed and were placed in what appeared to be an add-on wing. The room was TINY, the bathroom had no counter space and NO DOOR. It was dark. Very dark. There were few amenities - only soap, shampoo and conditioner. There was no coffee pot, no fridge, etc. Bed was extremely uncomfortable too. And, with the gap under the door, it was so easy to hear each and every conversation by anyone walking past our room. We feel seriously taken advantage of - the three-night stay was over $1000 once all fees and parking were added. Never again.

The hotel has gone downhill terribly. Paid for late checkout upon booking, confirmed at check in (which was also a very poor customer experience also), only to be harassed by House keeping. The front desk denies they allowed late check out, yet it is verifiable on their website stating 3 pm and were very rude and too lazy to even look at the computer to verify. Beds were hot and uncomfortable. The buffet costs as much as Belliagio, but is worse than the cheap ones on and off the strip. Showers were cold. They don't care about the customer whatsoever. If someone goes wrong, expect to be treated like their verifiable lies are on repeat and no one will make an effort.

I decided to use a free Hyatt night in Las Vegas so that my daughter and I could have an over night trip. We arrived at check in time and were given a room on the 11th floor. When opening the door we were invited with an extremely strong cigarette odor. We called the front desk thinking maybe we weren't given a non-smoking room. We were told all rooms were non-smoking. The front desk said they were fully booked and would send someone with air freshener. When the employee came in our room he immediately stepped back and said "Wow, air freshener isn't going to help here." He attempted to get us a new room but was told to use there machine to clean carpets. We went to the front desk and asked for a new room. They obliged which we were pleased with, no biggie. When arriving to the new room we entered to a dirty room that was not cleaned from the previous guest. We called the front desk again where she apologized, stated there were no other rooms available, and she would credit our room 2 buffet meals and when we returned the room would be ready. We had Mastros dinner reservations and didn't want to eat a big meal for lunch but decided to just go check out something light to eat with some wine at the Buffet. I'm very easy going so at this point I was okay with MGMs mistake and attempt to make things right. After the buffet and some gambling we returned to our room almost 4 hours later. The room was still dirty. I called the desk apologizing for my frustrations but this is the third time upon arrival  that I am calling about issues with our room. She apologized again. We were unable to take showers and get ready for our Mastros reservation because we didn't want to use a dirty bathroom that was not cleaned from previous guests. We threw ourselves together for dinner. Upon leaving for dinner reservations the housekeeping staff had finally arrived. I was so displeased and am not sure how there can be that much lack of communication among staff. I know I used a free night but I spent a lot of money to obtain that free night award and wish I would have used it at a different hotel. I have stayed at MGM signature suites before and have always been pleased. Needless to say I'm not sure if I'm willing to give MGM another try.

When you pay $20 more for an upgrade and the front desk sells you on it's a newly refurbished room but once you get in the room you say "this is new!" Honestly what a dump! it was very disappointing. It looked like an old room and I think we just got hustled. The door handle was broken to the restroom. The bath tub did not drain properly, it was backed up so you're taking a shower and a bath at the same time. It was just horrible. We didn't bother to call the front dest because all we wanted to do was go to bed to head out the next morning. We were just there for one night and to get a room like this was very disappointing. Wont's be staying here again.

Pros: Great room rates for mlife rewards members. Nice room. Friendly staff. Fast mobile check in. Request late check out. Check out online. Pet friendly.Cons:Parking is $15/day. System was down so my mlife rewards card couldnt be upgraded (the upgrade would have given me free parking). Requested late check out and put the do not disturb sign on the door, but housekeeping came to the door multiple times and even opened the door to ask when we were checking out.

Not sure why there are so many negative reviews--maybe the casino wasn't generous....We had an awesome weekend at the MGM grand.  The people were incredible.  You won't find better service in Las Vegas.  Check in, check out, baggage hold....quick and efficient.  People at this hotel care and it shows.Our room was perfect.  I am very picky about mattresses and pillows and these were superb.  The room was also immaculate.  It had a huge walk in shower too.The MGM grand is a *BIG* place.  If you prefer a smaller place without a casino, the MGM Signature is behind it (much like a Courtyard by Marriott style).  But if you want to be close to the action, stay at the Grand.  We ate at Craftsteak--DO NOT MISS THIS!  Morimoto was also excellent!   We also went to the buffet for brunch--come hungry!The hotel is conveniently located.  There is a tram stop if you want to go far--but there are a lot of interesting places to eat and play nearby.  (We recommend Eataly at the MGM Park!)We had such a great time.  Highly recommend the MGM Grand!

Well there were a group  of nine of us that stayed here for several days.  None of our sinks were  draining correctly took several calls to get them fixed. These rooms are VERY small and rundown nothing was working like it  should. And the elevators are two football fields apart so either way it's a very long walk. Also the smoking smell is  the worst  of any Casino we went in they just  don't ventilate them well - all the other casinos have it down.

The hotel is very clean and the staff are very nice. The beds are hard, there  are no coffee pots in the rooms and the light sockets are very loose. It's  hard to charge a phone because it kept falling out. Also, they don't have any USB to charge devices. Probably won't stay here again.

Booking this hotel I had a much higher expectation considering that it's at the MGM GRAND. I mean the name sounds pretty GRAND. Well I booked the GRAND KING STRIP VIEW room. First of all I paid extra for strip view and what I got as my view was the back side view of the strip which were back of buildings and what not. Second, the pictures online as your booking the hotel look very updated and very luxurious. The room was not very clean the bathroom was very outdated and there was mold inside the shower area, around the mirror, and the sink was clogging up which was gross. I definitely had higher expectations. This hotel needs some serious updating and more maintenance in hotel rooms and then maybe what you guys charge will be worth it. But, the front desk staff was very nice and helpful ...

Unfortunately we did not get what we paid for. We were very excited to stay at the MGM grand and were  recommended to choose to stay there by multiple people. The USB chargers in our room worked fine the first day we stayed there, but by the second day they stopped working completely and we ended up with dead phones the entire day and couldn't even take pictures of Vegas or contact friends/family. Also, our water was shut off with no warning or explanation and we had to wait for it to be turned back on which put us way behind schedule and forced us to have to cut things out of our itinerary. When it finally was turned back on, there was no hot water and we had to take freezing cold showers. The  bed sheets and comforters had stains on them, and we were also double charged on multiple things such as resort fees and taxes. When we saw our receipt at check out, we decided to talk to the front desk (thank goodness we did). We found multiple discrepancies and were told "sorry about that" and given about $100 back. Overall, we spent about $3000 for three nights at the MGM after buffets, shopping, gambling etc., and couldn't even take a warm shower. I never write negative reviews but I feel it's important to share how disappointing this experience was. We loved Vegas and will definitely be back, but we will not be checking in here again and recommend others don't as well.

MGM is definitely a "grand" hotel. The ambiance of this place is great. There is plenty to do without leaving the hotel. The suite was huge and clean and stocked with everything one needs. The service was prompt and staff was wonderful!

Where do I start??? Save your money this hotel is horrible. I stayed for 4 nights and my room was not cleaned once. The 2nd night when house keeping came I asked if she could come later once we were gone but that never happen. I had to call myself everytime I needed towels. This is the first hotel that I've been to that I ran out of toilet paper and had to leave the toilet to call and have it delivered. Had they been doing there job this would be avoided. The resort fee is way over priced for the service that you recieve. When I called down and said the room wasn't cleaned the lady just said she would bring towels up. I'm embarrassed of the amount of trash that's in the room because of the housekeeping neglect. This was my first time here and will be my last. Also, the room I was given has no fan in bathroom so everything is so stuffy. The management really needs to do something to correct these problems.

I tried to be positive after finding hair that wasn't mine in the sink and on the bathroom floor. I tried to be positive when the carpet in my room and bathroom floor were soaking wet. But after finding a mysterious  brown stain on my sheets on my last day in this hotel I am so disgusted. I was here alone, I did not have any potty accidents in the bed (LOL) and I don't drink coffee. But there was a huge brown stain on my bed. Picture attached and also the staIn is clearly a fresh stain it's not like a faded stain that did not come out in the wash. And that's after requesting an extra room cleaning because I found brown hairs in my sink. I am blond. Do they never change the sheets on the beds ? Or do they reuse dirty sheets ? And after reading these reviews I found I am not the only one with these issues

I have been to Las Vegas many times, but this was the first time I decided to stay at the MGM Grand Hotel. Was not a cheap stay, I figured let's give it a shot. Paid to have my room ready early, so I ended up on the second floor, which turned out to be a mistake. I was enough to hear the elevator "ding". I also was fortunate enough to hear cars driving right by my window and people talking to the late hours, outside of the window. Strangely enough I could hear people peeing, as if they were right next to my bed, toilets flushing. By far the worst stay I've had in the 21years I've been coming to Vegas. Not one to call and complain, I'm getting ear plugs for tonights stay. Personally I'm never coming back to this hotel again. To make matters worse I couldn't even watch ESPN in the morning, because the channel kept saying out of service. For the price I paid, wow It's like I stayed at a Motel 6, but at least the TV works at motel 6!

Check before check in what amenities are you stilettos to have in your room. I reserved the king size bed, and there was no mini bar, no coffee maker (not included they say, you can order fresh coffee and it be delivered), no bottles of water. The bathroom was unique, no private area to get dressed. If you don't want to walk far from the casino, ask for room near the closest elevator to casino, otherwise, it is a far walk. Also, no mini frig unless you pay. Even if you needed to store your medications, still have to pay
Public areas are updated and nice but my room in thE west wing looked like a throwback to the early 90s when this place was built. At least it was quite and comfortable.

My room was horrible.  The toilet seat was loose. The toilet paper holder was coming off the wall. When we took a shower the water backed up 3 inches in the tub and wouldn't drain. When we called about the problems we waited over 2 hours for someone to come. We need a shower chair for bathing as my daughter and I Aaron both disabled and the board they had in the shower was so low we needed each other's help to get up. They tuck all their sheets in so when you turn down the bed the bottom sheet comes out and you are left to lifting the mattress to tucking  it in yourself. I got the higher shower chair to put in thee shower after 2 hours but as I write this they have never showed up. I have called maintenance or what they call engineering several times and have even tracked down a floor supervisor. No ooze has ever come to fix the problems. Maybe MGM needs a facelift.

With the MGM Grand just recently being sold to Blackstone Group, I hope nothing changes in terms of quality and service. With the MGM Groups attempt to make a big splash in the Japan Gambling Market the company was forced to take a huge financial move recently by literally selling off some of its most popular and valuable properties.If anything else, thanks for all the good times!

I had a weird first start here: Within 20 minutes, I told the front desk clerk I was happy to be there with this being my very first stay at MGM Grand AND then soon after, I told the Mlife assistant this is my first and LAST time ever staying here. I believe I made a mistake online when I was offered 2 nights comped and unfortunately only booked 1 night. The front desk clerk told me I only had 1 night, and I corrected him, telling him I had 2. He stated I only had one night booked and the second night would be about $94 (not to mention those nasty resort/parking fees this company started on the Strip,) but I should be able to talk with the Mlife Players Booth to attempt to get back second offered night.20 minutes later, I spoke with the Mlife employee and she had to call her manager. I stood there while she had a personal conversation with the person on the other end and was laughing and laughing. When she finished, she put on a different face and told me it was absolutely impossible to comp me a 2nd night despite the offer. I asked if she was for sure since this is the absolute worst way to woo a new customer to a casino. She was definite. She told me it was based on availability and I would have to pay $94 (plus those crummy resort and parking fees.)Just so you know, they have 7,000 rooms - I believe the 3rd largest in the world? and the place as I observed that weekend, was more than half dead. There were no lines to the lousy buffet, no wait on any machine or table, the bars had many seats available. Additionally, I come to Las Vegas 4-6 times a year and bring available cash to gamble as entertainment. Believe me, any casino wants a gambler like myself in their place.I decided right then and there, I would never, ever give MGM another dime of my gambling money. I've heard so many horror stories about their business practices in the past such as the aforementioned terrible trend of resort/parking fees and the ways they treat and lay off their staff and for years, despite my established Vegas spending habits, they've never given me comps, so I've all-but ignored them. Suddenly, out of the blue, they start sending me offers. So, I took them up for the previously mentioned 2-night stay at MGM Resort. Yes, I did make the error online inadvertently only selecting one night. This is the easiest mistake to correct and profitable for the casino with the money I bring throughout the year. This is a way to keep a customer for life and spread good word-of-mouth for a company known for nickel/diming and pissing off their patrons. And whenever I've had a bad experience at Caesars, they immediately go out of their way to fix it and make me happy. Sadly, I thanked them for going to their competitors. I'm sorry I did that, Caesars and please know, thanks to MGM employees, I will be back to you with all my money.As for the rest of the place/experience, the room was alright. Nothing at all special and had blood (rust?) stains in the bathroom. The bed was okay, but I've had so much better in Vegas and the Eastern view they gave me was thee most bland and boring I've ever seen and I do love me some great views when I stay in Vegas. Caesars always makes sure I have a beautiful view of the Strip WITHOUT CHARGING ME.I've had their buffet once, maybe 14 years ago. I thought it was so incredibly bland and boring, I've never returned until now. I was going to use that $50 resort credit at the Aria for a real buffet, but of course, at MGM, they stated I could only use the free $50 at the place I was staying at (this is NOT the case at Caesars.) So, I was forced to try the Strip's worst buffet again. The food selection was small, it mostly soggy and barely edible. I think I did like random Pizza/Pepperoni taquitos, but that's hardly worth the incredibly low $18.99 price tag that morning. And speaking of which, that should be a huge red flag, if the NO LINE AT ALL wasn't enough. If you're paying under $30 for a buffet in Vegas, it should be considered to be of the same quality as the buffet in the movie Vegas Vacation. Final words on that buffet: you have to get your own drinks and no straws, unless specifically requested. So, I did and I've heard of that awful change to paper straws which was based on a viral myth but up to this point, I've never had one. Now I know why people hate them. They're awful!! They taste terrible making whatever drink I have unbearable. So, I have the choice of putting my mouth on a glass millions of people have or the terrible taste of paper straws. Thanks, MGM.MGM, you had two huge opportunities to resolve my error and you failed both times. I kept to my word and didn't give your resorts another dime of my gambling money. I went across the street to the new OYO and Tropicana. They both had incredible and fun staffs and I made sure they all knew how I was treated across the street.I hope you read this MGM Grand and take this to heart for other new customers to your establishment.

The Bad: We didn't have a good experience at this hotel. We had a room with one king sized bed. It didn't feel clean. The bed was made (at least they have that going for them), but the floor felt and looked dirty with spots. The walls had many marks, the paint was coming off the drawers under the TV, there were small holes in the wall around the outlet panels.The room smelled dirty and the bathroom smelled a little like sewer water - even after multiple flushes.We went out for the night, and when we came back,  the sink top and glass shelf connected to it was flooded with water and it dripped down to the floor. Our stuff on the shelf was soaked. It turns out that the sink was leaking at the point where the faucet meets the wall the whole time we were out.The Good (which brought this review up to a two-star rating): they have mobile check-in. After waiting in the mobile check in line for 25 minutes, we were greeted with a friendly woman at the desk.I would not recommend this hotel for staying in. I won't be staying at this hotel again. I would rather stay across the street at Park MGM, or the other hotels around even if it meant paying $100 more per night.

My family came to the MGM grand to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. We have been to Vegas many times, but this was our first time staying at the MGM grand. We specifically picked it after reading good reviews. Unfortunately our experience has been less than ideal. In fact, the only positive thing I can think to say, is that the view from our room on the 18th floor of the grand tower is nice. We opted to use the valet service which was an additional $35 a day. Once we were in our room we discovered that the mini fridge is stocked with items that are weighted so that nothing can be removed or added without being charged. Two members of my family are diabetic and refrigerate their insulin. When we called the front desk we were told if the insulin was placed in the fridge we would be charged $50. They opted not to refrigerate it. As our luggage was being delivered to the room, we struck up a conversation with the bellman. When we asked about activities for kids, he informed us there wasn't much for kids our age to do. (They are 6, 9 and 10.) This was quite upsetting to us, as many reviews we read mentioned the family friendly nature of the hotel.Our room did not have a coffee pot, which we found unusual, but perhaps that is common in some strip hotels.The internet did not work well at all for us.On night two, which was a Saturday, our room began smelling overwhelmingly of marijuana. I'm not just talking about a slight smell, it was very strong. Eventually we called the front desk and they sent someone with some type of machine that sprayed cleaner on the carpet. For a short period, we had that smell to deal with and then the pot took over again. We smelled pot off and on our entire stay. We made multiple calls to the front desk and though they acknowledged it and sent then carpet machine. The smell never stopped. I see in their policies that they collect a hefty fee for anyone who smokes in their supposedly smoke free hotel. However, we were never offered any sort of discount of our resort fees or even a chance to change rooms. Also, I believe the room above us was a nicer room with a balcony of some type, as we heard noises of people walking around, moving furniture and playing loud music until very late one night.We also learned that there was no room service offered. Apparently they cook your food, package it in to go boxes and drop it off. In my opinion, not having room service at a hotel of the MGM's caliber makes no sense at all. I'm actually not even sure if the take out food service is available in all rooms. My family had two rooms. One room had a menu, while our other room had no menu or food option on the tv menu. We were both in the same hallway, just at opposite ends.At midnight, we attempted to find late night food. We were turned away from 3 of the food court restaurants by staff telling us they were closed and finally went for pizza, which I believe is the only hot food option after midnight inside the MGM.Unless there is another pool area that I'm not aware of, the pool was very small. Yes, the lazy river was closed for the season, but the only open pool was very small. I saw other pools, but I believe that even when they are open, they are adult only or private pools I can only imagine how crowded it must get in warmer weather.We check out tomorrow and perhaps I will have an update to this review. At the moment, I would say that we've truly been made to feel how insignificant our families experience is. For us two rooms for three nights plus everything else really adds up. I know it's nothing to the MGM and they could care less if our family comes here again, but maybe one family will read this and reconsider staying here. I can tell you, we will never stay here again and we will tell everyone we know about our experience.

Worst experience,  will never comeback here. No one calls back. Customer service is awful.  TV is out for 2 days , sinks are clogged.  Offer 100 in food credit and  that's  after around 4 phone calls and going to front desk. Mlife member for over 10 yrs ... Mandalay and Delano always a great experience. MGM is awful
Long long wait. Look like a old 2 star motel. Not worth the money they want for this place

Went on stroll through the MGM and not much has changed as far as the casino side but the restaurants have definitely changed and the shopping side has changed as well.  There's lots of entertainment her tooBrad Garret has a great Comedy club as well as CSI new adventure to go on as well.  Shopping is on the pricier side but you must expect that being the stores being on the strip and in the MGM Grand.  There always having there nightly clubs and weekend concerts and of course the KA show which is just amazing.  You won't be disappointed.  They also have Pieology and Subway if you want yo eat reasonably Even if you just want to walk around the hotel you will find it delightful

I know my one little review means nothing to a corporation this size.  However, after today I felt compelled to post.  The security people here are the worst anywhere ever.  You are in Las Vegas, people are going to take pictures!  However, they seem somehow offended if you do. A few months ago I got run off by a security guard for trying to take a photo in the lobby by the big lion during a boxing fight week.  Are you insane? You have a huge lion, a boxing ring, etc.  However, you post security there making sure nobody takes photos?Today, I was near the entrance to The Park (MGM Property) and we briefly broke out the camcorder. This security guy comes in practically at full sprint to tell us it is private property and we can't film there.  WTF?  OK, MGM, I won't film there. I will just stay away all together

Customer service at the M life hotels has really gone down hill. My family has stayed here the same weekend for the past 12 years. 5 rooms. 3 nights. My octogenarian father has a heart attack the week before we arrive. He's fine but can't make the trip. MGM makes me cancel ALL the rooms to refund his and then as I'm rebooking the 4 the rate is $150/night/room... never  again. Not here.... time to move down the strip.

We stayed 3 nights in the West Wing, which I think are MGM's most "budget" rooms. I read some reviews before we went that terrified me, but we had a good stay.  Contrary to what some people experienced, we had plenty of hot water with excellent pressure and I really enjoyed the shower.  The room was nice enough, though a touch shabby in some details like chipped paint, worn chair, tired sink grout, carpet, etc. The clock radio CD player (cd player!? Lol) didn't work.  I guess that kind of gives you an idea about the age of the hotel. We both slept well and I liked the linens and comforter.  I also liked the layout and the closet.  The frosted glass doors of the shower and toilet area were not a problem, except that our handles were a little loose so they were a tad noisy at times. I really liked the location of the west wing and that if you take the west wing elevators down, you are very close to doors that exit almost right onto the strip. It was incredibly convenient to have that entry/exit so close.  Also, I called the front desk a handful of times, and there was always someone answering right away.Our view was even good, looking out over The Mansion next-door, and with some side views of the strip. I absolutely cannot complain.  Also, our room was cleaned very well, and the staff was pleasant.Also, one of the best things about this hotel is that the pool was open during our January stay. The water was a warm 80/85°, and we were by ourselves swimming most of the time. They had to have lifeguards there to watch us just to obey the rules, but it was very relaxing. The Jacuzzi was also open, and was great!  The whole pool area is absolutely stunning. You need to wear clothes from your room to get there, because you were walking quite a distance through the entire hotel, but there are bathrooms there where you can change. From other people I talk to, their hotel pools were not open at this time. To me, this was a real plus of staying at the MGM Grand.The rest of the hotel and the casino itself were beautiful. There are plenty of high-end places to eat and things to see. The food court offerings had a variety, but they were expensive! There is a conveniently located ABC store just up the strip, which has a lot of affordable stuff. Likewise, there is a CVS also just up the strip on the other side.We decided to see the show KÁ there during our stay. We got tickets from the box office the day of the show, a Tuesday. The person selling us the tickets made it sound like we were so lucky to get these great seats and that usually they were gone. Granted, they were in the center section, and not the sides, but at the time of the show, the theater still had tons of seats that were empty. As I understand it, the show has been playing there for well over 10 years. It has some amazing features that are specific to that auditorium, so it will never go on the road. I think it is worth seeing, but I would make sure you get a deal on your tickets on a weekday. I think ours were $79 plus the booking fees. We were in FF in the center section. Would I stay again? Yes, I would, as long as the pool was  open.

Was only staying in Vegas for a night so decided to book via mobile app since the rates were pretty cheap along with a late check out, which I always do every time I'm in Vegas.  Checked into the hotel room approximately 9:30pm without any complications.  Did not have a do not disturb sign to hang outside of our door.  Around 9am housekeeping barges in and asks us what time are we leaving.  I had informed her that I had a late check out which she asked what time would that be and I said 3pm.  We get ready to grab some breakfast and walk around for the entire afternoon.  At 2pm we head back to the MGM and enter the elevator with a bunch of other patrons. About 25 floors up we realize there's something awry since we cannot access our floor with our room key.  So then I had to make my way back down to the lobby, stand and wait in line at the front desk to get help.  The gentlemen informed me that there was no indication that I had a late check out, but he immediately rectified it and gave me a new room key.  We just hang out for the remainder duration of the time in the room, packing up, and trying to be courteous by emptying out some water bottles and alcoholic beverages and throwing away our trash. It's 3:00pm when I check out via the link in the email they had sent me.  Suddenly I hear a knock, it's the housekeeping lady, I apologize and inform her that we're finishing up and about to leave. It's 3:05pm when I hear another knock, this time it's a supervisor telling us that check out was at 3:00, I tell her we're literally on our way out. Probably will be the last time that I book at the MGM.  FYI the strip view isn't even worth it.

Not a bad hotel/casino, but apparently a functioning room key to operate the elevators is a herculean task. Multiple keys used, and a litany of failures. Next time I come to the strip, it won't be this place.

My family stayed at the MGM Grand for 3 nights and 4 days from Friday to Monday. Overall the hotel is very nice, rooms are clean and there is easy access to the whole strip. One complain I do have is don't spend the extra money to get a room with the view of the strip. I uploaded a video and I don't thing it's worth the extra cost. Plenty of dinning and options to eat. This was just a family stay no gaming. My kids are 10 and 7 and they had fun of sure.

The MGM is known as the place to be for a great boxing match. The grandeur of the entrance along with its reputation make it a place to visit on the Vegas strip. The hotel is home to loads of great restaurants ranging from high-dollar meals to grab and go snacks. The casino gaming floor is large and quite clean. Loads of slot machines and plenty of table games are available for patrons. Check-in at the MLife counter to pick up a card to use and accumulate points for gaming and dining. These can be redeemed later for some nice benefits. The biggest drawback to the gaming floor is the amount of ever-present smoke. I sooo wish there was a larger non-smoking section and better ventilation in general. As a non-smoker, I didn't like inhaling so much 2nd hand smoke while playing or my clothes smelling like smoke when I left the floor. I realize that's a part of playing casino games but this gaming floor was much smokier than some of the others I visited on this trip. The hotel room was just average. Although I stayed in a more recently renovated room, it was pretty standard. There was a free safe in the room but there was a $35 fee to use the mini fridge. Also, no clothes could be hung up in the closet because of the super musty oder inside of it. It appeared to be the result of water damage seen on the ceiling. Overall, I had a great time but I think I'll stay elsewhere on my next visit.

I was disappointed with the condition of my room during my latest stay at MGM Grand. The bathroom sink was cracked, the marble bathroom floor was damaged, the desk chair had torn upholstery and the easy chair was soiled and gross. I'm not certain if this room was an outlier but in any event the housekeeping staff should have removed this room from being assigned to a guest

I would stay here again if I go back to Vegas. We got a good deal for this hotel on m life and sort of last minute booking. We booked a couple days before our trip. We stay here over the weekend and got the west wing room. I wish it bigger but it was cozy. The hotel Is better than one I stayed at recently And it doesn't have that old smelling building or that's strong scent of smoke through out the casinos and hotel. This hotel have lots of options for food and places to hang out. One of the popular club is located here. The casino is huge and lots to see. The parking to the hotel is a walk though where you're practically walking through shop and store just to get to the check in. I wish that this hotel charge for parking since we are hotel guest  and already paying the resort fees.The services was good and friendly.

******BEWARE OF THE WEST WING****** The room I had for 3 days was terrible! We were told & directed to the wrong room number to start off, when we arrived at our correct room, finally, it immediately smelled of moisture, mold & just wetness. The floor was terrible to step on with bare feet. There was MOLD around the (cracking/peeling) shower floor, ceiling & around the window seal (I took pics to prove). I work in a hospital, do you know the hazards of breathing in that type of stuff?!?! We picked up the bucket to fill with ice, the WHOLE TRAY came with it, we had to peel it off, needless to say we didn't use it for the ice! It was stuck to the tray! Proof that it hasn't been cleaned since who knows when?! The room was cleaned, bed was made, pillow cases FILTHY (more pics taken)! The iron didn't work! There was a spot in the mirror that we swore was a camera with a black box in the middle that was covered by a sticker! Oh I took pics of EVERYTHING! We had no wet bar (refrigerator/microwave), I think that should be verbalized to anyone who's staying more than one day, "this room is NOT equip with these specific items, if this is a necessity, we suggest this other type of room", SOMETHING! Anything verbalized in case it was looked over during online booking. With MGM, I expected so much more, better! I felt as if I could have booked a room at a motel closer to the airport & had a better (healthier) experience. When we mentioned our room woes, we were simply told "oh that's the old wing of the hotel." Never again!
Here are the pics of the upgraded room! See my other post regarding my experience at the MGM! I suggest you get a room located in the main section of the hotel....The West King Suite looks horrible!

Old and run down. The "spa suite" with no robes or sandals. Called down and they said they did not have any.  The room was so dingy and dirty that we were scared to walk around without shoes on. Unfortunately this used to be a glorious and beautiful hotel... now it definitely shows its age.  The line to check in was approximately 200 people. A couple ticket redemption machines were broken. The hot water did not work properly. Both sinks backed up and wouldn't drain.  Will look elsewhere next time.

Friday night at the MGM Grand and so far absolutely nothing grand about it. Went ahead and got suckered into signing up and providing them with my info with the promise that I cOuld skip the line and go straight to my room but a huge outstanding NO! Had to wait in line for over an hour to check in with ONLY 3 attendants. Manager type person walks by and and reminds everyone that it's busy because of it's Friday night. Really?!? That's your response to not being prepared for a large crowd of people checking EVERY Friday night? Really?!?How about getting behind the counter and moving this line instead. How about better pre-planning and schedule more staff during high traffic hours? How about your app advertising of no check-in by downloading the app and providing you with my personal information. So far not the experience we were looking for and/or the experience I'm used to when I come spend my gambling dollars in Vegas. So far just a shame and just too bad!

Cool hotel overall but our room was very outdated and coming apart. Anytime we opened our bathroom door, it screeched a sharp noise and the floor of the shower was painted concrete. The wallpaper was peeling off and our blankets did not feel clean. I've stayed in other hotels in Vegas and this one fell very short in comparison.

One of the worst hotel I have ever stayed. I checked in around 8ish and found out there was no hot water. I was so tired so I took a quick shower and reported the problem next day. I was told there will be a technician coming to fix it. Then I went out sightseeing and return to my room afternoon. Saw a note stating the issue was checked with noticed temperatures of 109. Then I checked there was still NO hot water! I called and reported the problem and was told our room will be moved to another room AND our room key is reprogrammed to the new room. However our key can not be used for either the elevator or the rooms. It ended we got locked out from our own room and stuck in the elevator area. We had to ask the cleaning lady to open another room so we can make the call to the front desk as we only brought the room key with us.  The security guard get to stop us to move. After all these I was told the bell guy will deliver a room key to my new room. I asked if I could have two room keys instead and they said NO and I had to go to first floor to get the second room key! I asked why and they said it's policy! Then the dell guy brought me a folder with key, as I opened it there was TWO keys! The new room has hot water but it leaks the water to the toilet area. At the point I stopped fighting and just sucked it up...not the mention the new room is next to the elevator and constant moving noise...oh no to mention the dirty carpet! From this whole experience no one in the phone ever said a single word that they were sorry this happened.

Oh MGM, what did you do to Room Service? Now we come here quite a bit, but room service here will never be the same, and oh what a disappointment, as this is my Momma's favorite place to stay when in Vegas. Our check in was nice and smooth, no issues with nice a breakfast discount in the Avenue Cafe. Room service is a ritual for our first night, and we will usually go all out. We ordered a steak entree for my mother, an order of soup, chicken noodle, a flat pizza and a chicken entree. To our complete surprise when the order arrives the gal is at the door holding 2 large white take out bags, umm what??? They must have gotten rid of half their kitchen supplies because now they have gone green. Please, dont fr me wrong, I am all for no waste and making things easier on the environment, but this is just silly. All the plastic containers and actually everything is such a complete waste. I love a table with a white cloth and plates and utensils and salt and pepper shakers and bottles of ketchup, mustard, the works as it should be.  This wasnt it. And we were not satisfied. Honestly, our decision to revisit hinges on this room service change. It's so sad, but I think its goodbye MGM.
Bad experience. Dirty room. Poor ventilation. Far away from entrance. Long line to check in. Basically anything and everything you can think of that could be bad is bad.

Ok, I haven't been in Las Vegas in years so I was shocked by the hidden fees, or in my case, unaware fees attached to my supposed room deal at the MGM. After a 25 minute wait to check in, suddenly my $85 a night deal was bloated by some $45 BS resort fee plus tax, a night. On top of that, $15 parking fee per night. I would rather have all the fees included in one price for my room instead of having the check-in person tacking fees, making me feel like I was experiencing a mugging. I guess this BS business practice is common practice along the strip but that doesn't make it right. Now the room was tiny and the bathroom offered MINIMAL privacy. Oh, and no tub. The entire hotel carried the stench of smoke and the hallway along the west wing was dingy, carpeting was dirty-kinda gross. I was relieved to finally leave the MGM Grand hotel. If I return to Vegas, I'll be far more careful where to stay but the MGM will not be on that list.

This place blow my mind! Worst stay I have ever experienced from any hotel!!! We had no hot water in the sink and it was hit or miss in the shower after multiple attempts of having it fixed, service thought it would be a good time to call our room at 2AM " who does that?" So see if the issue was resolved "it wasn't " after letting them know it wasn't, they made to attempt to fix it or change our room it was a 5 night stay. They clearly didn't value there long time customers!!! I'm only writing this review so no it be makes the same mistake of staying here!! The rooms are in shambles I took pics of the disgust this room was in! Good luck to you if you ever plan on staying here. We will never make that mistake again!

Worst customer service ever. Takes forever to check-in because of long lines. They charged both of my rooms for parking and the customer service representative was too stupid to be able to understand the problem on the phone, I had to go through the long line to see the front desk person. I order shampoo for both rooms, they only delivered to 1 room, then came 1.5 hours later to deliver to the 2nd room despite it being after midnight and by this time there was a Do NOT Disturb sign on the door. The buffer is absolute garbage and expensive. It is freezing cold in winter going to the parking garage even underground. For the money it is not at all a value!
trying to even out this 3* average -- we've only stayed here once or twice but they've been great to us. thank you all!

In terms of casinos in Las Vegas, people always want to talk about "THE BEST" and for some people it comes down to amenities or pricing, but for me it's customer service and at MGM I have to give it up to Zac and Adelle, because they are the two best hosts in all of Paradise!

This is my first trip to Las Vegas. My husband suggested we book the MGM Grand Hotel because of it's  great service. What a disappointment. From the time we checked it has been a continuous disappointment. We have been here for two nights and we have three to go. I can't  wait to leave. Service cleanliness and quality have been the worst. I will never come back to this hotel.

Beware of the bait and switch!A group of us found a "deal" with MGM during their black Friday special for a room in the west wing. Even though we asked for our rooms to be next to each other,  we were all spread out. When we expressed our concern to concierge they modified  the location of a couple of our rooms and said that's the best they could do and that everything else was booked.So we were temporarily satisfied until we checked in and saw how deplorable the room conditions were!! Their west wing is a depressing dungeon with unclean and broken room fixtures. (See pictures) My group and I immediately went back to concierge,  this time to a different representative and after showing pictures and expressing how unfit our rooms were, we were immediately upgraded complimentary to their grand suites. What was even better was the fact that we were all on the same floor just a few doors down from each other. Before we were all on different floors without access to each other's floors and it was a hot mess. Im not sure why one representative told us that the rest of the rooms were booked,  but then a few minutes later a different representative was able accommodate us....But after the whole room ordeal we had a great time.As a business owner I'd be ashamed to offer these rooms to guests. So buyer beware! Do not stay in the west wing. MGM purposely will lure you in with a low rate hoping you will hate the room and pay for an upgraded one.

I surprized my girlfriend with first time to Vegas. Forget booking MGM. They dont care because there house is full. I checked on after 3pm after booking king bed. The guy at desk said uh maybe you get one 3 hours from now. Take a two queen beds or leave it was his policy. Apparently he does not care a long with hotel. When you want a special time they for sure did not come thru. Book anywhere close like Ny NY you will get people that actually care.

Long wait lines to check in.The valet costs $24/night and you have to wait for up to ten minutes for your car.The regular priced rooms are dark smelly and cramped and you'll have to upgrade for a standard room.The wait staff seems overworked and snippy. Horrible experience will never come back

Shut down water for the entire floor without notifying hotel guests. When I called to inquire the reasons, they simply said that there is a leak and they had to shut down  the water for an hour. She hung up the phone before I could even say anything...completely rude and worse service I have experienced.

Upon arrival we were greeted with warmth and kindness by a hotel employee, Ari. She was amazing kind, fun, and professional while checking us in and was able to provide us with a room upgrade and started our vacation off right. I will return to this property because of the very attentive staff and clean atmosphere.

We reserved a West room. The molding on the floor fell off, the door to the drawer under our TV feel off, the air conditioner wasn't working, and the closet for keep opening causing the closet light to come in and shine in our face while we were sleeping. The sound of someone else flushing their toilet and the water running in ours is extremely loud and obnoxious and you have to let the dinner run for a while in the shower before it gets hot.I literally called the front desk 6 times before the closet light was fixed, but the air conditioner was still broken. The guy who came to check out the cost just removed the lights altogether around 11 at night and said he'd send someone the next morning to fix the ac and no one ever came. We had to call the front desk soon. The front desk person did wave the resort fee for one day since we had so much trouble, then when we had to call the second day a supervisor upgraded us to a nice suite. We got into the suite and when we got settled our bathroom sink filled with black stinky water without being used. We called the front desk again and they said they would send someone who arrived at 1:30am after we were already asleep. The guy blew air through the pipes to clear them and my husband cleaned up the mess with our towels. The mechanic was super nice as has everyone been, but this is ridiculous. We considered staying another night, but the process have gone up even for the crappy room and the front desk is not willing to accommodate at a discounted rate for all the trouble. That would have been a nice gesture considering all the triple we had to go through switching rooms and everything else on our Christmas vacation. We'll be checking out tomorrow to go to another hotel. I gave them 1 start because there service people have been really nice.

Buckle in and let me set the stage. My brother in law flew to Vegas with a woman he had known for 8 days, with the intention of marrying her. She paid for everything. He was in an electric wheelchair because he had just had surgery to repair his leg that was broken in 6 places. Three days in, there was a fight, and he was abandoned in a paid hotel room at the MGM Grand. He only had his ID, no credit card, and not a cent to his name. He is a moron. He had the room for one more night until his flight home. Why am I giving this review? Because the lucky lady bailed on my brother in law, which was probably the best choice she could make. He called for help to my wife and I in Seattle, and we called the MGM Grand, attempting to put our credit card to use to keep him in the room, that was already paid for. The problem was that they have to have an active credit card on file for the room, even if it is paid for, in order to charge the daily resort fees. Attempting to just pay it took hours, on Xmas Eve. We had to get some sort of credit card form emailed to us, and faxed back to them, and eventually after numerous phone calls we think everything is good. We think my idiot brother in law is back in his room and we can actually have Xmas Eve dinner. We then get a call that he was locked out of his room anyways. His room, that was already paid for one more night with our new credit card on file and charged for $41 in resort fees, with an additional $15 to pay this way. He didn't have his phone charge cord initially, so he used the in-room phone to call Seattle to beg for my wife's help. This cost $27 per call. It counts as part of an incidental for costs applied to the room, but they will NOT apply that to the credit card we spent hours, a half dozen phone calls, and an extra fee to set up. There is around $100 in charges. We ask how we can pay that from Seattle, and the staff were not very nice. They said he had to pay cash. We pointed out he had none, and we had been on the phone with them all morning setting up the new card. They said he could walk to somewhere to get money. We pointed out my idiot brother in law was the man sitting on the electric wheelchair charging it in the lobby because he was stuck with a broken leg. He had no phone charger and was unable to coordinate otherwise. We were not given any options, and the staff just kept dropping our calls over and over until we gave up. While my brother in law is a moron, he was a man in an electric wheelchair that was trapped in Vegas until his flight. We were nice, we conceded that my brother in law was a complete idiot. We just wanted to pay for his costs and get him back. I'm not sure why my wife wants him back, but there you go.  The capper on this entire thing? They charged our credit card for the resort fees for my brother in laws room, that they locked him out of.  We called around and found the La Quinta that was 1.5 miles down. We were not sure his electric wheelchair would get him there so my brother in law charged his electric wheelchair in the lobby and went to the La Quinta. He barely made it, slowly beeping and dragging wheels into their lobby. The La Quinta is supposed to be a low-end hotel, but damn if they didn't do literally everything possible to help out.
