They were nice on the phone. Let us know exactly how to pay, and even let GrubHub deliver to the lobby and bring it up the idiots room for him. They even loaned the moron a charge cord for his phone. They were the nicest, most helpful people ever. The MGM Grand? It was actually on my list for a place to stay for my 30th wedding anniversary when we were planning to fly down to renew our vows. Now? There is no way in hell I'd stay in the place because the staff were awful when there was a clear emergency. I have literally never been in a situation where I was willing to throw whatever money it took at a problem and had people totally uninterested in taking it. It was absolutely absurd.

Booked the Stay Well Suite for Christmas and was totally UNDERWHELMED.     The decor feels outdated, the room is not very clean, the couch is sunken in, and there are stains on cushions and carpet.  Honestly, I expected more from this hotel.    MGM not Grand!!!

First thing first. Room was small. The bed was blocking the window so inorder to see the view, you will need to step on the bed to look through the window. Room was next to the elevator so you will hear the constant "ding and the lady announcing "Going down" when you're trying to get some sleep. To get to your room you will walk through the casino towards the end. I will definite not recommend the West Wing Rooms but then again all rooms are West Wing per the signs on the casino. To top it all, I have to pay $15/night for self-parking and Valet is $24/night. Resort fee doesn't include parking. I have been an M Life member for years but this experience made me not want to be part of it.
How is it that this place is so well built generally but has no bathroom fans? Every hotel I've been to in the developed world has them.

The worst experience I've ever had. Rude staffs and uncleaned room. I was assigned into a uncleaned room in which unflushed paper was remained in the toilet. I called the front desk and asked for help. The MGM stuff didn't offer any help for more than 30min. I called again and they front desk eventually said they cannot find people to clean the room. After I told them I cannot stay in a disgusting dirty room, they agreed to change me to another another room but with worse window scenery. However, the MGM grand never apologized to us although I think they should.The MGM grand charged us "room no show fee" since we arrived at 10:30 pm without showing us in advance. They refused to explain while I had no time to argue with them since I was in rush to the airport. It was the first time in my life to be charged because of showing in the evening. I am not sure whether it's common in Las Vegas or it is MGM's secret policy.I was stuck in my room for more than one hour because the MGM's elevator somehow didn't work. In short, I feel like no one cares about or respected my concern when I was staying at MGM grand. I would like to share my experience and never recommend this hotel. Definitely, I will not spend my time at MGM hotel anymore.

Stayed at MGM grand for a conference and while it wouldn't be my first choice on the strip, it wasn't a bad stay for the most part. The appeal of MGM has to be the casino and the restaurants itself. The hotel room seemed a bit dated and lacked a microwave and refrigerator. Instead, there was a refrigerator with stocked items. The beds were comfortable and there were ample towels and amenities in the bathroom. The tub had trouble draining sometimes which was annoying but we got thru it. I can see myself stopping in again on my next trip to the strip but probably not staying there. The Wolfgang puck bar in the casino was quite good and the drinks were phenomenal. The servers were sweet and provided great recommendations on things to do and shows to see.

I checked out of our room at the MGM Grand Casino in Las Vegas earlier this morning around 11am this morning. And I'd like to let you know that I am completely disappointed in the level of customer service I received from Catherine, the manager that was at the check in counter. We stayed at your location to see the Ariana Grande Concert last night. Before leaving for the concert we turned the heater on so the room would be warm upon our return. When we got back to the room, this was not the case. Our room was at 68 degrees when we returned and continued to drop throughout the night. We tried turning the heater all the way up, as high as it could go and no hot air would come out. I called the front desk to double check that there should be heat in our room, and there should had been. We explained the situation and she asked if we wanted to have someone come look at it, being that it was past midnight and we were ready for bed, we asked if they could bring up extra blankets since we didn't know how long it would take for them to look at the heater. Upon checkout we explained the situation to the women, and I asked if we could have a partial credit since our heater was broken and we had to go through the night with no heat. This is when she grabbed her manager Catherine, and this is where everything went south for our stay. Instead of Catherine being empathetic and understanding, she took the stance of judgmental and accusatory. Catherine gave the excuse that because I chose not to have an engineer come to the room, that she would not be giving me any credit. It didn't matter to her how late it was. Nor did the front desk women that assisted us ever mention that I would forfeit being compensated because I'm not having the heater looked at. Catherine even said she could had moved us to a different room, as if making us pack up all of our stuff at midnight was a practical solution.Catherine's customer service skills are sub par and need to be looked into. Catherine gave a multitude of excuses as to what I should had done differently to why they need to have an engineer go check. Her reasons for why the engineer has to go check came off as though she'd rather assume I was lying rather than give me the benefit of the doubt and correct my unsatisfactory stay. Catherine also insulted my intelligence and said a reason an engineer needs to check is in case I don't know how to use a thermostat. I'm left wondering if these assumptions made by your extremely defensive manager is because I'm a minority and she's stereotyping me. I expect better from MGM Grand and I was left completely disappointed after this interaction. Your manager Catherine deeply needs sensitivity training. Catherine gave me the run around and minimized my issues and brushed them to the side. She said she'd have an engineer go look at the room and follow up with me today and that has still not happened, I've also sent an email to the hotel concierge and have also not heard anything, so now here I am leaving a review. I want this issue addressed. A customer should never have to be insulted and assumed to be a liar and treated as such when they bring an issue to the staff's attention. I expect more from MGM, your employee completely dropped the ball.

The iconic MGM. Where legendary boxing matches have occurred. However MGM now is everything wrong with Vegas now. Outrageous prices for everything. Went downstairs to their mini mart to grab a bottle of booze. 40 dollars for a pint of mid tier vodka? The lady said the price is correct. Wow. 15 dollar a day parking. Wow. 45 dollar daily resort fee. Wow. I know these fees are common for almost every hotel on the strip, but this much for a dated hotel? Room was adequate enough. View was decent. Stay away from the mini bar too. They'll charge you 50 dollar restocking fee if you even place a couple items in there. Internet speeds were acceptable. Only reason I'll visit the property is for Top Golf and see boxing match. The restaurants are also absolutely insane with their pricing. I'm not old enough to experience old Vegas and the amenities and cheap prices. But it's night and day difference even just 15 years ago where bit bosses were loose on the comps, food was cheap, and the major hotels didn't try to nickel and dime you too death.

Nasty!! We were excited to stay here again for the NFR. We stayed here for the rodeo two years ago in a stay well king suite and LOVED it!! Not the case this time!!! We are traveling with another couple and told them we wouldn't stay anywhere other than MGM, now we are embarrassed that we recommended it! We are in a west wing king room and it feels like a prison cell! Super small, old, run down, dirty, and the bathroom looks like it's straight out of a prison documentary! We called the front desk to see if we could upgrade to the room we loved a few years ago, unfortunately they are completely sold out for the night on all their rooms (not sure how!) Next time we are in Vegas we won't be returning to MGM and we definitely won't recommend it ever again!!

Likely would not stay here again.  Here for a convention being held at an off-site location.  I had done a pre-check in in the am as went to a funeral in am then drove 4 hrs from California.  Arrived at 9:30pm with husband.  Although had the precheck in and a room number, when got to desk they switched our room to 2 queens from a grand king.  Said there were no more king rooms although I had done the precheck.  They had no explanation.  Had no recourse.  Got to room and there was no blackout curtain just a see through shade.  Room had green glow from window til middle of night because of the green lights outside.  Fridge not usable because full of extremely expensive items and if you moved anything, look out.  Everywhere in hotel was expensive, even for Vegas.  Felt nickled and  dimed for all.  Lots of restaurants in hotel were closed for refurbishment.  Felt that hotel lost some of the elegance it had when it opened.  Room did have good mattresses.  No clock.  No modern charging or USB ports.  Only a few plusses such as having Pieology and Hecho de Vegas in house which were good meals with friendly servers.

I will never ever ever ever ever ever ever ever ever ever stay here again. I've stayed here for over 10 years and the customer service just keeps getting worse and worse and worse. Here on a birthday stay and my boyfriend has never stayed here and I finally convinced him to stay here and it's been the BIGGEST disappointment ever... I will always go back to bellagio. I've never really stayed with third party sites until recently but I personally worked for a hotel for years and always treated every guest the same, clearly in Vegas they don't see it that way at MGM and they treat you like garbage specially when booking through a third party. Bellagio treated us as if we booked direct and saw and acknowledged my mlife and was just all around a better hotel/customer service experience. They clearly have higher standards at bellagio and a few others but no longer at MGM. Booking direct and spending money is all they care about. I understand it's high volume here but that's no excuse for poor customer service. And then when making complaints they extra give zero shits here and enjoy hanging up on you and saying things in a rude manor. Sad to say after I depart I will never return to this property.

The legendary MGM Grand. This hotel is a staple of the Las Vegas Strip. Think about the countless number of legendary boxing matches held at this hotel. The bright green lights projecting off of the side of the hotel at night. Everybody knows this is the MGM Grand just by looking at the green shade. The downside of the aesthetic is that the light is on all night long and you can't block it off in your room. If you're sensitive to light you might find it difficult to fall asleep here. The room shades on partially block out sunlight but the green light seeps right through. The hotel is pretty old but the room remain clean and organized. The only mishap I experience was a momentarily water shut off in my room. Yes, towards the end of my shower the water stream got weaker and weaker. Luckily I was almost done and not all soapy. Once I turned it off, it was unable to turn on again for at least an hour. Not sure what happened but definitely not something you would want your customers to experience at 9:00PM. Other than that, there are plenty of food selections in the lobby. They have anything from food court type restaurants to $100 per person high end type restaurants. I think this location is ideal for people attending events either at the MGM or Mandalay Bay. Otherwise they are at the south end of the strip and it's a bit of a walk to the other attractions in the center of the strip. There is a monorail at the hotel but it cost money. Remember when those used to be free? I had a decent stay at the hotel. Just the whole water issue left a bad taste in my mouth.

My husband and I booked a non-smoking room here for our 20th anniversary, and checked out 15 minutes after we checked in.The main reason was that while the room was supposedly "non-smoking", you have to walk through the super-smoky casino to access the hotel rooms...and even the elevators and hallways on floors that were supposed to be "non-smoking" STANK of cigarette smoke!If this doesn't bother you, then you'll probably have a grand ol' time here.  But for those of us asthmatics, this was a nightmare, and I was wheezing literally within minutes.  We had to check out right away and find other lodging at a non-smoking property instead.A smaller detail that made me uncomfortable there was a store right by the main lobby called "America!" that featured a bunch of rude pro-Trump t-shirts, as well as some generally misogynistic "joke" t-shirts.  I guess some of their clientele enjoys crude, misogynistic, off-putting political "humor", but my husband and I didn't and were happy to get out of there!  I also wouldn't recommend staying there if you have children who might see that stuff, either, as it's inappropriate for kids and unfortunately hard to avoid seeing as you walk down the hallway.  Your grandmother probably won't approve, either.Accessing their parking area is a nightmare, as is trying to get anywhere near the valet.  It's honestly so stressful, it's just not worth staying at a place with such extreme traffic snarls!  I didn't find traffic/valet access nearly as bad at other hotels on the strip, and I think this just boiled down to poor design in this case.Needless to say, this simply isn't the hotel-casino for me, or anyone else affected negatively by cigarette smoke!  It definitely has a target clientele, and I am not that.

Lmao these mf maids stole my brand new ass shoes that I had bought from aldo. I made a report and N O T H I N G was done. Like y'all need to check the carts after every f*ckin shift or make it easier to get reimbursed!  I had a weak ass apology from MGM I still never got my money back. They said nothing could be done and kept it pushing. Y'all some Hoes fr. Also my friends staying in another floor had their backpack tampered with! They left it partially Open and the Maids went through It and CLOSED all the zippers. B*tch if you're Gonna try and steal do It right! Dumbasses. I'll never stay here again. I hope that whoever stole my shoes breaks their legs n their mama gets hit by a car lmao. Smh. Enjoy them shoes hoe!

I'm giving them a one because they deliver their room service in takeout bags, and on paper plates. Breakfast for 72.00 that came on a paper plate.  They've been doing this for about three months according to the delivery guy.  I have to say that because that's what they turned his Position into. The tip/ gratuity for the delivery was included in the 72 dollar for two breakfast.  I really don't like Vegas and they aren't making a case for wanting to spend any time in this city.

You know I'm 60 over 30+ entertainment visits to LV and this was by far the worst, stayed here once before when you were family friendly 1998, don't remember any issues plus kids had fun!. The men I traveled with yearly never stayed here kind of know why now... If it wasn't for Emeril's or Umbra the 3 would have been a 1 or 2. I normally stay at other resorts. My thinking was since I blew $1900.00 on concert tickets for Bocelli and our last trip into the T-Mobile arena was such a hassle staying elsewhere, we'd stay at the MGM Grand. Well first mistake if I had called I probably stayed at the Signature to avoid all the smokers and cowboys and of course I know people smoke but your air scrubbers are none existent. That's one hell of a mix of people opera and cowboys, I worked in Vegas for a few years with your RTC and PBR was always in January well missed this one, meaning the nationals, but of course it gets worse.Grand Arena: Your usher staff on the main floor well need some SERIOUS training. Were on the main floor seat 1 & 2 and of course understand we have to move to let folks get to their chairs. Floor section B, Row P seats 1&2. Show start time 8pm, actual 8:20 at 8:40 your usher blinded me with here LED flash light, then now listen and understand this she lets 2 drunks who are late, fowled mouthed enter to their sets which where 12 & 13, I only count 16 seat, this usher interrupted the entire row it was ridiculous, they should have entered from the other end, common sense, not your usher. I spoke to a supervisor and she asked what she could do. Well I said train your people. In a classical setting say such as our Phoenix symphony people are not allowed to sit during the show, only at a break are the allowed into their seats. This along with this drunks big mouth and your dumb usher was beyond belief for my wife and I. Let alone the rude people who were constantly talking during the show behind us which of course your usher could have asked them to quiet down as the filmed the concert with the light on their phone for at least 12-15 minutes, multiple times, just unreal more lights in our eyes. Took that usher, older blond usher who was pissed at the world to the end of the show to stop the filming, just a joke. Note: also one of your people up from at the VIP entrance who just started on some poor guy because I think he asked her to move so he could get onto the venue, she was really loud and rude. Writing this makes me think it was a dream, I'm 28 and went to a boxing match or MMA fight. What the hell is going on there? Also writing this I'm dropping your rating to a 3 for you it just not right or correct, except for our room was quite at least and normal room we lucked out there I think. I can tell you we will NEVER come back and spend our money no matter the cost elsewhere. This seems to be an issue at other venues we read about after our stay yesterday, even the Hollywood bowl people acted like they were at a football game as they did at your arena....Only Boston, my home town got good reviews, it's a shame I grew up well educated and with some sense of class. Oh yeah someone, AKA an usher maybe should tell the cowboys that were sitting on the floor that their big brimmed hats blocked other people's views, it was our lucky night not ours! only in Vegas.I'm coping and sharing this review everywhere I can, my wife will critique you on her own she is just as disgusted and will do the same with her review, it's all we got. She was unhappy in your billing process as well but go figure she's a Treasure dealing in millions daily, not a clerk at Circle K. I'm sure they will eventually come to your arena for classical music and drop coins. I'm sure their enjoying their big tax breaks and have the money.Emeril's Shaun sommelier and bar staff: Emeril you should be proud of your crew in Vegas they made up for a lousy evening of what should have been classical for Mr. Bocelli but MGM made sure they messed that up this past Saturday. First Emeril your wine selection was for lack of a better word one of the finest I've seen, please open a restaurant here in Scottsdale! You sommelier Shaun was just fantastic. The wine we asked for was not in stock and he pulled out a beautiful replacement and at a smaller costs which is always a plus. The wine was fantastic and so was your food! Hope to see you soon but it wont be in the MGM sorry, we'll see you on our travels sure thought I was at one of your places in Orlando years ago? Well cheers to your restaurant and your staff in Vegas, thanks for that good memory!

I find that over 4 decades of attending in Las Vegas Strip is over with me. Everything is for sale.I called to ask about my checkout and additional time beyond 11am is by $. If you are gambling in the sports wages area a tiny little bottle of water was $4.50. Self parking at $15 a night. I say that I am directed to this by the Conferences. The Conferences are lots of locations are going to change to reasonable properties or I am out. I am glad MGM are doing so well. But not me, ever again.

This is probably about middle of the pack in terms of Vegas hotels. Rooms are a bit dated -  could definitely use more comfortable mattresses and comforters (a bit thin). On the gambling side, was a bit hit or miss with how good the dealers were. Some were super nice and fun and made the experience great while others seemed to be just going through the motions and really made for a poor experience. I ended up going over to the Wynn on my second day in Vegas where the crowds at the craps table were much more energetic. The crappiest thing is what they make their customers go through to call an Uber. For pretty much any other decent hotel on the strip you just go out the doors and jump in an Uber. At the MGM you have to walk downstairs down a huge hallway and then into the garage where I assume employee parking is and then go to a specific level for Uber pick ups. Probably takes 5 min but it's just annoying. Are these guys getting paid by the cabbies or something cuz you can still get cabs at the front entrance, just not Uber. Why make your paying customers go through this loop if they want to take an Uber to avoid the risk of an unscrupulous cab driver who always wants to take the highway no matter how close the trip is? (Which btw happens ALL THE TIME in Vegas)
Plenty of better hotels the chose when coming to Vegas. Super outdated and underwhelming. Chose the Cosmo, Aria or Vdara!

This was my first stay at the MGM and I liked it better than the Park MGM. The beds, which is what the room is really for, are incredibly comfortable. My room was updated and stylish with glass fixtures in the well-designed bathroom area. Lots of storage and plugs where I needed them.  There was a good separation from the actual bedroom which made the room feel bigger than it was. Really great use of space. A small work area and closet finished the room.  The only downside is the resort fee which every hotel here seems to charge now whether they're resort or not.

I've stayed at the MGM Grand Hotel 2 times, both times in a nice big room with a wonderful jetted tub - but no strip views. I love their cleaning personnel​, the number of towels you get in your room and that you can actually use the Wifi. On the downside is the minibar​. Wayyyy overpriced (A small can of pringles for 15$ anyone?) and they warn you that they will charge you when you remove anything from the fridge (to put your own drinks in for example). If you're looking for prices for the minibar you have to turn on the TV, which I personally find annoying. We helped ourselves by bringing a soft-sided cooler bag and filled it with ice from the ice machine (and we weren't alone with that idea, as the ice machine regularly was out of ice).The hotel itself is really GRAND. It will take you at least 15 minutes from your room to one of the exits of the hotel, if not more depending on where you're going and how many people are blocking the walkways. But who wants to leave the hotel, right? I mean, they have a casino, an arcade, multiple restaurants for all budgets, David Copperfield​ AND Cirque du Soleil (Ka) all under one roof! Outside you can find their pools and lazy river (even tho the lazy river was closed every time I stayed here). Beware of the weirdly expensive pool side drinks. Their "stay well" floors are heavily scented, just in case anyone is sensitive to that and needs to know before booking. The staff was always friendly and helpful and the location can't be much better for a stay in Sin City.

Made a reservation in August for a weekend in December. When I got to my room I realized that they did not give me the room that I paid for and called the front desk to have them correct the mistake. They let me know that there was fine print that let them change the room at will and the room assignment was not based on what I reserved and paid for, but by how much I gamble (which isn't much). Stay away from this hotel unless you gamble a lot.
Great place.  Definitely not a family friendly place. Clean and helpful staff. There's better places in Las Vegas.

From all the live sports events and concerts, I developed a very positive image of MGM Grand. After staying there on my most recent trip, I cannot give more than 1 star. -The property feels old and outdated. -Their uber pick up is close to a 15 minute walk from your guest room and is located on the second floor of a parking structure, which makes it super inconvenient for guests.-Never book a West Wing King - I was assigned a first floor room, which is dark, and lacked natural light. The hallway is also used as a passage to   quick cut to the strip, so there was a lot of noise.-The resort tries to squeeze every dime from you; they will ask you multiple times if you want to check-out late, but this is not out of courtesy. They want you to pay $30 extra to stay for an additional 2 hours. -When you store your luggage at their bell desk, the ticket says "Gratuity Not Included;" When you pay a $40+ resort fee, you would expect them to store your luggage without trying to squeeze more money from you. -The location of being on far end of the strip also doesn't help, vs. Bellagio or its neighbors that are right in the middle of the Strip, which allow you to explore both sides with more ease. The MGM tram also costs money.-The two things I liked about MGM Grand was their 1 Michelin Star restaurant: L'Atelier De Joël Robuchon, and the Chinese concerts they put on with big stars. The MGM workers who worked the concert was also courteous and thanked us as we exited the stadium.

Dont ever stay here and if you do watch out for front desk manager Benjamin Vance. This idiot has no customer service training whatsoever. DO NOT book one of MGM's bait and switch promos where they offer you a dining credit per day etc. They have no intention on honoring it and will scam you when you try and check out. None of the dining credit will be applied to your bill as promised. The manager claimed first that the promo desnt even EXIST!. Then when I showed it to him, he claimed I actually didnt book under it. In other words, I am a liar!! This is how you will be treated at the MGM in front of other guests and your family if you stay at any MGM property, disgusting. I have fouhd out that this is not isolated to me and they do this to many many people. Hoping you won't speak out or fight back. I spent over an hour arguing with this idiot manager who outright refused to honor the promo and then when I would not stop requesting the promo be applied and a general manager threatened to have me escorted out by security! Stay away, keep your money, stay at a non MGM property, don't say you werent warned...
Stayed right after all of the major renovations.  Miscommunication with front staff but otherwise fine.

Our stay at MGM Grand Hotel could be qualified as very convenient. The Las Vegas airport is probably at most 15 minutes away from the hotel. The check in was painless. The rooms were just ok. We only had one set of shampoo, air conditioner and lotion for two people that the cleaning lady did not refill when she came to clean up. If you are into gambling. The casino is right near the lobby.

This an outdated, overpriced hotel. The room's quality was poor. The towels in the room smelled. The carpet had stains. The AC vibrated occasionally. The walls are thin -- you can hear everything . No body wash in the bathroom. Parking was painful. There are much better options in the area. This was my first time at the MGM and will certainly be my last.
Called four times in one day to get our room clean... finically at 10 pm they said your room has been cleaned and this is how they cleaned all room... MGM, the world's famous hotel....
I love this hotel. I have stayed in most of Vegas hotels but for some reason i like MGM the best. Love the hotel, casino, bars and the rooms.

Check In was fabulous but anything after that is beyond disappointing. Don't come here if u wanted be treated like your doing a favor that you choosed there casino. I been in the most  cheapest hotels but never been treated like this before save your money and go somewhere cheaper. You will thank me after.
First time coming here 11/25/19, very huge hotel. Lots to see and explore!  We came during thanksgiving week to sight see. Definitely in the heart of Vegas, super nice place! Thanks!

So just checked in today.. not happy at all with our rooms that was supposed to have a strip view because that's what I paid for per the Mgm website.. not only did I not get what we paid for but was also given the run around of excuses as to why.. business is business MGM.. and customers should get what they paid for.. failure to do so is false advertising.. Will never stay here again.. no matter what the cost.. defending not worth it

This was my first time staying at MGM and it was the worst experience. We got in pretty late Sunday night because they did not mention the LV marathon was happening that day when I made the reservation. It caused a 3 hour delay in our arrival. It was a little annoying, but we got over it. At check in, I asked for a late check out. I was in town for an interview and wanted to be able to change after before I drove back to California. The woman helping me was a little rude, but ended up giving me a complimentary 1pm check out. The next day, I left for my interview and my father went to go explore the town. He went back to the hotel around 10:30 and found our room open and housekeeping inside. He told her we hadn't checked out yet and called down to the front desk with her there so he could confirm. They confirmed our late checkout with the housekeeper there. My father then noticed his jacket was missing, so he asked about it and the housekeeper walked to her cart and pulled it out for him. He then noticed his phone charger was also missing and asked for it. She again returned to her cart and pulled it out. My father then got his things together so he could go out again. When he reached the elevator, he realized he had forgotten his wallet in the room so he returned for it. As soon as he arrived, the door was once again open with the housekeeper inside. He confronted her and she embarrassedly laughed, but no one was amused. I called MGM customer service that night to tell them of the event and they didn't really seem to care and offered me a refund on my resort fee. They didn't address the fact that their staff was trying to steal from us and I honestly don't think a $40 refund was sufficient. I would highly recommend reconsidering staying at this hotel.

The Grand Tower rooms are great. Very comfortable, spacious bathrooms with lots of counter space, fantastic views. We've stayed in this wing many times and never been disappointed.The West Tower rooms are the slums. Small, dark, little windows with poor views, depressing. I booked one accidentally, and immediately requested another room. Don't stay there. You deserve better and the price difference isn't much.The location could be better. It's towards the end of the strip but if you get comfortable with the monorail, that will help you get to other casinos. Brad Garret's Comedy Club is in the MGM and we usually go there one night while we're there. No drink minimums and they have good comedians. The MGM's Avenue Cafe is a great restaurant for breakfast. Our mothers told us breakfast is the most important meal of the day, so it got our days off to a good start. They have good service and a great assortment of breakfast options. Of course, they have at least three Starbucks, a Food Court, several bars, and numerous upscale restaurants to choose from, so you won't starve.

Stayed here this weekend and started off bad from the beginning. Our room was "down grated" to a standard room with 2 queens instead of a Grand room with a king and a view. The view we had was of an ally with garbage blowing around everywhere. So that sucked! Yes they comped our hotel fees, but funny how the last time I dated with them I was told those fees can not be waived. Make up your mind. So we get to our down grated room and want to put our cold food items in the fridge. There is a nice sign inside saying that of you want to put anything in the fridge it will cost you $50 as well as take anything out. Awesome! We go out for the night, and do some gambling and what not and get back to our room late. I want to take a shower but there is no cold water. The water was too hot to shower in so I just splashed the water on me from a distance. Woke up the next morning with an 8am knock on the door for housekeeping, but early if you ask me, and since I was up, I tried to shower again. This time, only cold water. We called down to see if it would be fixed. Never saw anyone come but they claim he did. Don't believe that one bit. We went down to watch football and back up at 1pm and the room was still not clean. We went to watch the next set of game, and at 4pm still not cleaned. We left to get some food and finally at 6p they were 1/2 way cleaning our room. We came in and stayed for about 15 minutes and the house keeper left and didn't finish the room. No clean glasses, old towels left, no trash taken out, empty cups and bottles on tables and old food left. The next day was about the same. The pool at the MGM is a joke! 2 pools open with blown speakers on a Sunday day in November. Yes it's not pool season and would expect a party or anything, but that's not what was bad about it. We called down and were told the pool was busy today and all the cabanas and beds were sold and taken. So we got down there to about 500 people covering and filling 2 pools open. 500 people and 1 bathroom with 2 stand up and 1 sit down stall for men. The stall was a wreck with paper and mess all over it. There was a baby changing station left open with no amenities for it and a puddle of brown who knows what on it. So unacceptable. I'm pretty sure I'd code enforcement went in there and saw 1 bathroom for 500+ people they would shut it down. I was directed to another bathroom that was pad locked shut! Needless to say we left the pool right away. We went back to our still in cleaned room and changed and left to go anywhere but the MGM or any of their associate hotels. Too bad they own 1/2 the strip.  We went to check out and asked to speak with someone and we were directed to Katherine Corona the hotels Operations Manager, well one of them anyway. We discussed the issues with here and she said that she took care of our resort fees, but that was BS because the guy that checked us in did that for us because of the room down grade. Katherine did absolutely nothing for us except give us a very robotics and generic apology and offer us food coupons for the MGM. Why would I want to spend another dime with them let alone stay there any longer and eat. I was very disappointed in both the MGM and its staff. Not very professional and can not keep the hotel clean at all.

Mini bar was was crazy overpriced and charged $35/day for a mini fridge in the room.  TV wasn't working and wouldn't give a time to get it repaired.  Couldn't find the cost of the mini bar items that were posted on the TV because it wasn't working. Front desk wouldn't give me prices over the phone and told me to check the welcome page on the tv (that wasn't working).  Water ended up being $10.  When I asked why I didn't have the fridge I requested on booking. I was told it was cuz I booked with a third party.  Maybe next time I'll book with a third party and choose a different hotel.  Check in was lengthy with only a few people working the desk at peak times.  Buffet was extremely overpriced at $86 couple for dinner.  Quality was mediocre.
My window's motorized shade curtains did not work and the maintenance worker manually pulled them down to close them. The motor still does not work and will not retract.

I did not stay here, I stayed at New York New York, but was at MGM to attend a show. Both my daughter and I felt the staff were rude. We sat at the bar to play Poker and wanted to order a drink. We were playing the minimum bet which is what we always do, whether it is slots or poker at the bar. He demanded we up our bet to 1.00 each time or we would have to pay for our drink. Really? I played slots and no such demand was made. I also asked for a bottle of water and was told it was $7.04 and was told I should go to the store to get it.

Conference Experience & Security Review+ a touch of room : After staying at this hotel for 3 nights for a work function during the same time as the Latin Grammy's I have mixed feelings. Since there are plenty of reviews based off the hotel, I'm going to review based off the conference experience & security only + a splash of the room. Security first: Overall positive- safe in your room is large and easy to use. Security staff everywhere (more due to the Grammy's which was nice) they were even checking hotel doors making sure they were locked on my hallway. I was walking to my room one afternoon, I was worried something was wrong and was informed - "no only checking and making sure doors were locked". Also they were standing guard at every elevator entry today (day of Grammy's) which was super helpful- people trying to get up to floors without a key nonstop yesterday which was brutal. Staff- Were all very nice and professional and very helpful. Rooms- Sooo wish there was a coffee maker in the room- there is none and the two tiny Starbucks they have for this massive hotel never seemed to have less than 30-40 people in line ever (5:30am + always a massive line) so give up on coffee here. Frig in the room- fully stocked which means DO NOT take anything out and put your own items in there- they charge a restocking fee $50! Extra frig for $35 a day if you need it?!! Um what? Conference rooms were freezing all the time and no tissues in the conference room bathrooms at all. It was brutal to have a cold and use paper towels to sneeze with. :( Walked 16-18k steps everyday to get from room to conference room - that's how far the conference center is from your rooms so don't wear heels!!! Cleanliness was amazing! Thankfully the floors were spotless! I mean spotless- the reason this mattered to me was I had to walk in my bare feet from my room to the conference rooms on awards night (heels were killing me) - the floors were so clean I wasn't worried at all! But next time- I would have brought some tiny flats!!

I was confused why there was no armoire to hang my clothes and no towel racks to hang towels, wash cloths., and that there were handle bars everywhere.  They have a couple of bars for hanging clothes, one so low to the ground that my clothes would drag on the ground that if I had used it, my clothes would be touching thenground.  Man - the shower head is 2 feet too low.Ah, they put me into a handicapable room. Several little inconveniences. Thank you so much. No idea why they stuck me in it. Can't store anything in the fridge. Need to rent a fridge?This place is not Grand...Oh, want an uber/lyft, just walk down stairs, through the tunnel, passed the subway sandwich shop, up into our garage.  Why walk a quarter mile unnecessarily?  Because getting tips for the guys out front is more important than our customers being happy. But, they have a golden lion...  enjoy.

Came here a few times for gambling and to see the copper field show. Overall the hotel shows signs of being dated. For instance the copper field auditorium feels like 1990s. The carpet and bathrooms are also dated and just feel less luxe than other strip hotels. For the gambling, there is a good and we enjoyed playing for hours. For the copper field show, the sounds and lights were nice but the storyline was cheesy. It seemed to be targeted to families but leaves the 20s- 30s crowd a bit bored.

Meh.  We stayed a few nights at Cosmo.  It's so much nicer, cleaner, and with better amenities and service than MGM.  Our MGM room was on the west wing and it looked like modern amenities very cheaply done and not maintained.  Should be cleaner.  Where's the fridge?  It's a fine room, but it can't compare with Vegas' nicer places. It's in a decent location.  Lots of bar and food nearby. Good casino.  Sink doesn't drain well. Baseboards were dilapidated.  I'm not staying here again.  Not all rooms have been remodeled.

Just got back from a 4 night stay here. When the hallways didn't smell like pot they smelled of urine. The only way to describe the clientele is they are a Jerry Springer crowd. This place is not cheap. They have an exorbitant "resort fee" of nearly $40.00 a day, (for what?) and a steep parking fee per day. The location is also a long walk from the action and the nice hotels on the strip. I was there for a conference and thought it would be convenient to stay there. NEVER AGAIN. Other upper-class hotels on the strip are cheaper in price with little or no extra fees or smells.

I stayed here for my birthday the weekend of October 15th. Check in was a HUGE pain. Even if you do the check in on the app there's a separate line to get in to check in, you guessed it, again. Wtf? That's just not convenient nor a good business plan. Our room was pretty nice. It was clean but didn't have a great view. There was an awful buzzing sound that incessantly buzzed all night long right outside our room. It sounded like a bad light or a light going out.. I wear ear plugs cause I'm a light sleeper but it was so bad I barely slept. The girl working at the convenience store in the hotel downstairs was SO incredibly rude. My husband said she was giving me dirty looks and then got mad when I gave her the right change and she argued with me till she realized her mistake. Ok if you hate you job find another one, particularly not helping people face to face with that permanent scowl. It's not cute. They need to train her on how to be professional. You now have to pay $15 to park on top of the $42 a night resort fee. Seriously? Just too many reasons to stay elsewhere which we absolutely will next time.

No bell man.  Waited 1 hour and 20 min to check in. No joke. That alone is enough to find a new hotel.  They offer online check in which doesn't work.  Smart offer an app that doesn't work.  Neve again for me.

All I can say is WOW! Mercy was amazing to my friend & I. We flew in super early & knew that we wouldn't be able to get our room at that time but Mercy was able to work her magic & got us a room earlier than planned!!! Thank you Mercy ! I will be staying here again!

This trip to MGM Grand was surprising at how much ended up going wrong throughout the stay. It started with the parking garage because it told us where the parking garage was and that it was $15 a day, but when we checked in the parking process was not told to us or that we would be billed on our room the $15 a day. So we ended up paying double for parking. The check-in process was easy and quick, but the first elevator would not let us exit on our floor and we tried as well as other patrons to get on our floor. We finally made it to our room and were able to get into the room easily. Where we started to unpack and walk around the room. I opened the mini-fridge and picked something up to look at it and read the can, which I put back, but later found out I was charged $40 plus a service charge. Since we spent 6 hours traveling we decided to rest in the room and order room service, which ended up having a service fee as well. That was fine, but was not told to us anywhere that we could find.The walls to this hotel were also very thin and we could hear everything that other people were doing in their rooms. And early every morning we were woken up by someone in the alley throwing trash away. For the cost of this hotel we would expect that the walls wouldn't have been so thin and being woken up by everything at all hours of the night. The next morning we woke up early to head to an exhibit and I started to notice that the blinds were duct taped, the tile by the shower was broken, and the mirror was melting on the inside, which I assume could be a fire hazard. We spent the rest of the day out of the room and came back to rest and sleep early because we had to head home on Sunday, October 27th. After we checked out, my account was charged an extra $114.20 on top of the deposit I put down a couple months ahead of time of $273 and then at check-in I was charged $586.51, when I was originally told through their website the estimated balance due on check-in would be $386.51. So I ended up being up charged more than I thought was going to happen. When I emailed them stating that about the bill the only response I got was an email with the attachment of the bill. There was nothing said about the upcharge or anything and if I would have known that they would end up charging more I wouldn't have gone through their website or even through this hotel. We plan on never staying at this hotel again and plan on telling our family and friends about our experience with this hotel that used to be a major power in Vegas and has now lost its charm.

Here for a conference and incredibly disappointed. The conference itself is great. However walking through the smoke filled casino to get anywhere is not. The front desk must refer to the 'manager' for all decisions. The gym that is advertised as 24/7 is not and the manager 'brie' told us to "complain about it if you don't like it. " Apparently customer service does not exist here. You get what you pay for.

First, I have to say I was here for 4 days and my company paid for the stay $900+ to walk into a room which reeks of someone's cologne, and to find someone's dirty socks/shirt on the ground right next to the bed I was beyond disgusted. The air quality on the 20th floor was awful compared to the 8th floor where many of my other co-workers stay, was drastically different. I could actually breathe on the 8th floor while the 20th floor had no air circulating. The light in the room was so dim. Also, the tall lamp in my room was broken and the bulb was hanging on by wires. The water never got hot while on other floors my coworkers said the water was uncomfortably scalding hot. The sink water smelled like sewage which that trend extended to the restrooms of the outside restrooms. Every piece of food provided by the hotel was awful even our customers complained about how bad the food was. The restrooms near the conference area were not attended to. There was no soap, toilet paper, seat covers, paper towels. The restroom garbage was overflowing and none of the attendants cared. I would not stay in the MGM again especially for a $900 room I would expect a quality experience.

Absolutely avoid the West Wing. I feel like the price listings here that mark the MGM as more reasonable than other strip-located hotels are here because of the West Wing rooms-- that may be so, but they are small pods with no real windows. The hotel caters to people who want to be "on the strip" in a famous-name hotel but aren't going to stay in their rooms. There are quirks that go along with a hotel that is clearly showing its age-- the phone system failed our first night, so a broken safe in our room couldn't be fixed. Fortunately the front desk was helpful enough to upgrade us to the Grand Tower, which is the only part of this hotel that conforms to the standards one would expect for the prices. Basically, my experience here is that it's yet another Vegas hotel on the strip that gives you little while charging a lot. Unless you're going to spend the money for the Waldorf Astoria or the Aria, I'd find a place off the strip which will be nicer for the same money. You can always take a cab to the strip.Vegas attracts extremely helpful and responsive staff, and the MGM Grand is no exception. But the problems in the hotel are out of their control. All they can do is make it a bit better.Another thing: if you like having your own food and drinks in the room fridge or enjoy waking up to the hotel room coffee, that's not an option here. You can't use the minibar fridge, and you must rent a fridge for $35/day from housekeeping if you need one. There is no in-room coffee maker. Not huge deals for me, but some people consider these things "must haves."
The room smells like smoke and I'm on the 25th floor. The whole hotel smells like smoke, and it's so crowded you can't even walk through. Yuck.
Room was clean. Paid for a room with a view of the strip but the view sucked with the signs they put on the side of the hotel. Couldn't see anything.

Took forever to check in. Finally made it to the pool which is like a 20 min walk. Took an hour to get someone to take my food order and I'm told I can't order without my passport! Wtf MGM!?!! I've been coming to LV for 30 years and this is a first. Go someplace else.

Customer service does not seem to be a priority here. I wasn't happy with my room so I tried to change and was given the runaround for two days before they finally accommodated.  The West Wing is as far as you can get from the pools and conference center and the rooms are smaller.

I wish I can go lower then one star but let me tell you mgm corporation is the most greedy blood sucking people on the strip! They actually forgot what brought people to Vegas it was the customer service free parking and free drinks... now they charge you for everything! And sad thing is they lay people off when they make billions sad!

Having been to Vegas 10-15 times, and visited the MGM on a few occasions (go see Ka!), this was my first stay at the MGM Grand Hotel. The MGM Grand is one of the more budget friendly hotels on/near the strip, and though I don't usually shop Vegas hotels based on price, I brought my parents on this trip for their first visit, and didn't want the price of a room to scare them to death. One thing I completely forgot when booking the MGM was the property's fairly renown pool complex. Affordable Vegas hotel + epic pool complex = very large numbers of young, and sometimes pretty obnoxious patrons (many of them female walking around the lobby in thong bikinis with see thru wraps). Now, you may be reading this thinking "WHAT?! JACKPOT!!" and I would've been right there with you about 12-15 years ago, but that just isn't my scene anymore. If it's yours, then this is certainly the place for you. As for me, my girlfriend was there and I'm not trying to get murdered in Vegas. Check-in is a bit of a nightmare if you don't have the app, which I didn't download until later. The other hotels seem to have figured it out a little better. I highly recommend downloading the app, checking in in advance, and picking your keys up at the side desk dedicated to online check ins. The room itself was nice. We got upgraded to the Grand Tower at check-in, which is where you really want to be. I didn't completely grasp the hotel layout when I booked, and initially booked us in the West Wing. The West Wing is quite a walk from the front desk and hotel entrance (read: taxi/Uber pick up and drop off) and the views aren't nearly as nice. The West Wing is, however, closer to the exits that will take you to New York, New York and the rest of the strip, so prioritize. The shower had a bit of identity confusion and couldn't decide if it wanted to be hot or cold, and would alternate between lukewarm and scalding without being adjusted. I will say the mattress was amazing, pretty firm, and I slept very well despite the partying happening next door (same previously mentioned clientele). Who tf parties in a hotel room in Vegas?! No coffee in the rooms and the minibar prices will have you selling your children into slavery ($15 for peanut M&Ms). With no shortage of restaurants and bars, I recommend Tap, especially if you're looking to catch a game. And yes, you will pay NFL stadium prices for food and drinks. Lobby Bar is also a great place to relax and end a long night before heading up to your room. The shop around the corner had $12 Padron cigars that you can take into Lobby Bar to enjoy with a nice glass of scotch or bourbon. I remarked just a few hours after check-in that this would be the first and last time I stay at the MGM Grand. Not in a particularly negative way, but in a "been there, done that" train of thought. I still feel the same way. If you're ok with paying a bit more, there are much better places to stay, but if you like some of the things I complained about above, the MGM Grand could very well be your Mecca. Cheers!
Rooms are nice but no coffee maker. The hotel/casino does not have great signage. Not impressed for the cost.
Not worth the price. Poor service. Very low quality food. Dinner $45pp. Should've just spent the extra and went to the buffet at Caesar's. Now they have an awesome buffet. This is just poor quality.
I cannot believe how the entire place has gone down hill. It's warm out, ghetto and for such a big name they really need to step up their game. Only reason to go there is for the shows.

We have been looking so forward to our first experience at MGM Grande and have been sooo disappointed.  The valet Gary, awesome, the reception room coordinator, William, simply wonderful and welcoming. We waited 4 hours to check into our room, wandered the beautiful hotel and casino area while we were waiting and spent happily $$$$ on gambling. NOT one cocktail server was available, for 3.5 hours so we left to go somewhere else, sadly.  Had to walk across the street to get a drink and continued playing roulette. 4 hours later we called to see if MGM had our rooms ready and they were. We did not receive the promised text. Got to the room, nominally nice, and called for our bags (from four hours ago). Was on hold to be connected to bell hop for 25 minutes and  was told another 25 for our bags to be delivered. Unbelievable. We are beyond disappointed. Please spend your hard earned money somewhere else. This place does not care about the customer and you will be sorely disappointed.

HORRIBLE! A very young girl asked for help to her room, of course she could not recall her room number or floor. My group (all females) ask a pit boss, who then asked a security guard who directed this young girl to the front desk. Remember she could not recall her room number, then the front desk horrible service!!! Rude! Pointed the way, she still asked for help. FINALLY we were able to get a female security guard to escort her to her room. Some serious customer service and sensitivity training is needed. This is how you prevent abduction or rape. We asked for help 3x and we were sober. I would never recommend my family or friends to stay here.

Booked a room at the MGM Grand for a birthday weekend. The hotel room was so disappointing. Stayed in the west wing which is like a hole in the wall. The room was like a closet, no separation from the bathroom to the bedroom, so hardly any privacy. Thin walls, can hear the next room when they showered or used the toilet. The room was old and falling apart. The carpets are dirty the bathroom shower is cracked. I could have paid less and stayed at a much better hotel. The room didn't even come with a fridge or water bottles. I had to call just to get items I would get standard at hotels.

MGM must stand for Most Greedy MFs.  I booked one of the Stay Well suites for my mother and I when we went to visit her critically ill brother in a hospital in Vegas.  I wanted to try and show her a good time and distract her a bit when not at the hospital since she had never been to LV before.  I cannot tell you how big of a mistake it was selecting MGM for our stay.  Frustrations started as soon as we checked in.  I asked for a wheelchair to take my mother, who's 81, up to our room.  People act like they never heard of such a thing.  I was directed to the bell desk for the request and then he showed me a kiosk to rent a scooter for our stay.  I told him I just to get her to the room, no scooter required for our stay since we planned to be a the hospital most of the time.  Then he went over to security to request an escort to the room with a wheelchair.  Okay, whatever!  We waited and waited and waited at least 30 minutes until security finally came over.  He then proceeded to tell my 81 year old mother the elevator wasn't that far and started to walk her towards the elevator.  I shouted where is the wheelchair and then he shot around the information desk and came back with one.  Incredible.Once we got in our room, there was no microwave, no small frig, no coffee maker...nothing was included for your convenience. So, I looked for a pamphlet that list places in the area to eat, like any normal hotel would have, nope...nothing.  We were so tired and hungry we decided to take a look at the in-room dining menu.  However, the prices were so ridiculous we refused to pay.  Ended up walking to Denny's for dinner to get us something to eat.  And that was just the first day there!I did get my mother to venture down into the casino for a little fun with the slot machines.  Nope, no fun there!  All that did was suck up a quick $80 bucks and she was done after that.  I came back to the casino a few times and never heard anyone getting a pay out.  They should at least let the customers have a little fun while they are there!  I had to fight at check out as well.  My mother was looking at all the items at the mini bar in the room and turned around as she pulled a little bottle out the rack and asked if everything was included with the room.  I quickly told her no and she sat the item back down.  At check out I was questioned if we drank the peach schnapps.  I told him no, that my mother was snooping around but put it back. He lectured how it is clearly posted and it was charged to the room.  I reiterated that we did not drink it and my mother didn't realize that after paying for the room we still would have to pay more for food/drink items in the room. He finally removed from the bill.  Then he was going to charge us for using the complimentary $30 food coupon for eating at the Grand Buffet the departure day, which apparently is not allowed.  I told him we didn't use it the day of arrival so we should be square.I try not to use the word never but I can safely say I will never, ever, ever stay at the MGM again!

If I could give this 0 I would. First off our room is not what was shown in the reservation photo. You open the door and the toilet is right there and it looks like a little trailer park bathroom. The window is the size of a poster board. Our room wasn't ready when checking in and the lady gave us free drinks for waiting at the pool bar. No one had any idea of what we were talking about. Two hours go by and I keep calling and they hang up or keep transferring me. I had to go to the bell hop desk to get information regarding my room.

Was at MGM Las Vegas 3rd week of September. Excellent experience checked in at 11am and room was already ready. It was a executive queen suite very spacious. Would highly recommend this property. The only few down sides is that one of the lounges/bars Whiskey down is billed as 24hrs but it closed every night around 3am when we were there so why does it say 24hrs. Other than that it was great. Drinks at pool were kinda expensive the wife got a slushy type alcoholic drink and  it was $25 a little high never got another one. Be careful of minibar in the room someone before us unplugged the power strip to the tv and minibar and apparently took things out of it. When I plugged it back in we were automatically charged for the missing items even though we touched nothing. Had to go to front desk to dispute they tried to say we took the items after 15 to 20 minutes of arguing they finally took it off but I don't appreciate being told I took something when I didn't. Besides isn't there some kind of system to tell you if it's offline because two days later someone tried to come in and restock the missing items saying we took them I said that was two days ago check with your management. Other than that it was a great stay.

This hotel is huge, and the concept venues nearby (TopGolf, The District) can be excellent, there is something dated about the MGM Grand.  The core things like value for the money, service level and amenities this place rates more like a 3 not a 4 or 5.If you are coming for excellent and pricey restaurants (The District), or the location nearby the Airport and this is a big Convention Hotel you may wind up completely satisfied. I was satisfied but not wow'd. Rooms for one and that's most of why I give it 3 stars are a bit dated, no coffee, no nothing in these rooms, except more expensive stuff. The carpets look pretty old and in essence this place needs some upgrading. This hotel is 25 years old. The pool area on the other hand is very nice and offers lots of choices to sunbathe and play and the water in these pools was exceptional. I did try the Avenue Cafe, which was very basic and pricey, as well as some poolside fare, that was not at all tasty, or even made to order, And of course poolside lunch cost $45 with tax and tip. That hurts.I would basically only come here for a Convention or one of the top flight restaurants that are located in this complex. I do hope you enjoy it. It is very convenient as the Monorail comes directly into the District within the Hotel. There is enough food choices here to serve every palate, for sure. Avoid the food services of the hotel itself,  they are basic and not par excellence.Hakkasan, was the highlight of my October 2019 work trip. Oh to splurge with service fit for kings. Hakkasan could be the real special corner of the MGM that only a King can afford, after all the wine list goes to $6,000. That's over $1,000 per glass of wine. WOW!

If I could give this less than 1 star I would. This is such a horrible experience. The hotel staff is very unfriendly and really don't care about their customers or what we had to say. Hotel room was dirty, mirrors in the bathroom were dirty full of water and white mark stains, sink was dirty, floors in the room were dirty, toilet in the room did not work if you flush the toilet it doesn't stop flushing and continues on with that noise for a very long time until you go and start screwing with the handle yourself to make it stop. Just looking at that dirty room I couldn't stop itching thinking if there could be bed bugs here. Hotel looks real nice in the pictures but in reality it's so trashy and filthy with tiny room and even beds are extremely uncomfortable to sleep in. You would think you're staying in Motel 6 or something equivalent to that. Horrible hotel and horrible staff, stay away. I would not recommend this hotel and definitely would not return.

This is our favorite place to stay every time we come to Vegas.  Everyone is always so nice and helpful with anything you need. Always get a cabana if you go to the pool. Adults only pool is our favorite.  And stay in a Sky Loft if you get the opportunity!

The only reason I rated the hotel 3 stars vs. 1 is because of the casino and other entertainment. The rooms are nowhere near worth the price paid for them.It was my birthday and I booked a trip to Vegas on my own for my first experience! Two nights that cost over $350 so I expected a nice room. Wrong.I have stayed in motels that were nicer. The hallway leading to my room looked like something out of The Shinning. My room was 516 and the first room on my hall was 400! I just knew I would die on my way, but I was so excited. The room numbers change at around 450 and then started at 500. Still a looooong hallway. You walk in on a old sink and mirror with a bathroom to the right. Tight space and not well lighted.The room looked very old but appears clean and there wasn't a smell. The TV has maybe 10 English channels and most are news. Sorry folks no cable but there are pay per view options.I stayed two nights so they came in to clean my second morning and forgot to leave an amenity. I get it. Big hotel. The housekeeping crew were still visible down the never ending hallway so I asked for a lotion and she was so friendly and accommodating.  For that I can say the staff is friendly. This hotel needs a renovation or to drop their rates until the quality improves.

The only way I can describe my experience is garbage. I stayed at the MGM for a single weekday while on a quick business trip. I'm pretty sure they put me in a not-yet-remodeled room (West Tower, 5th floor, 500 room block) because after walking through plush and colorful carpets I ended up on a gray small corridor with gray carpet and the smell of decay. The room opened into a bathroom sink. Right there. The living room lights were controlled by a single switch that sometimes turned on the light to full, sometimes turned on the lights on dim, sometimes didn't turn them on at all. No rhyme or reason to it. The worst part was when I woke up to the smell of sewage. I'm not sure if it was old pipes or thin walls near a neighbor's bathroom, but the room quickly became unbearable. Like I said, garbage.

My first time staying at the MGM. The staff were very helpful and courteous, rooms were clean and spacious!It is the largest casino I have ever seen with pretty much everything and anything you need. We ate in one Mexican restaurant which was very good, unfortunate they charge for chips and salsa though. But overall a good visit and I will return there. I liked that end of the strip, more outside places and places to shop easily.

Our stay was short and great, but what made our experience the absolute best was VINCE at the valet parking. He went above and beyond to correct a misunderstanding and we had not experienced customer serviceable that anywhere else in Las Vegas. Thank you for your kindness Vince! All star employee

Only giving this crappy hotel one star because I have to. Went to a concert at the mgm garden arena. Venue is typical arena. Process to get in and out afterwards sucked. Honestly a scary and dangerous hazard with only ONE exit out. So many people and very unorganized after concert. Getting out was like a herd of cows. Mayhem. But my point is that after the concert when everyone is leaving and wants to get a bite or a drink EVERY RESTAURANT in the MGM hotel was closed. You had to walk for miles trying to find anything that was open and ONLY one restaurant was with a line a mile long because people were hungry after concert. The employees in the restaurants that worked the hostess stands were assholes. Very rude and nasty. Made smartass remarks to us when we asked if they were open. We were treated so poorly. The Uber area was a joke after the concert. Complete mayhem and since nothing was open in the hotel it made the Uber area overflowing with people and cars and everything was a complete unorganized mess. More rude security there as well. Will never go back to even stay at that horrible hotel.

I booked a one bedroom suite and was very disappointed. The blinds did not work and room said it couldn't be fixed. Next, we requested a specific number of blankets and sheets for the fold out bed and got something less. Finally, we didn't get late checkout as Pearl members.And the hotel rooms have an old tired look to them. I thought there was value in booking this hotel but you get what you pay for.

Nice hotel and casino. Horrible customer service!! Last time staying at mgm hotels. Had to sit outside in the heat with my 2 kids for 2 hours while they were cleaning a room. (I know I could wait inside, but way to crowded. And can't walk around with our kids and luggage). Check in is at 3, we got there around 4 and waited 2 hours for a room I paid for 4 weeks in advance. I called and went up to desk but nobody can give a straight answer, just dumb looks. Then they charge a deposit for every night you stay there? doesn't make sense. First for me in Vegas. (Example. if I broke a lamp the first night that's 100$, but I stay in that room 2 more nights that is now a $300 lamp?) mgm overall wasn't as good as I thought it would be, much better time at Luxor

For such an expensive hotel you would think this would be a nice stay. We arrived and had a king bed in west wing. Go say the least, rooms in west wing are outdated, small, & not worth 250+ a night. We called and said our room was horrible & upgraded our room.The first thing the employee darla said was "you have to pay extra". Not "I'm so sorry you were unsatisfied with your room". We went to our previous room to go get out stuff and our key didn't work.We went to the front desk and they GAVE AWAY OUR ROOM WITH OUR STUFF IN IT. Luckily the people that were assigned our room were good people and didn't steal anything. The room we upgraded to in the tower is nicer but still not $250 a night nice. They didn't do anything complementary with this whole issue so they didn't really do anything to make it right. West wing area they difference is huge. Plastic cups and a open bathroom no privacy at all. Horrible lighting and there is literally enough space to just fit the bed. The tower area is a bit nicer glass cups, bathroom with a door,better lighting. The beds are so uncomfortable and the pillows are very hard, sheets are rough and cheap.To say the least this hotel is not worth the money and I will never stay here again and don't encourage anyone too.

I have been here for 24 hours and have done NOTHING but wait in lines and get sent on one wild goose chase after another.  There is a 45 minute line for EVERYTHING, from checking a coat to Starbucks and the Fitness Center.  People were screaming at each other in a 100-foot-long Starbucks line this morning.  Forget your key card?  30 minutes gone while you wait in the "short line".On top of all of it, not one employee knows anything.  After asking six employees that never heard of a fitness center, I was literally sent to ANOTHER hotel by mindless employee number seven, and then promptly kicked of it.  I will NEVER come here again.

Oh boy what an experience here. Went here with my friend for her birthday and it was a sh**show. First thing- who the hell designed this place? Uncomfortable patterns used side by side. Everything makes you uncomfortable to look at. Can't say ugly. Just severely disturbing? (As if that is better). Who places byzantine next to mondriant next to wood and marble?Everything is expensive but thats a given except we were charged a resort fee even though we checked in around 1am the morning of the following day but guess that doesn't matter because we are using the Pool/wifi/gym in spirit just not physically on the day. Also, no free fridge because f*k you from mgm grand. Gym is tiny (honestly didn't mind) but why have a message saying how many bottles of water you are saving when next to the dispenser you are providing plastic cups?? hypocrisy at its best. I'm just reaching before the good part.My friend and I both experienced skin issues - rashes for her, eye stuff from me. She asked the hotel if the pillows were down/feathers or not and they said no. Guess what? They were indeed feathers as she found out the day before we left when the feather end poked out of the pillow. Cool so they don't even know their own hotel. We wanted to change the room after the first night but was told that all the rooms are the same?? Everything smelled like cigarettes (probably recycled nasty air from the casino area) or bleach. As in all the towels (I had a lovely stained towel btw) sheets, silverware etc smelled like bleach. The water is gross but thats a vegas thing not a MGM thing so cool - one thing that isn't their fault. Now I would have made this two stars. Because the pool is chill and I LOVED their spa. And honestly, every server/waitress/bartender in the place was so nice and had such nice energy. Coming from ny you never see happy servers like this cracking jokes. BUT when my friend complained to her booking service about the experience at the hotel the booking service stated that the hotel told them they had no record of the calls (there was at least 3) and that my friend had refused an upgrade. LOL WHO WOULD REFUSE AN UPGRADE? So now we know the management at MGM Grand are also grand liars. There are plenty of other hotels you can spend an exorbitant amount of money on and regret later who may not gaslight you and lie so I suggest booking your vegas nights elsewhere. But seriously? Who designed this place? They need to go to jail for their crimes against aesthetic.

I was here for my birthday weekend and had a HORRIBLE time! The first night we were there we had just arrived and went to bed. The next morning when we woke up I had a rash on my face and hives on my body. My friend opposite of me had pink eye. We called the hotel (Front Desk) to tell them and they said they would change the sheets. If it persisted then they asked for us to call back. I still had hives and a rash on my face. Called the front desk again for a room change and they said they would call me back. They never did!!! The room was HORRIBLE! The hotel AC unit was blowing out a cigarette smell into the room. I spoke to Expedia after my trip and told them of the situation. They spoke to the hotel and said they have NOTHING on record in regards to me complaining of what had happened to us (hives, rash and pink eye). They told the Expedia representative that I refused the room change when they said they would change the room. It makes no sense of how we would turn down a room change when all of this was happening to us. I am very dissatisfied with my trip and do not recommend staying at this hotel.

This past weekend was my 2nd time staying at the MGM. Some of the things that I like about the hotel are that the rooms are comfy, beds are okay (on the harder side), was the pool and lazy river are super fun, the casino is great, and Morimotos is in the hotel! However, there are a lot of hidden fees upon checkout. I was surprised at the extra $90 I had to pay after staying only one night. I paid an extra $30 for late checkout, but while I was laying in bed I had house keeping knock on my door two different times trying to come in and clean the room. Also, when we got there at 8am and checked in we were told that they would text us when the room was ready. They never did. We found it it was ready when the bartender at the pool tried to charge our bill to our room (using only our last name) and the receipt came back with a room number on it... I wonder how long it was ready before we found out. I would come back to this hotel if I was sharing a room with a group of friends, because it is definitely one of the more affordable hotels. However, I wouldn't recommend staying here as a couple or if you are looking for something a little nicer.

For the price this hotel and room on the 4th floor was below average in terms of amenities. Not to mention the conspicuous lack of a coffee pot in the room, forcing one to be squeezed yet again by Vegas. The main floor is too smoky, and the music at the pool tasteless and too loud,  designed for brains on booze I guess. And...1. Filthy carpet. 2. Small pieces of trash in the closet. 3. Paint chipped on the drawers.

Want to be treated like a criminal for wanting a refund in response to a subpar experience? Then check out the MGM Grand and its pool! After arriving to enjoy a daybed, my party and I found the daybed next to us to be packed. A daybed of four was seated at least 10 people. Four of them were children under 10. One of them was a toddler that had a chorus of screams and hollers he wanted everyone to hear.A member of my party spoke to our host (Gary... or Garry?) to see if we could be moved. Understandably so, the place was booked. Except... we could see empty beds. And, according to policy, any guest that doesn't arrive by 11 AM forfeits their reservation. It was well after 11. So, we took it in stride, enjoyed the pool as much as we could, and noticed not long after that our devoted host was very attentive - to the bed next to us. I had to track him down two times to order drinks and to check out for the day. He checked on us once, but was by the bed next to us quite often, chatting and hobnobbing. Keep in mind, I had already paid his gratuity.Fast forward to a few days later (my wife and I wanted to wait for a guest to leave before we started "causing trouble"). I call the pool, speak to Sophia, and inquire about receiving a refund. We have a pleasant conversation, which ends with her saying she'll see what she can do. I missed her callback, but she went and called my wife (who's name wasn't on the reservation) to say they'll refund the tax and gratuity. When my wife explained further that the issue was more than just the host, things took an antagonistic turn.Sophia became rude, taunted my wife by saying that's all they're going to do, all refunds go through her, and there's no way we'll get anything else. When things grew a little more heated, my wife requested to speak to Sophia's manager. Sophia denied, saying he doesn't handle these matters (please, remember this for later). There was no resolution between my wife and Sophia. So, after hearing how the call was handled, I called back and immediately told Sophia I would need to speak to her manager. Magically, he was available to handle our matter.Except, his attitude wasn't quite in check. The moment he (Tim Mushi) answered the phone, he was belligerent. He had the same snotty attitude Sophia apparently had with my wife. It must be part of MGM management training. When I tried to get a point in, he became louder, pointing out that my wife was rude and threatened MGM Pool staff (by saying someone should be fired, which never happened). I had to get louder, at which point things dissolved. When I pressed to talk about the issues that happened at the pool, Tim was more concerned with the phone call that never should have happened and likely didn't happen the way he was told. So, because I didn't let him continue with his nonsense, he hung up.Fast forward 10 days, we get in contact with an MGM Customer Experience rep who sends an email stating they would be happy to find a different resort that's a better fit for us. Essentially, we're being told to not come back to the MGM Grand. So, I made a phone call and found that Tim had wiped his hands clean of the matter, is offering no refund (despite the original promise of a return on the gratuity and tax), and refuses to speak to us further. I pressed with the rep (who was quite pleasant) that we want the refund. At this point, it's the principle of how we were treated. It eventually comes down to us being able to get the refund, BUT we would be banned from ALL MGM properties. Over $30. Neither my wife nor I ever threatened a member of MGM staff. We never screamed. We never cursed. We simply demanded what was rightly owed to us. A fix for a miserable experience. Instead, we were given an ultimatum. ... of course, I took it.
