Who would want to give money to a company that puts such individuals in management positions anyway? And that's how I was added to MGM's nonsensical black book.
Motel six. Trash. I feel ripped off. I paid $1800 for 2 people. Not happy. Dirty shower, dirty carpet, no window, banged up furniture.
Watch out for the inexpensive rooms!  We ended up at the end of super long hallway on the first floor in a room that felt like it was underground.

MGM hotel bar across the way from Mlife rewards center, playing $100 at video poker machine. Bartender, older man said did I want something, I replied a Corona please. Because I was gambling at the bar the beer was complementary. Asked if they can change the TV to a different football game annoyed at my request, but did change the channel. After a bit ask for another beer. Bartender a very rude tone said, You're not playing fast enough you're watching TV looking at your phone, start playing more or you can buy your own beer at $10 each. Really what does a beer cost the MGM about a $1, if that much, cashed out. There was about $45 left from my original $100 buy in. Bartender either he hates his job and is tired of dealing with people or was mad because I asked to change the TV channel or doesn't like Latin people. Maybe it's all the above

Great stay and really loved the stay well rooms. I definitely felt better on this trip and the vitamin C shower was very good on my skin not drying it out. Service and speedy mobile check in was great also.

Ratty rooms, Walmart with slots but nice people work there.  NEVER take the stairs in the hotel. You might get mugged and you can't get back in with your key. Worst low rent hotel I have ever been in.  This defines a "shithole". How can you have low rent smokers in the high stakes bar. Do they have any class?

Being someone who cares about their lungs and health, going to your room after being in a casino where people are blowing their cigarettes in your face when you are trying to gamble, you expect to finally be able to breathe a little fresh smoke free air. Well the vents must be connected because our room reeks of cigarette smoke. I woke up with the worst sore throat due to the smoke. Came here to celebrate my husband and I 5th year wedding anniversary and I can't even fully enjoy it because of this horrific sore throat. We called downstairs and they said they would send security to spray our room which he didn't even show up. 1) I paid for a smoke free room. Don't advertise smoke free rooms if your vents are connected to rooms where people smoke. 2) figure out a way to control this issue. I get the fact that it's vegas but after breathing in nothing but cancer causing chemicals all freakin day, you just want to get back to your room and rest your lungs. Can't wait to leave. My lungs and throat need a break. I can't even imagine bringing my kids here. Find another hotel that respects the health of guest.

The reason I gave this hotel 5 stars was mainly because of the staff. My room was nice as well, but the staff outdid themselves with the customer service. I got turned around quite a bit (that hotel is a maze!) But regardless of where the employee worked, or whether they even knew how to get where I was trying to go, they helped me, or found someone that could. I really appreciated the above and beyond efforts of the staff. Everything you need for your trip is right there at that hotel. However, the hotel's proximity to the rest of Las Vegas' attractions is superb. I definitely will be visiting again!

Love the lazy river!  Hated the bed in staywell section.  Apparently premium bedding means hard as a rock!  The bed caused loss of sleep and aggravated pain.  Bring your own snacks/water otherwise you are paying very high crazy prices.  No coffee pots in rooms as they have 2 Starbucks on premises.  Took us 2 nights to realize they have a blackout blind behind the front blind.   The spa is a very nice area to relax/unwind/rejuvenate and the day passes are affordable (discounted if your staywell).  Also staywell has its own check-in/out area over to right of lobby desk just go thru doors (they also provide free fruit and water).  We will be staying here again but we'll be much more prepared next time.  The MGM grounds are well cared for.  The staff all polite and respectful.

Im gonna make this short cause i have things to do. YOU DONT WANT TO GAMBLE HERE!Im a las vegas local and i have nothing against mgm and their outdated brand. Im just writing this review to save some of you slot players. If you notice on youtube, NONE of the slot channels play at MGM properties. Theres alot of money in this business. I have been up and down the strip and ive played at most casinos. NONE take your money faster. NONE!Its actually disgusting how bad the slots are in mgm. Its basically legal robbery. Their properties are falling apart and cant keep up with the cosmos and wynns. They are so corrupt, they bring in crazy money and still cant afford a legit entrance to their casino from the strip.Play with caution. Go to PH or Cosmo or a station casino or even downtown if you want actually enjoy your slot play.Now that im done bitching, the pool area is nice and deserves a star. As far as pool parties, go to encore or marquee. Thank me later!
The worst place and bad customer service Charge too much money for the rooms and it's really small rooms check your room first before you purchase it you can't even take a shit man

We flew into Albuquerque and made our way to Vegas for my sister's wedding. The customer service here was by far the worst we experienced on our entire trip. I felt like booking, fees, and what was included or not included was not clear, which is what bothered me the most. For as much as we paid for this room, it wasn't worth it. I would not recommend the MGM to friends, and I won't be staying here in the future.
Worst most disgusting hotel I've ever stayed at. Too many disappointing and frustrating events to even write. Spend the extra money and stay at Bellagio, Cosmopolitan or Wynn.

Stayed here during our time in Vegas. Overall a good experience! We got the incidental fee waived (from 300$ to 197$) and when asked they did let us upgrade our room for an extra 20$ a night.Our room was good, clean, cozy and the housekeeping people even  arranged our personal toiletries nicely and in order on a tray which was a nice touch. We used the concierge service to buy Ka tickets and that went smoothly.Gambling was a bust but luck is luck. The pool was great, not overwhelmingly busy. Would stay again if needed but for what we're looking for in Vegas, we would stay on the north part of the strip. Not the fault of the hotel though!
Nice and clean, second visit here. So far I have good experience at the MGM hotel. They have good stuff and the reception took care of our issue

This hotel is clean, pretty and has a lot of nice features.  However, in all my travels in the US and abroad I've never had a hotel make me feel like they were milking me for every penny they can.  They replaced a mini-fridge and coffee pot with  a minibar.  Forcing guests to waste left overs and explore options to purchase a morning cup of coffee.  The eliminate seating in the lobby forcing guests to have to sit in front of a slot machine to rest or wait for someone.  When I asked to speak to a manager about an issue I was told he was busy and would call the next day. Never did call.  Then when they sent me a survey, it timed me out and wouldn't let me back in.  I don't normally complain. I know hotels and resorts are profit driven - but it's the first time I became glaringly aware of it.  It did not make me feel like a guest, just a dollar sign.

Our "windowless" budget hotel room had a window so that's a huge plus. However they didn't change the garbage from the previous guests and didn't make the bed up after we took off the do not disturb sign at 2pm.
So far a terrible experience.  No water in my room. They offered me resort fee credit and that's it.

Asked the front desk lady if there's a complimentary upgrade available and tipped her $20. She said she has a suite available that is $75 more in value and I accepted it. Turns out it wasn't complimentary and she charged us for the upgrade and made it seem like the price was still the same as what we paid online. The front desk lady took my $20 tip without making it clear to us that it was not complimentary.When we found out that we were charged for the upgrade, we brought our concerns to the front desk while checking out. Manager Benjamin came, and was honestly useless af. Kept disregarding what we were telling him and wouldn't bother to help us out. He wouldn't do anything for us and basically telling us to fk off. Will I be staying here again? Fk no. Probably would recommend my friends to stay away from this hotel.  Just remember, Benjamin won't do shit for you.

MGM is very special to us - we got married here and had our reception in the West Wing Bar in 2010. We try to stay here every time we are in Vegas, which is at least a couple of times a year. If not here, we stay at their other properties. This most recent visit in Sept 2019 was top notch. We were able to stay in one of their spa suites for a terrific rate, and everything was so comfy and clean and perfect. We did all of our dining on the property, except one meal over at Eataly in Park MGM. Everything was outstanding. What impresses me most about MGM is that the entire massive property is spotlessly clean at all times, and the air exchange on the casino floor is so good that you don't come home smelling like cigarette smoke. The service from the staff at every level is beyond compare. The prices for the rooms is unmatched for the quality.

Not impressed with this hotel.  We are staying in a "sleep well" room/floor and the housekeeping staff is so noisy!  The room is also nothing great.   I would rather stay in a Residence Inn. Only reason we are staying here is because we're here for a concert.  I won't be staying here again.

They don't care about loosing a customer, customers beware that they change their Hotels's name and if you forget to cash in your chips they won't honor their chips with the excuse of that's not our name anymore, we changed it to MGM Park!  Thieves!!

I like to stay in mgm grand for their poker rooms and their lazy river. I like to just relax in their river tube on a tube. Their poker room is always full with friendly dealers. The room is on the smaller side but looks very modern. I took a star down because the hot water in the shower is hit or miss. Sometimes it took forever to warm up and this was an issue the last time I stayed as well. The hotel is huge and is located in a convenient place on the strip.

I always stay at the MGM when in Vegas. Last month had to go on business and my company put me up at the Palms (no choice). I drove to the MGM for dinner and to gamble. Pulled up to Valet and went in. When it was time to leave, I gave my claim check to the valet attendant and she said " that will be $16.00. I said "what"?  They charged me $16 bucks to park. I will eat at the Palms next time and save the parking fee. In fact, it will be a cold day in hell before I go back to the MGM. I'm sick of their crap with all of the new "resort fees, parking fees and now drink service charge fees". On top of all that, the whole feel of the Grand is different. They took out the lions, the rainforest cafe, took out one Starbucks, it just felt cheesey in there. Quite honestly I get everything comped when I stay there but really thinking twice now before I book the Grand again. VIVA LAS VEGAS!

I was 20-minutes late for the JABBAWOCKEEZ Show, which was like 1-1/2 hours long. I recommend the show, because there's audience interactions. They were great... I was impressed with the dancing and storylines. MGM Grand Hotel has too much going on... Eating, drinking, clothes, souvenirs, massage chairs, spas, games of all sorts, CSI Museum and a few more noteworthy shows on the premises too. Also, MGM Grand Hotel has a monorail entrance on-site.I played a little on the cheap slot machines, just because this Vegas... And they're not cent, 5-cent, ten-cents a play neither, but its cheaper than Pac-Mac for minimum a dollar play... Pffft. What?!!!MGM offers Free Learn How To Play Poker Classes at 10:30am, (everyday, maybe). I do not know where or which location. So if you're interested, call their concierge desk.Drake played in the background. Real loud. MGM aright.

I stayed at the MGM Grand from 9/3-9/6 2019I would have rated lower but the casino and restaurants were excellent. The service on the other hand was not excellent. My room was cleaned only upon arrival. Did not receive any housekeeping for the duration. I called numerous times for service to no avail. I kept getting the runaround and false promises of my room being cleaned ASAP. I went as far as trying to get a manager involved but the front desk assured me I would have service. Again no service. My wife had to ask a room clerk servicing another room for towels. Very disappointing as we did like staying here and I pay for a resort fee and for what. I thank you for the great casino and restaurants but that's about all. I would like to speak with someone in corporate in regards to me paying for service I never received. My name is Tom and I stayed in room 6-542.Thank you

Reported bed bug to front desk on our departure morning. Waited 35 minutes and no response. Complained in person at front desk. More than 30 hours later, still no response from hotel staff on the cleaning all of our clothes required. Don't stay at MGM

Wow, I believe this will be the last trip to Vegas, it's not Las Vegas anymore!  Had a four hour layover decided to hit the MGM grand to get a few free drinks and play the slots.  Went to the first bar to order a drink and play their card game there at the bar.  Sorry the beer was nine dollars no free drinks at this bar as you play you get drink tickets.  Lost over 35 bucks no drink ticket.  Went to a second bar, after I put in a $20 bill and played it, then I got a free drink.  Went to the ATM to withdraw some money, there is a nine dollar fee to withdraw any money!  . I played on the floor for an hour and a half and 15 minutes before I had to leave a cocktail waitress finally walked by.  How I long for the good old days.  Too many skyscrapers when you walk out, you can't really tell where you're at.  Just to commercialized. I think it's time to go check out Laughlin again.

Absolutely horrible. Their computer Systems crashed twice in a three day. Internet is slow in the West Wing. The infamous West Wing is a dump!  it's a retrofitted old hotel that has outdated mechanical units that hum and hiss.  Couldn't get any sleep in The three days that I stayed here. Management promised to provide me a room change but that never happened. This place is a pure pig with lipstick put on it.

It pains me to even offer up one star for this "hotel." If i didn't have a home I'd probably opt to sleep under any given bridge under an expressway. Upon check in our first room had a lamp that didn't work, which in an already poorly lit room made it difficult to see more than 2 feet in front of you, which would have resulted in my makeup coming out like a five year old's art project. We were quickly and seamlessly moved, which is where the customer service ended. When we moved rooms we were delighted to find all the lights worked now allowing a whopping 5 feet of visibility. From there, the experience was downhill. The room smelled. It wasn't vacuumed. The walls were as this as I aspire to be. Which resulted in us being woken up to the screaming and blaring music of the neighbors every morning. It wasn't all bad though because the noise forced us to get up and take in an unparalleled view of the cracked roof and what I suspect to be a maid's cart who threw it along with herself off the roof when she could no longer take the filth of the hotel. The room offered no amenities like most Vegas hotels do. No robes, slippers, shower caps, body wash or the like. The shower had drill holes in the walls. The room did offer a stocked fridge that left no room for anything guests may need to place in there such as medicine. One of the members in my group had diabetes, so we called and asked for a fridge for her insulin. We were told we could absolutely had one for a measly $35/night. When told we could provide proof of the medical condition we were still told it would be $35 a night. When asked if we could remove the items from the fridge in the room we were told we could and would be charged for all fhe items. We were additionally instructed it wasn't a temperature controlled fridge fit for storing medication. When we asked to speak to a manager about this we were told the manager "was in bed sleeping." The blatant disregard for human life by the staff we interacted with was more disgusting than the hotel itself. The room service prices will cost you the same as attending one of the 5 star restaurants in Vegas and will be served in plastic containers and a brown bag as the hotel no longer brings anything in on plates or a table, which makes me feel better that in addition to the disregard for human life they equally disregard the waste of plastic and effects on the environment and ocean. In sum I probably wouldn't even be so inhumane to recommend this hotel to an ex or an enemy.

MGM Grand has been the place my husband and I have opted to stay at during the summer mainly because of the lazy river and Wet Republic. But over the last 3 consecutive times we have stayed here in a period of one year, we grow that much more frustrated with our experience here. During my most recent stay over the Labor Day weekend, we decided that this was our last time staying at the MGM. We checked on Friday (8/30) at around 7:30pm. We had reserved a king room and was told that the only available king rooms they had were on the 12th floor. When we got to our room, both rooms on each side were blasting music so loud that the walls felt like they were vibrating. Sure, this is Vegas and people want to party so I have no problems playing your music while you chill and get ready. But, call me old or whatever, I also want to get some sleep while I'm here! So I didn't want to risk not getting sleep, I called the front desk and asked for a room change. They were able to change my room to the 11th floor, and we actually ended up getting an even worse room!! Not only was the room SERIOUSLY showing it's age, but the strong smell of chemicals trying to cover up, what I believe used to be a smoking room, was too much. My sinuses started to hurt after being in there for 3 minutes. I immediately called the front desk AGAIN asking for another room change. At first they kept telling me that there were no other rooms, and that they would bring up some machine to get rid of the odor. But I'm pretty sure that wouldn't have helped the situation. After about 5 minutes, they finally moved us to a queen room on the 23rd floor. This room was better and we no longer cared that it wasn't a king room. We just wanted to start our night.I wish I could say that things got better, but they didn't. College kids screaming and yelling in the hallway at 4am, AC didn't really keep the room cool, and our clothes and sandals got stolen at the lazy river.My husband and I decided that it's not worth it to try and save some money, and will begin staying at either Aria, Cosmopolitan, or the Mirage where our experiences have been great each and every time we stay.Super disappointed with the MGM Grand. As a platinum mlife card holder, I'm not expecting royal treatment, just better than what I received during my 3 nights here.

First I wanna start off by saying I paid over $800 for a room that's worth no more than $100 on the worst side of the hotel. I specifically booked to have a tub a king bed & a view in my room. Instead I get a stand up shower & two full beds. On top of that, I got house keeping waking me up at 6AM , we were just getting in for some sleep! Then as we try to leave , they couldn't give us my car because of a lost ticket I never got! I had been using valet for the three days I stayed and no problem, I wanted to leave ASAP! It was a horrible experience. We wanted a nice room to celebrate an anniversary n all we got was issues from the moment we got there. We wanted a weekend to relax n just got stress. We were lied to when it came to what we were getting. The lady at reception who was checking us in said oh you know what I'll go ahead and upgrade you don't worry. The other rooms are more outdated, we'll get you a better room. She saw my girlfriend n I n I guess assumed we were friends or something and just gave us too beds. Unnecessary. The parking was also so rude. We came in the last night we brought our car through valet. The guy didn't give us a ticket. He just said oh you came here before so it's fine n he took our car n we didn't get any ticket. Next day we tried to get our car because we were checking out and we went through so much trying to get our car. It took about an hour to an hour and a half for us to finally get our car n be able to get on the road. This was a horrible experience n we should not have been treated that way. You would think this hotel would have had better customer service. It was pretty unfortunate that we spent our anniversary n vacation like this.

The best part of this hotel so far is the room. The service at all of the casino bars is slow and the employees would rather chit chat with each other then help customers. It's pretty shocking. This is my first stay here and I plan to avoid spending any real time or money here. There are too many other options in Vegas.

You finally have the time to go on vacation...  Just to find out how neglected are the MGM rooms in Las Vegas.I made sure to take photos so you guys could see how neglect this hotel is... Yep! This is mold at the MGM hotel in Las Vegas.Yep, the sewer water comes up.... Yep! The entire suit smells like sever mold... Yep, Claudia said we are welcome to post those photos on Yelp...This is the first and last time we are staying in this hotel... Claudia the MGM representative is not bothered by it... and actually encouraged me to post the photos....

I was played at blackjack table with EunKyung who is a beautiful dealer, she is amazing and definitely perfect customer service for all over table players, it was awesome spending times with her who got win or lose whatever. If you want to spend time with great memories with blackjack table at MGM Grand, should be playing with her EunKyung!!!!!!

This hotel is not the average hotel... this is my first time here and everything looks clean except the rotten tangerine stench... but when I first step in the room with my shoes off... the ground feels wet... i dont know if they mopped the carpeted floors or not but it feels like you are stepping on wet bread. Secondly, I was laying on the bed just watching Spider-Man. Suddenly I started itching like crazy... I almost peeled off my skin.. i didn't even spend the night here yet but will never come here again.. the only pro of this hotel is that it has tv. Also the movies are 10 dollars... ridiculous.... spend your money on something more enjoyable :-)Edit:Also we got charged unnecessary charges and the check out won't even work!!!!!!!!!!!!

Unfortunately today its my worst days stay here just we come from California driving and we came  a little tired so we check in and we went to sleep for a while.....so when we wake up tarannn some bite bugs in ours legs

The least smoky place on the strip. Cant say that I stayed here as I was just going to see Ka by CDS but it was a nice casino anyway. I appreciate that they had better ventilation that made it not smoke filled and they even had some arcade games to play. if i came back to vegas i would be more interested in staying here.

I've been staying at the MGM probably 12 times a year for 4 years now. I used to love it but it's really gone downhill recently. The rooms haven't been updated in years, I always book a room in the main wing (not the cheaper west wing) typically runs $250+ per night. The room has no bath robe or slippers, the shower pressure is so bad it's practically useless. My biggest recent annoyance is they've changed their room service policy to a strictly "to go" packaged options. You spend a fortune on the upcharged items (yes they charged me $10 for a banana...) and then they can't even deliver the room service on a table? So you're left to either eat your food on the desk in room staring at the wall or in bed if you actually want to see your tv. Despite the fact that all of these to go containers are bad for the environment and creating more waste. If I'm going to spend $70 on an order of panckakes, the least you can do is deliver them on a glass plate!Don't expect much from this hotel. While others in the area seem to be upgrading and learning how to improve, mgm seems to be taking a step backwards.

First of all let me say I stayed in the MGM Grand Las Vegas about 12 years ago and do not remember the problems to be like the ones I am about to describe. I was there with my Fiance this time as we were getting married there in Vegas. I thought you know it would be nice to get a STAY WELL room as it might make the experience more enjoyable. I was way off thinking this. The room was always hot, granted it was 105 plus daily, but that is no excuse not to be able to cool a room properly, I heard several people on the elevator complaining about this as well. Next thing was the electrical outlets, MGM this is 2019, I should not have to worry about my electronics staying plugged into an outlet all the time. The out lets are old, no plug will stay in them, people these days have Ipads, Tablets, Cell phones and every other device imaginable and want to keep them charged. Seriously invest some money into this problem. Not to mention as I was ironing some clothes the iron plug came out of the outlet every couple of minutes because it was so loose. I think people reading this get my point, very frustrating. So then we come to the laundry service, I put 3 pair pf pants in for the laundry service, the ticket said if I had it ready to go by 930 am I would get it back by 7 pm. I called laundry at 850 am said I had some laundry to pick up, well it was picked up at a little past 10 am. I did not get the laundry back until about 1 the next day and do you know the only reason I got it back then was because I called and asked where was my laundry that I should have had back the night before. So now lets talk about the STAY WELL room, they sure do make it sound like it is a great experience online, a real let down if you ask me. First it says online and I quote "sink water purification filtration" bad news MGM your water smells like sulfur coming out of the bathroom sink when you first turn it on. Then the Amenities goes on to give you this elaborate listing of how amazing everything is in the room. There is no way this room is worth the extra cost for what they say will make your stay more pleasing. MGM food trays with food on it sitting in the hallways 24 plus hours is definitely a no no when it come to cleanliness. Overall a bad experience to be honest I was a little embarrassed in front of my new bride to be as I had her thinking the MGM experience would be the best. Not to mention this was her first time in Vegas. We were planning on coming back and making this a yearly thing, it will not be MGM or any of their properties getting my money again.

Love the MGM. More than anything the staff! I met a most delightful woman named Angela on my way out. I love people who go beyond and above the call of their job! Thanks for being a rainbow in my cloud today Angela!

Beyond disgusting and extremely disappointed by horrible customer serviceWe filled the ice from the ice machine Friday night, the next day we notice the melted ice and the nasty stuff in he water.  Immediately took the ice bucket down to reception as we were shocked!  They took the bucket and sent us back to the room to wait for someone to come talk to us.... forward a week later, Kristen hood from risk management accused us of lying, refuses to tell us what was in the water (they said they would analyze it), or when the last time the machine was cleaned...  no apologies, nothing-  unreal!
F this place...spent 3 hours in here and over $1000 on the tables, not one fucking drink the whole time...called them out on it and got kicked out!!!! F this place!!!

SPEND YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE. We got to Vegas late last night to check in to the MGM. Check in was easy since they have the mobile check in now.Once we get to the counter they inform us that the room we booked was unavailable so they were "upgrading" us. We get to our room and the SMELL IS HORRIBLE. We called the front desk and they told us they didn't have any other rooms open for us. They said they would comp us $40 for food and beverage, take the resort fee off for one night, then told us to call back in the morning to see if we could switch rooms. We call back this morning and they refused to switch us rooms.They sent a housekeeper (who was a sweetheart) to use a deodorizing machine. We came back from the pool and were expecting to not have a smelly room anymore. This was not the case. I get it, staying at any hotel on the strip is a gamble, but I expect to have a clean, non smelly room when we are spending our money here.We will definitely not be coming back to the MGM ever. Horrible customer service and everything is so expensive here.

Stayed in the West Wing King. Would not recommend if your staying more than 2 nights. Room is super small and so is the bathroom with very little privacy. I asked for some type of view, I got a view of a wall. My shower was leaking all over the place. Had to put numerous towels on the floor to soak up the water. They came to fix it but it was still leaking. The safe stopped working after the first day. Had to hike a mile just to get to the west wing, no signage , it was difficult to find. This room was not a pleasant stay.

Came here for the 1st time and I'm a local , I know it's  only a request when you request for certain things , the front desk rep was not friendly at all and she did not accommodate me what so ever. My room was far from the elevator towards the end and also no view at all. Very disappointing at.

Extremely disappointed in the customer service here. Found blood on our sheets when we checked in. After 2 calls to housekeeping and the front desk, 40 min later, housekeeping showed up to strip the bed, but only left a new set and said someone else would be by to make the bed. Another 30 later, we finally did it ourselves.

From the $19 chicken fingers, that don't come with fries, to the cart after cart after wine glass of dirty dishes left in the hallways for over 24 hours, this hotel is by far one of the worst I've ever stayed at.  The pit bosses are rude jerks who make it impossible to have a good time while you're gambling. We went across the street to The Excalibur and spent four hours gambling there and had a great time. I had two terrible interactions with manager Bree and the operations manager who's name I don't remember, who were extremely unsympathetic to my need for a fridge to store my medication. They wanted to charge me $30 per day to rent a mini fridge or $50 to empty the minibar.  What the hell?!?!? I've stayed at at least eight hotels on the strip and I would recommend every single one, over this hotel. Even the Tropicana!! I will say that the shining stars of this hotel are their housekeeping staff. They were extraordinarily friendly and courteous and put a smile on my face with every hall passing. In summary: Overpriced food, rude management, unkempt, and just straight up LAME!!!!! Spend your money elsewhere.AAAAAND...I was just informed that one of my husband's coworker's kid STEPPED IN ACTUAL FECES INSIDE OF THE ACTUAL HOTEL HALLWAY THIS MORNING!!!! Disgusting!!!!There is also NO BUSINESS CENTER and you have to PAY to use the FEDEX Center.THIS IS THE WORST HOTEL IVE EVER STAYED AT IN MY ENTIRE LIFE!!!!! Everyone in management is beyond unhelpful.

We didn't have tv or internet for the entirety of our stay. We notified the front desk of the issue multiple times and they did nothing to resolve the problem. Our door was also broken and wouldn't close. The hotel was aware of the problem and made no effort to fix it.

Hey I'm not reviewing the casino im just reviewing the impeccable service of DJ SCOOBIE. And the security, garage attendants. RALPH and His coworker on 8/29/19.  I was in a little incident and they really did help me out very much

Love the MGM.  Loved it @40 years ago too.  The show we saw there had plenty of room between the seat in front to stretch my short leg out since I'm a senior and that's what some seniors have to do.  I have a bad knee!  We did not stay there so I can't comment on the hotel itself but when I did stay there about 40 years ago it was great
Great weekend at the MGM.  From check in to check out, their staff was very helpful and nice. Room was clean and we had a great view of the south strip!  I highly recommend

Stuck in the 60s motel?All the points below relate to a room in the west wing specifically;  First the closet rack provides barely enough clearance vertically to hang a jacket off the ground, if you have a coat or needed to hang a dress, part of it would be on the ground for sure.  There was also not enough space to hang more that 4 or 5 items as a room safe was placed in the same area taking up hanging space.  The shower dripped all day and the shower floor pooled water in a section of the floor for my entire stay.  The sink was not clean and was heavily chipped in certain spots not hiding it's age very well.  The placement of the bed in the room, no doubt to hide the fact that it is an extremely narrow room with Queen not King bed, prevented window access and the auto shade buttons did not work.  No modern conveniences like a mini fridge or single cup coffee maker either.  There was a large mirror in the walkway leading to my room as well as several floor to ceiling mirrors, six in total, contributing greatly to a dated 60-ish or 70-ish vibe.  The pools were a nice way to enjoy some sun and there are a few notable restaurants from Morimoto, Joël Robuchon, Emeril Lagasse, and Tom Colicchio in the building.  The MGM staff including the room cleaning crew were friendly and responsive when asked.  Baggage check held my bags securely for for a few hours after checkout with gratuity on both ends. I was informed that some rooms in the upper west wing were renovated, so maybe it's just the lower level west wing rooms with a dire need to renovate.  If I stayed here again, I'd want to make sure the lower level west wing was not offered to me again.

The place is ehhhhhh. But they really rip you off with the resort fee. 45$ for shit that doesn't work properly. Crappy AC in the room. Can't even hold a temperature. WIFI that is a pile of shit. And TV that doesn't work properly at all. We had a Grand room and it wasn't all that grand. One of the lights in the room didn't work. The shower took foreverrrrrrr to even get close to warm. And didn't even really get hot. Food prices are amazing. It's like being at a football game and everything is over priced. PLUSSSSSSS........ they wanted to charge us an extra 40$ to have a late check out. WTF.... now I think I remember what drove me out of spending time in Vegas even when we are only a few hours away. ‍

The communication at this hotel is awful. Different stories from different employees. Especially at the pool. Reserve chairs. Is ridiculous. They need to explain thoroughly what you get what you don't get. We called to reserve chairs the day before. Turns out you could go down to the pool and pick out the one you want and then you don't have to come in the morning to wait in line Etc

This hotel is a joke. I've been to Vegas numerous times. And never had such a bad experience with a hotel. First they stick us in a different room other then what I payed for because they are over booked. Which I had no idea of until I got to the room. "Supposedly a upgrade of what the told me on the phone " I wanted a grand king room and I get stuck with 2 queen beds and a shitty view. I called to ask why this is a upgrade. They  said it was furniture features. The 80s low grade furniture and having a queen room was a update. If I wanted a different room to call tomorrow during check out. So we have our room for one night, I go to take a shower this morning and there's someone's black pubes all over I'm beyond disgusted at this point , I call down stairs, still no room, they can put us in the same room I didn't want on a different floor. So basically I'm in a dirty room I didn't ask for and the best they can do is have me keep calling  until the room I booked is a available. Thanks MGM you have really let this place go.

This is probably the worst hotel I've stayed in in Vegas.1. Some elevator buttons don't work. Swipe your card, nothing happens. Scratch your head, try again five times without luck, then try the other side of the elevator where it magically works right away. Really?!2. There is no reading light or bright light at the bedside. Just one covered, dim, yellow lamp in the middle, which is nowhere near enough to read a book with.3. There's a small fridge in the room, but it's filled with overpriced junk and a sticker on it that if you place anything else inside the fridge, there's a $50 restocking fee. Really?! So I can't even put in my own items?!4. Everything is a mile from everything else. Want to go to the pool? Want to go to the fitness center? Enjoy the 10-minute walk.5. Elevators are too cramped and too few. OK, so you got your room on the 22nd or whatever floor. Good luck finding an elevator going down that isn't already packed like a can of sardines.6. When I entered the room, there were four glasses made of glass. Two in the room, and two in the bathroom. I used one to drink from. After the very first room service, they'd all been replaced with plastic cups. So much for saving the environment huh?!7. There's the usual "save the planet" paper in the bathroom asking you to re-use towels, or place them on the floor to be replaced. So why do they replace my towel when it's hanging up?!8. Room service. Terrible. I work from the room from 8-10 AM and put up the "do not disturb" sign. Then I get lunch and go out for 3 hours. I come back, and the room is not clean. I leave again for 2 hours, and come back to a room that's STILL unmade. The next day, I leave my room at 9:30 AM and they're doing the room next to mine so I figure my room will be cleaned too. I come back 3 hours later, and all the carts are gone, but my room is still dirty. What the heck?! Really?!Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. Everything else I've been to on the strip is ten times as good as this place.

People stay away from this resort or expect so many insane charges.  For example $10/package to leave something at the FedEx desk with a all ready pre-paid shipping label...no joke.  And $24 for being 10 mins getting the car from valet (photo of receipt).  $15/day for self park...what happened to free parking in Vegas??? Venetian has free parking and Cosmo lets you drop UPS at the front desk for free.  Rooms are dated, which is crap for $1600/5 nights.  The pool may be amazing but not coming back here.

This hotel is very costly and does not have refrigerator, coffee maker, nor a microwave!! I was upset that there is no way of preserving or warming up food. The prices for food and beverages are unreasonable!!!

By far the worst last Vegas hotel I have ever stayed at. The terrible experience started with the initial booking. I called to book 6 rooms with them...it took over an hour and a half on the phone because the "system" wasn't working. The rep also told me that she had to put each room under a separate reservation. However she confirms they were all the same price and would be under my name. Well I get to check in and I find out some of he rooms are not registered under my name and are actually more expensive!!! As an apology for the inconvenience, the front desk game me $150 food and beverage  split among the 6 rooms. Well...that didn't actually happen and what's worse is when the other in my group tried to charge to the room, they weren't allowed to because their names were not on the room even though I added them at check in. The buffet is absolutely disgusting and made some of us sick. And to top it all off...valet charged us $24 a night!! DO NOT say at this hotel. It will make you regret taking a Vegas trip.

Never again will I stay here front desk is so rude when ask for a MGR would not come to the phone says the rep that ans the phone this morning was asking for a courtesy checkout just till noon the rep that ans said no then ask for MGR would not come to the phone then the rep says I'm calling Housekeeping to make shur I was out and then hung up
location: South Montebello, East Los Angeles, CA

review_text: Middle of the road resort for Vegas. The room we stayed in was a bargain and the quality reflected the price. Very small, no bathtub, tiny window, one queen bed, and just a weird layout. Their casino floor and shops are pretty good. Their pool is the only reason we gave it a shot. I would recommend their lazy river to anyone. We've tried Mandalay Bay's and felt MGM had them beat in this area. Idk if I would stay here again but didn't have a bad time.

MGM grand's customer service is actual crap. When you login to their wifi, it shows there's a $50 credit that you can use towards breakfast and buffet. It's obviously very clear, as it literally says, "enjoy complimentary breakfast or lunch." When we went to the buffet place, we confirmed TWICE with the guy there that it was okay to use the credit, and he told us it was okay. He also said that the $50 will be charged to your bill and when we check out we get our credit back. However, when we went to the front desk to check out, we were met with cold attitude and not one, not two, but 3 charges of $50 from the buffet. Obviously, as a customer, this made us extremely confused and to be quite frank, pretty upset we were going to pay $150 of something that should've been complimentary. The lady called us the manager, and I have to say, with all due respect, that I did not like his attitude one bit. His main point being they couldn't waive the fee for us and that it was OUR FAULT we confirmed with the buffet, not the front desk, as apparently the buffet does not have access to the information of your stay. Obviously this is a miscommunication between their hotel, as we pointed out to the manager, but he ASSURED us that it was our miscommunication with the hotel. Through our minutes of talking back and forth, the only solution we got was to have one of the $50's waived. The thing that makes me the most upset is not that I had to pay what the hotel should've covered, per their own website, which i will link below, but their attitude was overbearing and it looked like they just wanted to place all the blame on the customer. Frankly, this is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, in terms of attitude and customer service. If you go to any other hotel this would never ever happen. I am so disappointed, and to have this happen on the last day of your visit really ruins your whole mood/trip. If you're thinking about going to this hotel, I would 100% suggest look elsewhere for a better deal and better customer service, which obviously MGM Grand lacks. I've never been more upset and disappointed in my various stays at various different hotels. Look anywhere else and you'll find a hotel with better customer service than MGM grand.

If I could Zero stars I would. Me and my Husband drove out late on a Friday night. We booked several months in advance for the west king room. After waiting in the check in line for over an hour apparently the mobile check in was down. The girl checking us in was rude as hell. She walked to the back to speak with a supervisor to "check" on our room. She comes back and says she upgraded our room to the wellness wing...catch is there's two queen beds. This is not what we paid for. She brought out a manager who then we could tell was that there was a flood in the wing where our other room was and that no reservations are for sure. You put a "request" in for bed size if that was so understandable but why not say that on their booking site.. the room after-all was specifically called the West King room with a king sized bed it did not say may or may not get .. what a joke ! After a long drive and these ladies at the front desk testing our patience we accept the room with the two queens for the night. Got to our room... are you kidding me ! The beds were so small and hard as bricks had we had known this we would have stayed at a motel. Thank you MGM Grand for a terrible experience your staff is rude. Will Never stay here again! If coming to visit Don't be fooled by the Luxury on the exterior because our room was nothing of the sort.

Stayed here 2 years ago and knew to request a room in the Grand Tower because I don't want to stay in the "West Wing".  Now I realize that they have mobile check in which is great and you can check in before you arrive to Vegas!  Once we got here, we went to the left side of the lobby where you can pick up your room key cards at the mobile check in and bypass that long check in line!  So convenient!It's summer time and MGM is crowded as I went to the fitness center and it was crowded so go before 9:30 am!  The fitness center is located inside the spa/salon.  Nothing has changed in the fitness center, but I would suggest that they provide wet wipes so we can wipe down the equipment before and after we use itThe rooms in the Grand Tower look exactly the same from two years ago but that is ok since the West Wing probably hasn't changed either!  The only other thing that I noticed was that when you get on the elevator, you have to swipe your room key card to get to your floor and then press your floor button.

What hotel DOESN'T include a refrigerator, microwave, and coffeemaker in the room? MGM GRAND in Las Vegas, that's who. This is the worst, cheapest (and I don't mean the cost of the room), and overall worst hotel I've had the displeasure of staying at. The pool area is disgustingly filthy. Empty beer cans, aluminum beer bottles, and plastic cups litter the grounds. Virtually all of the lounge chairs have towels thrown on them, although those parties may have left hours ago. The staff doesn't go through and pick up abandoned towels, so there is rarely a place to lay. This place is all about them making money and giving very little attention to their customers. Tomorrow is check out, and I will neither spend another dollar nor step into the MGM GRAND in Las Vegas. Bally's, Belagio, and even West Gate offers way more than this dump. Stay away if you don't want to be disappointed.

Less than 24hrs after my arrival and after my first night sleep in what I expected to be a clean highly reputable hotel I woke up to bites all across my stomach arms and neck. I didnt think much of the bites at first as I was just scratching away unconsciously, a day later I developed a rash and still didn't think it was my room. Every morning I woke up to more red marks on my body that within 24hrs turned into a highly itchy rash.I contacted management, took them an entire day to call me back with no real apology or concern. I rushed to a local urgent care facility and they said it's very common to get bed bugs, fungal or even poison ivy exposure through the hotels as people pass in and out of the rooms with very minimal cleaning. Management brought in some third party company to test the room and called me back saying test results were negative. They didn't show me the report, didn't offer any reimbursememt, apologize or take any responsibility.. I even went as far as to ask them to take pictures of my rash or look at pictures that I took but they refused.Meanwhile this rash has spread across my body and I'm sure I'm not the first

After my second stay here, I want to say this hotel is just AWFUL! The service is just terrible.  They really do not want to clean your room no matter how many times you call and this angers me because we're paying a resort fee every night!! ALSO When I checked into my room I saw a long piece of hair under the pillow. Gross

This buy far he worst hotel I have ever been too. Not sure I'm staying $450 online. Then another 167 at checkin. Not incidentals "resort"  total fo over $550 and then they thy to up sell us to stay in a real room. And when you don't bite they put you in a room 4 blocks away. And is an absolutely awful room.

Love this place. Great room. Easy check in. Friendly staff. My M Life status was upgraded automatically when they noticed I was a Veteran. It gave me free self parking. Nice touch. Cannot wait to go back. Highly recommend.

This was the absolute WORST most EXPENSIVE hotel to stay in.  Our toilet flushed itself all day every day for an entire week in our room! The air conditioning doesn't work in nearly any of the rooms even if it says it's on you are still dying of heat.  The customer service is absolutelyappalling.  We needed help with our luggage and they would not give us a cart to get it to and from our room.  $50 for a plate of chicken tenders room service.  The security was absolutely the rudest.  Yelling to get out of the way and keep moving when I PAY to stand where I want to!!!!!!!!!  I want a full refund we were NOT treated as guests and the assistant just came up with a cart to get our luggage but they wouldn't give us our own cart.  I am not a happy customer I DO NOT recommend this hotel

Not the Vegas I use to know... or Mgm grand atleast very disappointing. Stayed here, had a stay well room... no difference shown, I still woke up exhausted. Aside from that I hold a gold tier card within the past year and the VIP rewards desk are just terrible. You basically answer your own question. Need new staff or something. And the room extremely outdated.

We were in attendance for the Paparazzi convention and this was the worst hotel and hospitality I have ever encountered. The check in process was a disaster and then we had to wait over an hour to get our bags. In route to an from function rooms the security and ppl that were directing traffic were out right rude and totally unprofessional. They didn't have a clue to what was going on, sending us in circles and giving wrong information. We also had to call housekeeping every evening when we returned to our rooms due to getting no service. The housekeeper supervisor attempted to make it right by giving us a voucher stating the 4 of us could have $25 comp on drinks. We try to use them in places to find out if the ppl lease a space they are not part of MGM and the voucher was no good there, so we find a MGM bar order one drink each and when we go to order the second drink was told no this is only good for one drink per person. When we went into the Garden Arena for our functions it was so disorganized and we experienced the most rudest ushers I have ever seen. We did speak with a supervisor and reported specific situations. I have never been to a company convention that has paid good $$ for ur business to host them and been made to feel like a herd of cattle. There were a couple of ladies that greeted u at the door over those 4 days that were pleasant but that was it. This was the worst hospitality I have experienced in all my years in business. How can u be a high end convention hotel and only have a refrigerator full of expensive items with not room for a customer that is staying 3-4 days at a time and can't keep any of ur own perishable items. How can u have a bathroom with no exhaust fan??? No microwave no coffee maker. The only good thing during this convention was the love, support that was put on by Paparazzi, the MGM contributed nothing good to our experience. If we could give 0 stars we would have. So disappointed we this so call great hotel/casino in Las Vegas

What a disappointment. This was our first trip to Las Vegas and was hoping for a great experience but didnt receive that from our hotel stay. Room was very ran down which I can let slide a little due to the amount of guests you receive (but still no excuse) but the 5 nights of no solid sleep due to the how horrible the bed was is unacceptable. My wife's back and mine are completely messed up and when told at check out I got a unsincere "I'm sorry".  For a main hotel on the strip I wasn't impressed at all. Looking forward to go home and see the chiropractor and get some sleep.

Our reservation was for the Signature.  Our flight from London was 2.5 hrs late, so  we got in at 9:30 PM.  Stood in line to check in at Signature for 20 min only to find they had cancelled our reservation and moved us to MGM Grand.  Another taxi,(they paid).  Stood in line for 45 min to check in to the Grand, we finally got to our room about 11:45 PM. We did get a$50 credit for room service.  We left the next AM at 9:00 to fly home.  Will go elsewhere next time.

MGM Grand isn't that...grand. It's expensive. They have that part right. Hotel is overpriced and so are the bars. Sports book is cool and so is the casino. I have never stayed here and probably never will. It just doesn't seem worth what it should be. They nickel and dime you for everything. People like coming here to see the shows, which is about the only good reason except for the casino. The casino is pretty okay. It's not much different than at any of the other mega resorts except for the large sports book. There's an entry just for this. The hotel is showing its age. A lot come just for the casino. The games aren't that good and you can go somewhere else and have much cheaper fun.

MGM was much better the way I remembered it back then, although I'm not sure what it was that made it so good. I've slept a few nights there around last summer and the check-in area was, to be honest, pretty damn dope. There were music videos such as Taylor Swift and Michael Jackson on a huge-ass screen on the wall of the check-in. However, the casino I can't exactly remember what it looked like. The worst part of it is and this is for most hotels, the air is just polluted with a shit ton of vape and cigarette smoke.Now about restaurants. There's a make-your-own-pizza place there which no matter how you design it, it tastes hella good. There's also a buffet called "Grand Buffet" which totally makes sense because it's in MGM "Grand" and also it kinda feels like your in that rich-ass place from "Star Wars" - The Last Jedi". But honestly, there's straight out nothing to eat except for several melon slices as well as a couple sushi rolls.The hotels are pretty awesome from the fact that it almost looks like an apartment or even an upstairs floor of a house. There's a lot of space in these hotel rooms so you can do what you want as long you don't make too much noise, I guess. Lastly, I wanna talk about the performers and famous peeps. First off, David Copperfield, I mean rarely anyone there talks about him nor does he have any shows going on, however there's a gigantic picture of the rich-ass dude so where the hell is this guy at?! Another group I wanna bring up here are the Jabawockeez. I mean, they were so much better and even more hilarious in Monte Carlo, however as they moved here to MGM, they're just total shit. I guess it's 'cause the stage is so damn small as well as not that many people this time up on stage.

This has been the worst experience for a paparazzi convention. Sad that a hotel this size can have so many issues the 1st night we had no AC and repair people had to come to our room at 2am. Mold in the bathroom and then no hot water. Today our room was moved at 5 which took 3 hours and the staff made the bed with dirty water bottle in the bed. No one cares there Zack at the front desk was rude and would not understand we are here for a convention. We missed the gala since the room was not ready room was dirty it's supposed to be hyper allergic and there not mold dirt it's nasty to think MGM has a front desk staff Zack treat guest like this I am in the marketing field for hotel management and this is no way for hotel guest to be treated like this. Jason from repair department is wonderful. Other than that would never recommend or stay here again plus we will make sure all paparazzi associates are aware to never book at MGM which is 1,000 of people!!!

Everything you want is at this place.   Not sure it needs a full review being that there are other hotels like this one around.  This place is cool tho...hosting some of the hottest shows.  The pool is like 5 acres big.  Definitely worth a stay.  The room is nice and spacious.  I got a room over looking the airport runway and that's cool.  You won't be disappointed.

Checked in  today at the MGM Kayley was amazing she saw me with my kids showed the most amazing hospitality saw that I was struggling a bit she decided to  helped check me in seamlessly,her computer started acting glitchy so Natalya came to to assist it was the the best team effort I've seen in awhile, I even offerd kaley a tip witch she responded no thanks I want you to enjoy that with your kids what and angel this world needs more kayley's she made me and my family feel so special like a vip what an amazing person she is thank you sos much kayley your the bomb.com we love you
